original: brtson 'grus brtan po'i go bgos pas yang dag par rtsom pa brtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtan po'i go bgos pas yang dag par rtsom pa brtan par 'gyur te /
translated: And by donning the armor of steadfast diligence, one's correct exertions become steadfast.

original: ma byas par bar du phyir mi ldog par ro //
analyzed: ma byas par bar du phyir mi ldog par ro //
translated: The armor of firm effort is the firm undertaking of the perfections, because one does not turn back in the middle without having completed them.

original: mthu'i le'u las sbyin pa'i chos kyi mthu bstan pa gang yin pa de ni lag rkyong pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: mthu'i le'u las sbyin pa'i chos kyi mthu bstan pa gang yin pa de ni lag rkyong pa'i phan yon no //
translated: The benefits of openhandedness are the powers of giving taught in the chapter on power.

original: shes rab kyi chos kyi mthu bstan pa gang yin pa de ni don dang dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i phan yon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi chos kyi mthu bstan pa gang yin pa de ni don dang dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa'i phan yon bstan pa yin no //
translated: The benefits of explaining the profound meaning and intention are the powers of wisdom taught in the chapter on power.

original: go rims kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: go rims kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: In terms of their sequence, he says:

original: de dag gi go rims gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: de dag gi go rims gang yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: What is their sequence?

original: bya ba thams cad la bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang por bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes snying brtse ba bstan to //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad la bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir dang por bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa yin no zhes snying brtse ba bstan to //
translated: He shows compassion first, because intention precedes all action.

original: de dag ni sems can la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sems can la ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are associated with concern for sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i don byed par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bas mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs nas dge ba la 'god par bya ba'i phyir de nas snyan par smra ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i don byed par 'dod pa yin no zhes bya bas mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs nas dge ba la 'god par bya ba'i phyir de nas snyan par smra ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, he is one who speaks pleasantly in order to lift them out of the nonvirtuous states and establish them in the virtuous ones.

original: rigs par smra zhing zhes bya bas ni yi ges so //
analyzed: rigs par smra zhing zhes bya bas ni yi ges so //
translated: He speaks appropriately means by means of the words.

original: 'dzin du 'jug pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'dzin du 'jug pa ni don ji lta ba bzhin du'o //
translated: He causes them to take up means in accordance with the meaning.

original: ston par byed pa ni de gnyi ga khyad par du 'phags @257a * //
analyzed: ston par byed pa ni de gnyi ga khyad par du 'phags @257a * //
translated: He teaches means both of those in an exalted manner.

original: pa'o ; / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / sems can zhugs pa rnams log par sgrub ba la mi mjed pas de dag mi spod pa ni brtan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yang dag par bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / sems can zhugs pa rnams log par sgrub ba la mi mjed pas de dag mi spod pa ni brtan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is one who is steadfast because he does not abandon those who are properly engaged in the practice, even though they may be hostile toward him.

original: de lta bu'i brtan pa dang ldan pas zang zing dang chos kyis rjes su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni phyi ma gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i brtan pa dang ldan pas zang zing dang chos kyis rjes su 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni phyi ma gnyis kyis so //
translated: He is one who is steadfast in this way and he supports them with material things and the Dharma means by means of the latter two.

original: rtags de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rtags de dag gis pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that those signs are included in the perfections, he says:

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags lnga po de dag gi go rims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i rtags lnga po de dag gi go rims zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: These are the five signs of the bodhisattva.

original: snying brtse ba ni sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad med pa bzhi'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying brtse ba ni sems can la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa yin pa'i phyir dang / tshad med pa bzhi'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Compassion is the intention to benefit and bring happiness to sentient beings, and it is included in the four immeasurables.

original: tshad med pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir des bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i khongs su gtogs pa nyid kyi phyir des bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The immeasurables are included in the perfection of meditative absorption.

original: 'byor pa thob pa'i sems can rnams la de lta de ltar don bsgrub pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims su bsdu bar 'dod do //
analyzed: 'byor pa thob pa'i sems can rnams la de lta de ltar don bsgrub pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims su bsdu bar 'dod do //
translated: The accomplishment of the aims of sentient beings in accordance with the attainment of the perfections is included in the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: phan par byed pa'i ngag rigs pa ston pa'i mtshan nyid can ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus so //
analyzed: phan par byed pa'i ngag rigs pa ston pa'i mtshan nyid can ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas bsdus so //
translated: Speech that is helpful and characterized by the teaching of what is correct is included in the perfection of wisdom.

original: brtan pa ni snying stobs kyi ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: brtan pa ni snying stobs kyi ngo bo yin la /
translated: Steadfastness is the essence of courage.

original: snying stobs kyang brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid yin pas des bsdus so //
analyzed: snying stobs kyang brtson 'grus kyi bdag nyid yin pas des bsdus so //
translated: and courage is also the nature of effort, so it is included in that.

original: brtan par gyur na sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pas mi mjed pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: brtan par gyur na sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pas mi mjed pa'i phyir bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin no //
translated: When one becomes stable, one has the perfection of patience, because one is not perturbed by the perverse actions of sentient beings.

original: de bzhin du so sor rtog pa mang bar 'gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du so sor rtog pa mang bar 'gyur bas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin no //
translated: Similarly, one has the perfection of wisdom, because one has much discernment.

original: yang shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / snying rje rnams ni snying stobs kyi bdag nyid do zhes bstan pas de'i phyir snying stobs kyi bdag nyid can gyi brten pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: yang shes rab dang / brtson 'grus dang / snying rje rnams ni snying stobs kyi bdag nyid do zhes bstan pas de'i phyir snying stobs kyi bdag nyid can gyi brten pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum gyis bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is taught that wisdom, effort, and compassion are the nature of courage. Therefore, courage, which is the nature of courage, is included in the three perfections.

original: lag rkyong ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa kho nas bsdus zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lag rkyong ba ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa kho nas bsdus zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Openhandedness is included in the perfection of generosity alone.

original: gcig tu sbyin pa'i ngo bos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu sbyin pa'i ngo bos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the nature of generosity alone.

original: don dang dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
analyzed: don dang dgongs pa zab mo nges par 'grel pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa'i ngo bo yin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the essence of the analytical knowledges because it definitely elucidates the profound meaning and intention.

original: ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi ngo bo yin pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the essence of the perfection of meditative concentration because it is the essence of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi dang mthun pa'i rnal 'byor gyi @257b gnas las rtags kyi le'u ste dang po'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / de ltar rtags rnams 'byung ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs sam /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi dang mthun pa'i rnal 'byor gyi @257b gnas las rtags kyi le'u ste dang po'i 'grel pa rdzogs so / // / de ltar rtags rnams 'byung ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs sam /
translated: This completes the commentary on the first chapter, having signs, in the Bodhisattva section of the Bodhisattva Grounds, which is called ‚ÄúThe Yoga of the Basis.‚Äù

original: rab tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the arising of the signs is in the context of being a layperson orüîΩa monastic,

original: de'i rjes la phyogs bstan to //
analyzed: de'i rjes la phyogs bstan to //
translated: the next topic is the presentation of the two contexts.

original: phyogs de gnyi ga la gnas pa yang cha byad tsam gtso bo ma yin gyi /
analyzed: phyogs de gnyi ga la gnas pa yang cha byad tsam gtso bo ma yin gyi /
translated: In both of these contexts, it is not just the mere costume that is primary,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos gtso bor gyur pas byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos gtso bor gyur pas byang chub sems dpa'i grangs su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but rather it is the bodhisattva qualities that are primary, and so one comes to be counted as a bodhisattva.

original: phyogs gnyi gar gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang rjes su mthun pa byang chub dang shin tu nye par 'jug pa'i chos bzhi bstan pa ni khyim pa'am rab tu byung bas bslabs na myur ba kho nar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar gtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa dang rjes su mthun pa byang chub dang shin tu nye par 'jug pa'i chos bzhi bstan pa ni khyim pa'am rab tu byung bas bslabs na myur ba kho nar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The four qualities that are in accord with the training of the bodhisattvas who belong to both groups and that lead to the near attainment of enlightenment are taught in the verse beginning, ‚ÄúThe one who is skilled in the means of training in the perfections, who is well-established in the practice of the bodhisattva, who is skilled in the methods of guiding beings, and who is intent on enlightenment for the benefit of the world.‚Äù

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la yang dag par sbyor ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to the correct practice of the six perfections,

original: las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las kyi mtha' legs par byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he is well-established in the practice of the bodhisattva.üîΩWith reference to the control of the senses, etc.,

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gdul bya'i dbang du byas nas ni mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can gdul bya'i dbang du byas nas ni mkhas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: he is skilled in the methods of guiding beings.üîΩWith reference to the ripening of beings,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o //üîΩrnam par smin pa dang lan la re ba med pa'i phyir byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas ni gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'o // rnam par smin pa dang lan la re ba med pa'i phyir byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //
translated: he is intent on enlightenment for the benefit of the world.

original: las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa bzhi bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' legs par byed pa bzhi bstan par bya ste /
translated: The four kinds of good works should be mentioned.

original: gcig tu nges par sbyor bar byed pa ni nges par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par sbyor bar byed pa ni nges par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The application of certainty is the very act of certainty.

original: gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni byang bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba ni byang bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: The application of respect is the very act of purification.

original: rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid ni rtag tu byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor bar byed pa nyid ni rtag tu byed pa nyid do //
translated: The application of constant practice is the very act of constant practice.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni kha na mtho ba med par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni kha na mtho ba med par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The application of non-affliction is the very act of non-affliction.

original: gzhan dag gis bkag tu zin kyang gzhan gyi tshig mi nyan par nges par 'ga' zhig la ci zhig sbyin par 'dod pa ni nges par byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bkag tu zin kyang gzhan gyi tshig mi nyan par nges par 'ga' zhig la ci zhig sbyin par 'dod pa ni nges par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Even when others try to stop him, he does not listen to their words, but is certain to give to some person whatever he desires.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i bar du gcod par nus pa ni sems can gyi ris na 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i bar du gcod par nus pa ni sems can gyi ris na 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that there is no one in the realm of sentient beings who is able to obstruct the bodhisattva's generosity, he says:

original: slong ba po yang legs par 'ongs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba po yang legs par 'ongs na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Even if the petitioner comes in an improper manner, etc.

original: dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba na gus par byed pas de'i phyir byad bar byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba na gus par byed pas de'i phyir byad bar byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When he gives away all his possessions, he does so with respect. Therefore, he is called the ‚Äúone who acts respectfully.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus,üîΩhe gives gifts that are pure,

original: sbyin par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩyongs su skyo ba med par zhes bya ba ni phongs par @258a * //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // yongs su skyo ba med par zhes bya ba ni phongs par @258a * //
translated: and so on.

original: gyur kyang ngo //
analyzed: gyur kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout being discouraged‚Äù means even when he is in a state of poverty.

original: phangs pa med par sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phangs pa med par sbyin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni rtag tu byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe gives gifts without holding anything back‚Äù means he always gives.

original: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsngags pa bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The praise of generosity is taught.üîΩOne should understand morality and so on in the same way, as appropriate.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan la /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa la yang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs thams cad du yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan la /
translated: Even in all circumstances, he overwhelms the opposing factors.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'jug pa'i sems la sus kyang bar du bcad cing bskyod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'jug pa'i sems la sus kyang bar du bcad cing bskyod par mi nus so zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: After he has taken up morality, no one can interrupt or disturb his mind that is engaged in giving.

original: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / rig pa'i gnas la mkhas pa dang ; tshul khrims brtag pa la mkhas pa dang / phyi ma'i 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas mkhas pa rnam pa bcur gzhag go //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad du sems can 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / rig pa'i gnas la mkhas pa dang ; tshul khrims brtag pa la mkhas pa dang / phyi ma'i 'dod pa'i don bsgrub pa la mkhas pa dang / theg pa la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas mkhas pa rnam pa bcur gzhag go //
translated: In all situations, one is skilled in training sentient beings, skilled in the sciences, skilled in examining morality, skilled in accomplishing the aims of future desires, and skilled in the vehicles.

original: mkhas pa 'di dag ni gnas ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'i zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: mkhas pa 'di dag ni gnas ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya'i zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: These ten skills are posited in terms of skill in the vehicles.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: These and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad ni bya ba lngar bsdus pas bya ba lnga zhig bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad ni bya ba lngar bsdus pas bya ba lnga zhig bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: Since all the activities of bodhisattvas are included in five activities, one should do the five activities.

original: mkhas pa gong ma bzhis ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhas pa gong ma bzhis ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The four higher skills.

original: dang po sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: dang po sems can yongs su smin par byed pa la mkhas pa ni /
translated: The first, skill in ripening sentient beings,

original: rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams kyi don sgrub par byed do zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis sems can rnams kyi don sgrub par byed do zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: accomplishes the aims of sentient beings by four aspects.

original: sems can rnams rang gi don la 'dzud do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams rang gi don la 'dzud do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He engages sentient beings in their own aim.

original: lnga pas ni bstan bcos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa thob pas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod par byed do //
analyzed: lnga pas ni bstan bcos thams cad la mi 'jigs pa thob pas phas kyi rgol ba thams cad tshar gcod par byed do //
translated: By the fifth, he attains fearlessness in all the treatises, and so he can defeat all adversaries.

original: drug pas ni tshul khrims rnam par dag par byed do //
analyzed: drug pas ni tshul khrims rnam par dag par byed do //
translated: By the sixth, he purifies morality.

original: bdun pas ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: bdun pas ni 'dod pa'i don sgrub par byed do //
translated: By the seventh, he accomplishes the aims he desires.

original: phyi ma gsum gyis ni rigs pa sogs pa'i dbang gis chos ston par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi ma gsum gyis ni rigs pa sogs pa'i dbang gis chos ston par nus pa yin te /
translated: By the last three, he is able to teach the Dharma by means of reasoning and so forth.

original: de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba thams cad byed par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus he demonstrates that he can perform all the activities of a bodhisattva.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúAll activities are completed.‚Äù

original: bya ba thams cad kyis don gnyis sgrub par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba thams cad kyis don gnyis sgrub par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he demonstrates that he accomplishes the two aims by means of all the activities.

original: tshe 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this life‚Äù and so forth.

original: phan pa dang bde ba dag gis bsdus pa dang mthun pas bsdus pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbsdu ba'i @258b dngos po bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: phan pa dang bde ba dag gis bsdus pa dang mthun pas bsdus pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / bsdu ba'i @258b dngos po bzhi po zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase by means of the four principles for attracting a following indicates that the bodhisattva attracts beings by means of the four principles for attracting a following, which are generosity, agreeable speech, beneficent conduct, and sameness of purpose.üîΩThe phrase by means of the four principles for attracting a following indicates that the bodhisattva attracts beings by means of the four principles for attracting a following, which are generosity, agreeable speech, beneficent conduct, and sameness of purpose.

original: de dag las phan pa dang bde ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las bstan pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩ'di lta ste bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las phan pa dang bde ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las bstan pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / 'di lta ste bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi le'u las rig par bya'o //

original: sgo gsum po 'di dag ces bya ba ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi sgo nas dang / mkhas pa'i sgo nas dang / phan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩsnying thag pa nas zhes bya ba ni chen por gyur pas so //üîΩde lta bu'i smon lam rnam par spang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis yongs su dgos pa yin no //
analyzed: sgo gsum po 'di dag ces bya ba ni legs par byas pa'i las kyi sgo nas dang / mkhas pa'i sgo nas dang / phan 'dogs pa'i sgo nas so zhes bstan pa yin no //üîΩsnying thag pa nas zhes bya ba ni chen por gyur pas so //üîΩde lta bu'i smon lam rnam par spang ba'i phyir yongs su bsngo ba'i khyad par gyis yongs su dgos pa yin no //
translated: The phrase by means of the four principles for attracting a following indicates that the bodhisattva attracts beings by means of the four principles for attracting a following, which are generosity, agreeable speech, beneficent conduct, and sameness of purpose.üîΩThe

original: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa rnams kyi bsla ba pa'i lam ni drag shus can gyis zhus pa'i mdo las bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa rnams kyi bsla ba pa'i lam ni drag shus can gyis zhus pa'i mdo las bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path of training for the bodhisattva who is a householder is taught in the Sutra Requested by Ugra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni mdo gzhan dag las bstan pa bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni mdo gzhan dag las bstan pa bzhin te /
translated: The path of training for the bodhisattva who is a renunciant is taught in other sutras.

original: mdor bsdu na bzhi po 'di dag tu thams cad bsdu bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bzhi po 'di dag tu thams cad bsdu bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In brief, it should be understood that all of these are included in these four.

original: 'di ltar 'thob par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'thob par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, it is said that ‚Äúin this way, one attains enlightenment.‚Äù

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bsdus par gtogs pa 'bad pa med pa byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir yon tan gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi cha byad ni ma yin no zhes yongs su gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa bsdus par gtogs pa 'bad pa med pa byang chub 'thob pa'i phyir yon tan gtso bor gyur pa yin gyi cha byad ni ma yin no zhes yongs su gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, it is clearly taught that the qualities are primary for attaining enlightenment without effort, which is included in the bodhisattva‚Äôs training, and not the mere form.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thun mong du mtshon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thun mong du mtshon pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to illustrate the commonality of all bodhisattvas,

original: gang su yang rung ba de thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang su yang rung ba de thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: it is said that ‚Äúany bodhisattva whatsoever.‚Äù

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag la ni byang chub sems dpa'i khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba thams cad kyis kyang khyad par med par bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag la ni byang chub sems dpa'i khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba thams cad kyis kyang khyad par med par bslab par bya'o //
translated: These four dharmas should be practiced by all bodhisattvas, lay and ordained, without distinction.

original: gzhan dag la ni khyad par yod do zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni khyad par yod do zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: But there is a distinction for others.

original: sbyor du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyor du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Even though they are engaged, etc.

original: gzhan du na khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba dag khyad par med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that there would be no difference between lay and ordained bodhisattvas.

original: de ltar gyur na ni rab tu byung ba yang don med par tha la bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na ni rab tu byung ba yang don med par tha la bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then ordination would be pointless.

original: khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par rnam par gzhag par bya ste //üîΩyongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa med par bstan pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa lngas khyad par rnam par gzhag par bya ste // yongs su 'dzin pa'i nyes pa med par bstan pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The distinction is established by five aspects.

original: yongs su grol ba yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grol ba yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the absence of the fault of possession is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover, they are not possessed of anything.‚Äù

original: yongs su ngal ba'i skyon med par bstan pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba'i skyon med par bstan pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The teaching of the absence of the fault of weariness is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúFor what reason?‚Äù

original: sdug bsngal ba @259a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba @259a * //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are not weary of suffering.‚Äù

original: rnams las yongs su grol pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnams las yongs su grol pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and is completely liberated from all of them.

original: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni khyim pa rnams kyis ni dka' pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni khyim pa rnams kyis ni dka' pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The purity of the morality of accepting comes from the difficulty of lay people, etc.

original: dge ba la gcig tu brtson pa yin pas gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: dge ba la gcig tu brtson pa yin pas gang yang smras pa /
translated: He is devoted to virtue alone, and so he is

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: swift in his superknowledges.

original: yid ches par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir tshig btsun pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yid ches par bya ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir tshig btsun pa yin gyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is a trustworthy person, and so his word is authoritative.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las phyogs kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las phyogs kyi le'u ste gnyis pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the second chapter, on the spiritual life, in the Bodhisattvabhumi, the section on the yogas of the bodhisattvas that is consonant with the ground.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'am /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'am /
translated: The Bodhisattva

original: rab tu byung ba yang rung bsam pa dag pa ni chos bzhi po de dag yang dag par spyod par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi rjes la bsam pa bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba yang rung bsam pa dag pa ni chos bzhi po de dag yang dag par spyod par 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir phyogs kyi rjes la bsam pa bstan to //
translated: The purity of attitude is taught in order to show that the four practices are carried out by those who have gone forth into the homeless life, not by others.

original: bsam pa dag pa nyid ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa nyid ni lhag pa'i bsam pa'i khyad par dang ldan par shes par bya'o //
translated: The purity of attitude should be understood as a special kind of superior attitude.

original: 'phel ba dang / sa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba dang / sa dang / rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam pa gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The superior attitude is presented in three forms: as increase, as stages, and as a method of presentation.

original: rgyu nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba nyid dang / bya ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rgyu nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba nyid dang / bya ba nyid kyis so //
translated: It is presented as cause, as classification, and as activity.

original: rgyu nyid ni sems can thams cad la mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid ni sems can thams cad la mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun no //
translated: The cause is the seven kinds of affection for all beings.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni bsam pa bco lnga ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni bsam pa bco lnga ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The classification is the fifteen kinds of attitude.

original: bya ba nyid ni /üîΩbya ba bcu ni byed par bstan //
analyzed: bya ba nyid ni / bya ba bcu ni byed par bstan //
translated: The activity isüîΩas follows:

original: zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The activity is taught as being tenfold.

original: mnyes gshin pa ni sems can rnams kyi yid la 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa ni sems can rnams kyi yid la 'dod pa sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Affection is the fulfillment of the wishes of beings.

original: de yang rgyu'i skyon dang bral ba dang / yon tan gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyu'i skyon dang bral ba dang / yon tan gyi rnam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is free from the fault of cause and is endowed with the aspect of virtue.

original: de ltar na mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: de ltar na mnyes gshin pa rnam pa bdun no //
translated: Thus, there are seven kinds of affection.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i mnyes gshin pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i mnyes gshin pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa yin te /
translated: Among them, worldly affection is defiled by three kinds of defilement:

original: 'jigs pas sam /
analyzed: 'jigs pas sam /
translated: from fear,

original: gzhan gyi ngor ram /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngor ram /
translated: from the face of another,

original: bsam pas ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam pas ma yin no //
translated: and not from the heart.

original: de la 'jigs pas kun nas bslang pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'jigs pas kun nas bslang pa gang yin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Among them, that which is produced from fear is not proper,

original: gnas ma yin pa la sbyor ba yang srid pa la mi dga' bas rab tu ldog par yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnas ma yin pa la sbyor ba yang srid pa la mi dga' bas rab tu ldog par yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: because it is possible that one will turn away from it through disgust for existence.

original: gzhan gyi ngor byed pa de yang rgya che bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngor byed pa de yang rgya che bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is done for the face of another does not become extensive.

original: bsam pas ma zhugs pa de yang mnyam par mi @259b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pas ma zhugs pa de yang mnyam par mi @259b 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is not engaged in from the heart does not become equal.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang po las skyes pa'i mnyes gshin pa de yang skyon dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang po las skyes pa'i mnyes gshin pa de yang skyon dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: Thus, that affection which is produced from the first cause is also faulty.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: It is reprehensible because it is defiled.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs ni kha na ma tho ba med pa ste /
translated: The opposite of that is irreproachable.

original: mi skyo ba'i bar du'o /
analyzed: mi skyo ba'i bar du'o /
translated: It is not wearying up to the limit of non-weariness.

original: gzhan gyi ngor bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni gsol ba btab pas byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngor bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni gsol ba btab pas byas pa'o //
translated: That which is generated in consideration of others is done by request.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni gsol ba ma btab pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni gsol ba ma btab pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is not done by request.

original: bsam pa ma yin pas bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ma yin pas bskyed pa gang yin pa de ni zang zing dang bcas pa'o //
translated: That which is generated by an improper intention is with material substratum.

original: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po'i phyogs gang yin pa de ni zang zing med pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is without material substratum.

original: de dag gis byas pa'i skyon med pas rgya che ba dang mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa'i skyon med pas rgya che ba dang mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: It is extensive and equal because it is free from the faults of those.

original: yang chos bzhi ni rang bzhin med pas 'gro bas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang chos bzhi ni rang bzhin med pas 'gro bas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Again, there are four dharmas that are the entry to the life of a bodhisattva:

original: 'di na 'ga' zhig gcig tu mi phan pa sdug bsngal bskyed par 'dod pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: 'di na 'ga' zhig gcig tu mi phan pa sdug bsngal bskyed par 'dod pa ma yin yang /
translated: Here, someone does not wish to generate suffering that is only non-beneficial.

original: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis sems can la mnyes gshin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rkyen gyis sems can la mnyes gshin pa'o //
translated: and the other is affection for sentient beings that is dependent on other conditions.

original: des na de'i mnyes gshin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i mnyes gshin pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that affection is not proper.

original: mi dga' bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi dga' bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and one becomes displeased.

original: kha cig ni zhe sdang gis mnyes gshin pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni zhe sdang gis mnyes gshin pa ste /
translated: Some are affectionate through hatred.

original: mnyes gshin pa de ni gsol ba btab ste /
analyzed: mnyes gshin pa de ni gsol ba btab ste /
translated: That affection is not proper.

original: rgya che ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rgya che ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not extensive.üîΩThat affection is not proper.

original: de'i mnyen por gsol ba ma btab pa dang / rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mnyen por gsol ba ma btab pa dang / rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is not extensive.

original: kha cig ni 'dun pas mnyes gshin pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni 'dun pas mnyes gshin pa ste /
translated: Some are affectionate through desire.

original: de'i gnyen por zang zing med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por zang zing med pa dang / mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The remedies for those are nonexploitiveness and equanimity.

original: rmongs pas mnyes gshin pa ni rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / mnyam pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pas mnyes gshin pa ni rgya che ba ma yin pa dang / mnyam pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Affection that is confused is not extensive and is not equal.

original: de dag gi gnyen por rgya che ba dang / mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen por rgya che ba dang / mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The remedies for those are extensiveness and equanimity.

original: yang 'jigs pa'i mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'jigs pa'i mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni 'jigs pa med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the remedy for affection that is fearful is fearlessness.

original: skyon dang bcas pa'i mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni rigs pa dang mi skyo ba'o //
analyzed: skyon dang bcas pa'i mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni rigs pa dang mi skyo ba'o //
translated: The remedy for affection that is faulty is propriety and nonweariness.

original: 'dun pa'i mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni gsol ba ma btab pa dang zang zing med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni gsol ba ma btab pa dang zang zing med pa'o //
translated: The antidotes to the affection of desire and hatred are: not to make requests and not to give material things.

original: gti mug gis mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni lhag ma dag go //
analyzed: gti mug gis mnyes gshin pa'i gnyen por ni lhag ma dag go //
translated: The antidotes to the affection of delusion are the remaining perfections.

original: mthun pa nyid yin pas yid du 'ong zhing zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthun pa nyid yin pas yid du 'ong zhing zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since they are in harmony, they are pleasing.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i phyir phan pa ste 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i phyir phan pa ste 'dod pa'o //
translated: Since they are pleasing, they are beneficial, i.e., desired.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: They are endowed with happiness, i.e.,

original: yid dang 'tsham pa'o //
analyzed: yid dang 'tsham pa'o //
translated: they are in harmony with the mind.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the generation of unreasonableness:

original: nyes par spyod pa la yang dag par sbyor ba ni chas ma yin pa la yang @260a * //üîΩdag par 'dzud pa'o /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa la yang dag par sbyor ba ni chas ma yin pa la yang @260a * // dag par 'dzud pa'o /
translated: The application to bad conduct is the application to what is unreasonable.

original: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa la yang dag par sbyor bas 'dul ba ma yin pa la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa la yang dag par sbyor bas 'dul ba ma yin pa la sbyor ba ste /
translated: The application to the afflicted is the application to what is not discipline.

original: 'jig rten gyis mi spyod cing ma bsngags pa ni tshogs par kun du spyod par mi 'os pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis mi spyod cing ma bsngags pa ni tshogs par kun du spyod par mi 'os pa ste /
translated: What is not practiced and not praised in the world is not suitable to be practiced in an assembly.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: These three are unreasonable.

original: sems can rnams kyi don la rab tu sbyor ba ni shin tu ngal bar gyur kyang yongs su mi skyo ba ni lus la ngal ba med pa dang / yid la skyo ba med pa ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don la rab tu sbyor ba ni shin tu ngal bar gyur kyang yongs su mi skyo ba ni lus la ngal ba med pa dang / yid la skyo ba med pa ste /
translated: Application to the aims of sentient beings is the non-discouragement of the bodhisattva, even in the face of great hardship.

original: snying rje can ni skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas so //üîΩrnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje can ni skyo bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas so // rnam par smin pa la re ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: The compassionate one does not become discouraged.üîΩThe absence of desire for the evolutionary development of sentient beings is the non-expectation of reward.üîΩThe absence of desire for evolutionary development is the non-expectation of evolutionary development.üîΩThe absence of desire for the evolutionary development of sentient beings is the non-expectation of reward.

original: zang zing med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir rgyu med par mnyes gshin pa'o //üîΩrgya che ba nyid ni chen po nyid de /
analyzed: zang zing med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir rgyu med par mnyes gshin pa'o // rgya che ba nyid ni chen po nyid de /
translated: The absence of desire for the evolutionary development of sentient beings is the non-expectation of reward.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa nyid do //üîΩde'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa nyid do // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The absence of desire for the evolutionary development of sentient beings is the non-expectation of reward.

original: rnam pa thams cad dang phrad kyang spong bar mi byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dang phrad kyang spong bar mi byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The absence of desire for the evolutionary development of sentient beings is the non-expectation of reward.

original: dga' dgur mi sdug par byed kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag gi bde ba la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir smras pa /
