original: gzhan dag la ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang sdig pa byed par mi 'dod de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la ni rnam grangs gang gis kyang sdig pa byed par mi 'dod de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He does not wish to harm anyone in any way.

original: gcig la ji ltar byed pa de bzhin du thams cad la byed pas kun la mnyam pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la ji ltar byed pa de bzhin du thams cad la byed pas kun la mnyam pa yin no //
translated: He is impartial toward all, for he treats all beings as he does his most cherished child.

original: de'i phyir phyogs gcig la ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs gcig la ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is not partial.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i phyir dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: He is said to have a virtuous intention because he is endowed with the intention to benefit and gladden all beings.

original: sbyor bas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir mchog tu dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor bas phan 'dogs pa'i phyir mchog tu dge ba'i bsam pa can zhes bya'o //
translated: He is said to have a supremely virtuous intention because he benefits them through his actions.

original: mos pa ni lhag par mos pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni lhag par mos pa'o //
translated: Faith is a mental disposition that is characterized by clarity.

original: de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pas sems kyi dga' ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nges par 'dzin pas sems kyi dga' ba ste /
translated: Similarly, conviction is a mental disposition that is characterized by a firm grasp.

original: dngos po de mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po de mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: It is a delight in the mind that does not abandon an object.

original: gzhan gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa ni dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa ni dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Faith that is generated through the power of another is preceded by faith.

original: rang gi stobs kyis bskyed pa ni chos rab tu 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi stobs kyis bskyed pa ni chos rab tu 'byed pa sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Faith that is generated through one‚Äôs own power is preceded by discernment of the Dharma.

original: dbang po rnon po dang rtul ba'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang rtul ba'i dbye bas so //
translated: This is because it is a distinction between those who have sharp faculties and those who have dull faculties.

original: dad pa sngon du 'gro ba ni so sor rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa sngon du 'gro ba ni so sor rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Faith as a prior condition is called ‚Äúdiscernment.‚Äù

original: cig shos ni nges par byed pa zhes bya'o //üîΩbsam pa lhag par gyur pa ni lhag pa'i bsam ste /
analyzed: cig shos ni nges par byed pa zhes bya'o // bsam pa lhag par gyur pa ni lhag pa'i bsam ste /
translated: The other is called ‚Äúdetermination.‚ÄùüîΩThe superior intention is called ‚Äúsuperior aspiration.‚Äù

original: lhag par mos pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the intention of superior aspiration.

original: lhag pa nyid kyang 'chad par 'gyur bas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa nyid kyang 'chad par 'gyur bas shes par bya'o //
translated: Superiority itself will be explained later and should be understood.

original: de ltar na bsam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med na yang dngos po'i dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye bas rnam pa bco lngar bstan @260b to zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa med na yang dngos po'i dbye ba dang / gnas skabs kyi dbye bas rnam pa bco lngar bstan @260b to zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: Thus, although the characteristics of intention are not different, they are taught to be fifteen types by way of the categories of entity and state.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa bco lngar zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Those are also summarized as fifteen types.

original: de la lhag par mos pa'i dngos po ni bcu ste /
analyzed: de la lhag par mos pa'i dngos po ni bcu ste /
translated: Therein, the entities of superior aspiration are ten.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The entity of going for refuge is stated as follows:

original: mchog gi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchog gi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The superior intention.

original: bslab pa'i bsam pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: bslab pa'i bsam pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa ;
translated: The intention of training is stated as follows:

original: tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The intention of morality.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.

original: sdom pa la gnas pa'i dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sdom pa la gnas pa'i dge ba'i chos bsgom pa'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa //
translated: The thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:

original: de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrgya che ba'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o // rgya che ba'i dngos po ni gang gi phyir smras pa //
translated: The intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.

original: mthu'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthu'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:

original: dang po ni mchog gi gnas la lhag par mos par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dang po ni mchog gi gnas la lhag par mos par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The intention of the perfections.

original: gnyis pa ni nyes par spyod pa las dben pa la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni nyes par spyod pa las dben pa la'o //
translated: The thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:

original: gsum pa ni dge ba'i chos la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni dge ba'i chos la'o //
translated: The intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:

original: bzhi pa ni zab mo'i chos la'o//
analyzed: bzhi pa ni zab mo'i chos la'o//
translated: The intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.üîΩThe thing to be cultivated by one who is established in the vow is stated in the verse:üîΩThe intention of the perfections.

original: lnga pa ni rgya che ba'i chos la'o //
analyzed: lnga pa ni rgya che ba'i chos la'o //
translated: The thing

original: sems can pha rol po'i dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la phan pa'i bsam pa ni phan pa la lhag par mos pa'o //üîΩsdug bsngal can rnams la ni bde ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can pha rol po'i dbang du byas nas sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu la gnas pa'i sems can rnams la phan pa'i bsam pa ni phan pa la lhag par mos pa'o // sdug bsngal can rnams la ni bde ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
translated: The thought of benefit for sentient beings who are the other side, who abide in the cause of the three kinds of suffering, is the superior aspiration for benefit.

original: bde bar lhag par mos pa'o ;
analyzed: bde bar lhag par mos pa'o ;
translated: The thought of happiness for those who are suffering is the superior aspiration for happiness.üîΩThe thought of benefit and happiness for both is the superior aspiration for benefit and happiness.

original: / gnyi ga la zang zing med pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: / gnyi ga la zang zing med pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior aspiration is called that because it is disinterested in both.

original: gcig tu byang chub kyi sems brtan pa'i phyir brtan pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu byang chub kyi sems brtan pa'i phyir brtan pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The thought of stability is because of the stability of the thought of enlightenment.

original: thabs la lhag par mos pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thabs la lhag par mos pa'i phyir mi slu ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The thought of nondeception is because of the superior aspiration for the means.

original: de lta bu ni dngos po'i dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni dngos po'i dbye ba yin no //
translated: Such is the classification of the categories of substance.

original: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi dbye ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The classification of states is threefold:

original: ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: the impure thought,

original: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i bye brag gis ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The classification of application is twofold:

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa dang / lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa dang / lhun gyis grub par 'jug pa'o //
translated: engagement through the power of discrimination, and spontaneous engagement.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ma dag pa'i bsam pa'o ;
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par gyis 'jug pa'i phyir ma dag pa'i bsam pa'o ;
translated: Engagement through the difference of aspiration is impure aspiration.

original: / dmigs pa med pa nyid ni dag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: / dmigs pa med pa nyid ni dag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The absence of an objective referent is pure aspiration.

original: mthar thub par gyur pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thub par gyur pa ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The attainment of the ultimate is extremely pure aspiration.

original: ma dag pa'i bsam pa de nyid so sor rtogs nas 'jug par bya ba nye bar bzung nas tshar gcad par bya ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //üîΩgzhan dag rang @261a * //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i bsam pa de nyid so sor rtogs nas 'jug par bya ba nye bar bzung nas tshar gcad par bya ba'i bsam pa zhes bya'o // gzhan dag rang @261a * //
translated: That very impure aspiration is to be engaged through discrimination, and is called the aspiration to be subdued.

original: gi dang gis 'jug pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gi dang gis 'jug pa de ni lhan cig skyes pa'i bsam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The spontaneous engagement of others is called the innate aspiration.

original: de'i phyir smras pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚Äúhaving become of that nature.

original: yang bsam pa de ni skye ba thams cad du rten la shin tu gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rten des bar mi gtong pa'o //
analyzed: yang bsam pa de ni skye ba thams cad du rten la shin tu gnas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rten des bar mi gtong pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù Moreover, that aspiration is extremely well-established in all lives, because it is not interrupted by that support.

original: de ltar na de'i bsam pa ni sa thams cad du gtogs par rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i bsam pa ni sa thams cad du gtogs par rjes su 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, his intention is to engage in all the stages.

original: des na 'di dag gis bya ba bcu byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di dag gis bya ba bcu byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, these ten are the ten activities.

original: dang pos ni dkon mchog gsum la lhag par mos pas rab tu dang ba'i bya ba byed do //
analyzed: dang pos ni dkon mchog gsum la lhag par mos pas rab tu dang ba'i bya ba byed do //
translated: By the first, he performs the activity of faith, through his superior faith in the Three Jewels.

original: dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i sbyor bas tshogs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa'o //üîΩgnyis pas ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa la brtan par gnas pas ma nyams shing ma ral ba'o //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i sbyor bas tshogs thams cad kyi mchog tu gyur pa dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa'o // gnyis pas ni tshul khrims yang dag par blangs pa la brtan par gnas pas ma nyams shing ma ral ba'o //
translated: By the second, he performs the activity of worship of the Three Jewels, which is the best of all accumulations, through his application to the accumulation of immeasurable merit.üîΩBy the third, he performs the activity of guarding, through his firm adherence to the precepts of morality, without transgression or rupture.

original: gsum pas ni dge ba la rtag tu gus par byed pa'i phyir bag yod pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pas ni dge ba la rtag tu gus par byed pa'i phyir bag yod pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: By the fourth, he performs the activity of mindfulness, through his constant respect for virtue.

original: bzhi pas ni 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sbyor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sbyor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: By the fifth, he performs the activity of non-attachment, through his application to samsara and his intention for nirvana.

original: lnga pas ni bstan pa la ma zhugs pa rnams nges par 'dzud par byed do //
analyzed: lnga pas ni bstan pa la ma zhugs pa rnams nges par 'dzud par byed do //
translated: By the fifth, one causes those who have not entered the teaching to enter it.

original: drug pa la sogs pa gsum gyis ni sems can rnams kyi don la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa gsum gyis ni sems can rnams kyi don la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: By the next three, one applies oneself to the aims of sentient beings.

original: dgu pas ni brtson 'grus brtan pa dang brtson 'grus rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgu pas ni brtson 'grus brtan pa dang brtson 'grus rgya chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: By the ninth, one's effort becomes firm and vast.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / brtson 'grus rgya chen po yang dag par rtsom par gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus 'bar ba dang / brtson 'grus rgya chen po yang dag par rtsom par gnas te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: One abides in the practice of blazing effort and vast effort.

original: de dag gnyi ga'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba lhod par mi 'gyur zhing sbyor ba nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga'i bshad pa ni sbyor ba lhod par mi 'gyur zhing sbyor ba nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The explanation of both of these is: One's practice does not become lax, nor does it become weak.

original: / bcu pas ni dge ba rnams la rab dang gtso bor 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: / bcu pas ni dge ba rnams la rab dang gtso bor 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By the tenth, one becomes foremost in the virtues.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: One quickly attains the unsurpassed.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'dren no //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'dren no //
translated: One is led to the effortless.

original: des ni gong nas gong du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa la mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des ni gong nas gong du bla na med pa'i byang chub thob pa la mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is favorable for attaining the unsurpassed enlightenment, higher and higher.

original: bsam pa 'di dag ni bsdus ba dang rgyas par bstan pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di dag ni bsdus ba dang rgyas par bstan pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: These intentions are taught in brief and in detail.

original: dbye ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dbye ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis skabs de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The divisions are taught in the sutras, in the context of the bodhisattva stages.

original: bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The brief explanation is in terms of those.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i @261b gzhi dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las lhag pa'i bsam pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i @261b gzhi dang mthun pa'i chos kyi rnal 'byor gyi gnas las lhag pa'i bsam pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the commentary on the third chapter, on the superior intention, from the Bodhisattva Section of the Bodhisattva Levels.

original: // / de lta bu'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i lus la sogs ba'i spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa zhes bstan to zhes bya bar de dag gi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pas ston par byed
analyzed: // / de lta bu'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'i lus la sogs ba'i spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas skabs thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa ni gnas pa zhes bstan to zhes bya bar de dag gi sdom gyi tshigs su bcad pas ston par byed
translated: The summary verse at the beginning of the chapter is taught in the commentary.

original: do // gnas pa 'di dag ni zhugs pa dang / ma zhugs pa rnams dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: do // gnas pa 'di dag ni zhugs pa dang / ma zhugs pa rnams dang / mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du ci rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: These stations are to be applied as appropriate to those who have entered and those who have not entered, up to the fully enlightened ones.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa las gzung ste zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa las gzung ste zhes bya ba la ;
translated: From the perfect lineage, it is said.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rjes thogs la bstan pa'i go rims kyi 'grel pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩji ltar bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa'i rjes thogs la bstan pa'i go rims kyi 'grel pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / ji ltar bstan pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i bslab pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to explain the sequence of the teachings following the superior intention, it is said:üîΩThe bodhisattva who is endowed with the signs as taught, who has entered the application to enlightenment, and who purifies the intention, will thus abide in these stations of the bodhisattva who is training.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rtags rnams dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi sbyor ba la zhugs pa dang / bsam pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pas 'di ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas 'di dag la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rtags rnams dang ldan pa dang / byang chub kyi sbyor ba la zhugs pa dang / bsam pa rnam par sbyong bar byed pas 'di ltar slob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i gnas 'di dag la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, in order to show that one who possesses the signs as taught, who has entered the application to enlightenment, and who purifies the intention, will thus abide in these stations of the bodhisattva who is training, it is said:

original: rigs la gnas pa yang sems bskyed pa'i bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa yang sems bskyed pa'i bslab pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: And the one who is established in the lineage is taught from the point of view of the training in generating the Thought.

original: gnas pa re re la yang gnas skabs kyi khyad par dpag tu med pas mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes smras pa /
analyzed: gnas pa re re la yang gnas skabs kyi khyad par dpag tu med pas mdor bsdus pa yin no zhes smras pa /
translated: And since there are innumerable special occasions in each of the stations, it is said that they are summarized.

original: gnas pa ni mdor bsdu na bcu gnyis yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas pa ni mdor bsdu na bcu gnyis yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The stations are twelve in all, etc.üîΩThe meaning of station is the application of the Bodhisattva to the practice of body, etc.

original: gnas pa'i don ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus la sogs pa'i spyod pa'i sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa'i don ni byang chub sems dpa'i lus la sogs pa'i spyod pa'i sbyor ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is what it means.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: It should be understood that all the Bodhisattva practices are included in these.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang bstan pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i yang bstan pa ste /
translated: The Tathagata is also taught in terms of the teaching of the Bodhisattva stations,

original: byang chub sems dpa' kho nas de 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' kho nas de 'thob pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because only the Bodhisattva attains them.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas bzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas bzhes bya ba la /
translated: The term fully enlightened is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩThe term unsurpassed is used because there is no other state higher than this.

original: 'di'i pha rol na mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas pa gzhan med pas bla na med pa'o zhes de dag gi ming rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'di'i pha rol na mchog tu gyur pa'i gnas pa gzhan med pas bla na med pa'o zhes de dag gi ming rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.

original: gnas pa bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs la gnas pa ni @262a * //
analyzed: gnas pa bcu gnyis gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rigs la gnas pa ni @262a * //
translated: The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.

original: rigs dang / de'i rgyur gyur ba lus la sogs pa'i las kyi khyad par ni rigs la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rigs dang / de'i rgyur gyur ba lus la sogs pa'i las kyi khyad par ni rigs la gnas pa'o //
translated: The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.

original: sems bskyed pa rnams kyi ni bsam pa ma dag pa'i sa ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa rnams kyi ni bsam pa ma dag pa'i sa ste /
translated: The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.

original: de dang 'dra bar mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.

original: gnas pa dang po ni bslab pa la gnas pas bsdus pa ma yin te /üîΩbsam pa dag pa nyid du yongs su dag pa'i bslab pa gsum la gnas kyi /
analyzed: gnas pa dang po ni bslab pa la gnas pas bsdus pa ma yin te /üîΩbsam pa dag pa nyid du yongs su dag pa'i bslab pa gsum la gnas kyi /
translated: The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve is used because there is no other state higher than this.üîΩ The term abode is used because it is the basis for the attainment of the other states.üîΩ The term twelve

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de lta bas na mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs na yang yod du zin kyang /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir de lta bas na mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs na yang yod du zin kyang /
translated: Therefore, even though it exists in the stage of action in faith,

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab par rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab par rnam par gzhag pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: the training in superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom is not attained,

original: bslab pa ma yin pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bslab pa ma yin pa dang 'dres pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is mixed with the non-training.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la yang nges pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la yang nges pa med pa yin la /
translated: There is no certainty even in the stage of the joyous.

original: gang las bslab pa'i nges pa thob pa nas de'i rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las bslab pa'i nges pa thob pa nas de'i rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: But from the attainment of certainty in the training, there is its establishment.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa ni sa dang po ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa ni sa dang po ste /
translated: The stage of the joyous is the first stage,

original: rab tu dga' ba rnam pa bcu rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba rnam pa bcu rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by the ten aspects of joyfulness being established.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni sa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la gnas pa ni sa gnyis pa ste /
translated: The stage of superior morality is the second stage,

original: rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi gnyen po dge ba la kun du spyod pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam gyi gnyen po dge ba la kun du spyod pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by the practice of virtue which is the antidote to the ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa ni sa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa ni sa gsum pa ste /
translated: The third level is that of The Luminous,üîΩ

original: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang/ snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa bstan pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang/ snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa bstan pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The third stage is called the stage of one who practices with firm conviction, because on it one practices the transcendences with a firm conviction that is free of doubt.

original: bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang yang dag par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs dang yang dag par ldan pa ste /
translated: The fourth stage is called the radiant, because on it the light of the knowledge of the transcendences shines forth.üîΩThe fifth stage is called the brilliant, because on it the light of the knowledge of the transcendences shines forth even more.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi las yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro // de bsgom pa ni shes rab kyi las yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The sixth stage is called the manifest, because on it the bodhisattva manifests the knowledge that is the cause of the transcendences.

original: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa nyid de /üîΩdes na lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi rjes su mthun pa nyid de / des na lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa'o //
translated: The seventh stage is called the farreaching, because on it the bodhisattva reaches the far shore of the nonproduction of all things.üîΩThe eighth stage is called the unshakable, because on it the bodhisattva is unshaken by the realization of the nondifferentiation of things and of the transcendences.

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyi lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa 'bras bu bzhis bsdus pa yin pa ltar 'dir yang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyi lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa 'bras bu bzhis bsdus pa yin pa ltar 'dir yang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i dbye ba rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The ninth stage is called the excellent intelligence, because on it the bodhisattva attains the excellent intelligence of the four unobstructed knowledges.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the cloud of teaching, because on it the bodhisattva, like a cloud, obscures the light of the sun and moon, which are the two knowledges of the disciples and the selfbuddhas, and rains down on beings, obscuring them with the great compassion and the great magic of emanations.

original: sa lnga pa ni bden pa nges par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sa lnga pa ni bden pa nges par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The eleventh stage is called the stage of buddhahood, because on it the bodhisattva attains the knowledge of all the aspects of all things.

original: bden pa mthong nas kyang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtogs pa mang bar 'gyur ro zhes @262b bya bas nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs kyi dbye ba de dang de dag dang ldan par gyur pa ni sa drug pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong nas kyang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtogs pa mang bar 'gyur ro zhes @262b bya bas nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs kyi dbye ba de dang de dag dang ldan par gyur pa ni sa drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth stage is endowed with the various divisions of the dark and bright sides.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni chos rab tu rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: By what is meant the discrimination of phenomena.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: By what is meant the reality of the truths.

original: de ma shes pas sdug bsngal la 'jug pa dang / yang shes pas ni 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i rnam pa gsum char yang lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ma shes pas sdug bsngal la 'jug pa dang / yang shes pas ni 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'o zhes rab tu rtogs par byed pa'i rnam pa gsum char yang lhag pa'i shes rab la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The three aspects of understanding that one enters into suffering through not knowing that, and through knowing that one does not enter into it are called the stage of superior wisdom.

original: mtshan ma med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Signlessness is also of two kinds:

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing 'bad pa dang bcas pa dang / de las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas shing 'bad pa dang bcas pa dang / de las bzlog pa'o //
translated: that which is accompanied by formative influence and accompanied by effort, and the opposite of that.

original: sa bdun pa la gnas pa yang mtshan ma med pa kun du spyod pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: sa bdun pa la gnas pa yang mtshan ma med pa kun du spyod pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Although the one who is on the seventh stage is also engaged in the practice of signlessness,üîΩhe is not yet engaged in effortless practice because he has not yet gained victory over the resistant tendency.üîΩThe eighth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the path of spontaneous practice because he is endowed with the cultivation of that signlessness in abundance.üîΩThe ninth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.

original: yang de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal ba ma yin pas 'bad pa med par bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pas zhes byas nas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las nges par rgyal ba ma yin pas 'bad pa med par bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pas zhes byas nas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: The tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.üîΩThe tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.

original: brgyad pa ni de mang du bsgom pa dang ldan pas de ni lhun gyis grub pa'i lam bsgom pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes byas nas mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni de mang du bsgom pa dang ldan pas de ni lhun gyis grub pa'i lam bsgom pa la 'jug pa yin no zhes byas nas mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pa'o //
translated: The tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice of the absence of signs and the absence of effort because he is engaged in the practice of the path of the absence of signs and the absence of effort.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyis chos 'chad pa la mkhas pas chos smra ba chen po nyid kyi gnas rab tu thob pas sa dgu pa so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyis chos 'chad pa la mkhas pas chos smra ba chen po nyid kyi gnas rab tu thob pas sa dgu pa so so yang dag par rig pa la gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The tenth stage is called the one who has entered the stage of the practice

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan zhing pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas pa mchog ni sa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang ldan zhing pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i gnas pa mchog ni sa bcu pa'o //
translated: The supreme abode is the tenth stage, which is endowed with the perfection of the bodhisattva's practice and the perfection of the transcendences.

original: de ltar na gnyis ni sbyor ba'i sa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gnyis ni sbyor ba'i sa'o //
translated: Thus, two are stages of practice.

original: bcu ni mngon par rtogs pa'i sa ste bsdus nas bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: bcu ni mngon par rtogs pa'i sa ste bsdus nas bcu gnyis so //
translated: Ten are stages of realization.

original: gnas pa thams cad bsdus te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnas pa thams cad bsdus te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase all abodes are included means that all virtuous qualities are included.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad bsdus so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All bodhisattva practices are included.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni /
translated: The abode of the Tathagata

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yod pa ma yin te zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la yod pa ma yin te zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: is not found among the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: It transcends all the bodhisattva abodes, etc.,

original: de'i gnas pa ni rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas pa ni rnal 'byor gyi gnas tha ma las ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: His abode will be taught in the final stage of yoga.

original: des na smras pa /üîΩgnas pa tha ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: des na smras pa / gnas pa tha ma ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩThe last abode is the ten dharmas,

original: chos bcu ni de'i gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i @263a * //
analyzed: chos bcu ni de'i gnas su gyur pa yin pa'i @263a * //
translated: because they are the basis of that,

original: phyir / rab tu gnas pa'i gnas kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir / rab tu gnas pa'i gnas kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the abode of the well-established.

original: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis mdo sde nas gnas pa bstan pa de bzhin du bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gang gis mdo sde nas gnas pa bstan pa de bzhin du bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: As it is established, so it is taught, means that it is taught in the same way that the abodes are taught in the sutra.

original: rnam pa bzhis rigs la gnas pa rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis rigs la gnas pa rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The abode of the lineage is established in four ways:

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / las kyi mtha' phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / rgyu phun sum tshogs pa nyid dang / las kyi mtha' phun sum tshogs pa nyid do //
translated: perfection of intention, perfection of application, perfection of cause, and perfection of activity.

original: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /üîΩrang bzhin gyis sems kyi rgyud dge ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / rang bzhin gyis sems kyi rgyud dge ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Regarding the first, it is said:üîΩBecause the mental continuum is virtuous by nature, etc.

original: rang bzhin gyis rgyud dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rgyud dge ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the mental continuum is virtuous by nature,

original: spyi dang khyad par la so sor brtag pa med par yang ngo //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par la so sor brtag pa med par yang ngo //
translated: and without examining the general and particular characteristics.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang mngon par ldan pa yin par bzhed kyi mngon sum du byas pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni sa bon dang mngon par ldan pa yin par bzhed kyi mngon sum du byas pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe becomes endowed with virtuous qualities‚Äù means that he is endowed with the seeds of those qualities, not that he is endowed with the actual qualities,

original: kun du spyod pa yang yang dag par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa yang yang dag par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: because the text says that he ‚Äúsees‚Äù the practice of those qualities.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /üîΩde yang dag par spyod pa la yang yang dag par snang ba zhes bya ba la /üîΩde dag gi rigs kyi rtags kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan rnams mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / de yang dag par spyod pa la yang yang dag par snang ba zhes bya ba la / de dag gi rigs kyi rtags kyis bsdus pa'i yon tan rnams mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: The second verse is stated from the point of view of the second kind of faith.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúhe sees the practice of those qualities‚Äù means that he sees the practice of those qualities.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúhe sees the qualities that are included in the family of those qualities‚Äù means that he sees the qualities that are included in the family of those qualities.

original: de la yang dag par snang la zhes bya ba ni de dang yang dag par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la yang dag par snang la zhes bya ba ni de dang yang dag par spyod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe sees the practice of those qualities‚Äù means that he sees the practice of those qualities.

original: nan gyis sbyor ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis brtan par byas nas sbyor ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nan gyis sbyor ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis brtan par byas nas sbyor ba ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not by force means not by one's own firmness.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩso sor brtags te gags dang bcas par ma gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / so sor brtags te gags dang bcas par ma gyur pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩNot by analysis, not by obstruction.

original: tshar bcad pas ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshar bcad pas ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not by destruction means not by one's own firmness.

original: gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gsum pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the third, it is said:

original: sa bon 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
analyzed: sa bon 'dzin pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o /
translated: It is the holding of the seed.

original: bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bzhi pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the fourth, it is said:

original: dri ma rags pa dang bral ba yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dri ma rags pa dang bral ba yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is the freedom from gross defilement.

original: rags pa nyid ni kha na ma tho ba chen pos kun nas bslang ba'o ;
analyzed: rags pa nyid ni kha na ma tho ba chen pos kun nas bslang ba'o ;
translated: Grossness is the instigation by a great offense.

original: / kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa yang lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'i las te /
analyzed: / kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa yang lus kyi nyes par spyod pa la sogs pa'i las te /
translated: Defilement is the karma of bodily misconduct, etc.

original: ma la sogs pa'i rten gyi srog gcod pa dang / de la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i rten gyi srog gcod pa dang / de la sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the killing of one's mother, etc., and the preparation for that.

original: ngag gi las dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: ngag gi las dge 'dun gyi dbyen la sogs pa dang / yid kyi nyes par spyod pa log par lta ba'o //
translated: The verbal misdeed is the schism of the Sa·πÖgha, and the mental misdeed is wrong view.

original: bya ba gang @263b bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba gang @263b bstan pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is taught as the practice?

original: bya ba gang bstan pa 'di dag thams cad kyang rigs la gnas pa'i yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba gang bstan pa 'di dag thams cad kyang rigs la gnas pa'i yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It should be understood that all of these practices are for one who is established in the lineage.

original: de ltar ming gis bstan pa'i gnas pa rnams don gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas rigs la gnas pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar ming gis bstan pa'i gnas pa rnams don gyi sgo nas bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas rigs la gnas pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, having presented the states by name, in terms of the presentation of the states by meaning, it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is it to be established in the lineage?‚Äù and so on.

original: dri ba byas pa bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa la sogs pa la yang sbyar te /
analyzed: dri ba byas pa bzhin du mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa la sogs pa la yang sbyar te /
translated: As with the questions, it should be applied to the states of the stage of resolute conduct and so on.

original: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa rnam pa lnga bstan pa ni gnas skabs nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rtsom pa nyid dang / thob pa nyid dang / yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa rnam pa lnga bstan pa ni gnas skabs nyid dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rtsom pa nyid dang / thob pa nyid dang / yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: The presentation of the five common and uncommon states is in terms of the state itself, the nature itself, the undertaking itself, the attainment itself, and the complete perfection itself.

original: ngo bo nyid ma gtogs pa gzhan rnam pa bzhi ni sa bstan pa thams cad du rjes su rtogs pas thun mong pa zhes bya'o //üîΩngo bo nyid ni so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma gtogs pa gzhan rnam pa bzhi ni sa bstan pa thams cad du rjes su rtogs pas thun mong pa zhes bya'o // ngo bo nyid ni so sor nges pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The other four aspects, except for the reality aspect, are called common because they are realized in all the stages.

original: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The reality aspect is called uncommon because it is individually certain.üîΩFrom the first production of the thought of enlightenment on, etc.

original: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas skabs gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: dang po sems bskyed pa nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gnas skabs gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: This clarifies the situation.üîΩWhatever the bodhisattvas do, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang ci yang rung zhes bya bas ni ngo bo bstan to //üîΩrgyu tsam la 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa gang ci yang rung zhes bya bas ni ngo bo bstan to // rgyu tsam la 'jug cing zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: This indicates the essence.üîΩEngaging in the mere cause, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa rnams kyi rgyu tsam la 'jug pa yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis bon 'dzin pa yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu tsam yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa rnams kyi rgyu tsam la 'jug pa yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyis bon 'dzin pa yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa'i rgyu tsam yin no //
translated: Because it is endowed with all the qualities of the bodhisattva, it engages in the mere cause of the stations of the bodhisattva, and because it holds the seed of all the qualities of the Buddha, it is the mere cause of the Tathagata's station.

original: don de nyid bstan pa ni rgyu yongs su 'dzin par zad kyi zhes bya ba la des rgyu yongs su gzung bar zad kyi 'bras bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa ni rgyu yongs su 'dzin par zad kyi zhes bya ba la des rgyu yongs su gzung bar zad kyi 'bras bu ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is stated: ‚ÄúIt is merely the cause that is grasped,‚Äù meaning that the effect is not grasped.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gnas pa gzhan ci yang brtsams pa yang med ces bya ba ni brtsams su zin kyang gnas pa 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs sbyor ba'i lam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan ci yang brtsams pa yang med ces bya ba ni brtsams su zin kyang gnas pa 'thob pa dang rjes su mthun pa sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs sbyor ba'i lam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no other state that is begun,‚Äù meaning that even if it is begun, the state of obtaining the path of preparation is the path of preparation, which is compatible with obtaining the path of preparation.

original: des bsdus pa med de /
analyzed: des bsdus pa med de /
translated: It is not subsumed by that,

original: sems bskyed pa med pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa med pa'i phyir dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba dag pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the generation of the mind does not exist and because the pure application of generosity and so on does not exist.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta shin tu ring ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lta shin tu ring ba nyid yin no //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is very far from that view.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad brtsams pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yod pas des sa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir brtsams pa @264a * //üîΩzhes bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa thams cad brtsams pa yin te zhes bya ba ni sems bskyed pa dang / sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba yod pas des sa 'thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir brtsams pa @264a * // zhes bya ste /
translated: The phrase all the bodhisattva stages are undertaken means that the generation of enlightenment mind and the practice of the perfections such as generosity are undertaken because they lead to the attainment of the spiritual levels.

original: de'i don du shin tu 'bad par byed do zhes bya bas 'thob pa yang med ces bya ba ni yang dag par mngon du byas pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i don du shin tu 'bad par byed do zhes bya bas 'thob pa yang med ces bya ba ni yang dag par mngon du byas pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase there is no attainment means that there is no actualization of the spiritual levels.

original: rnam par sbyangs pa yang med ces bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa med do //üîΩmos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa thob cing de la gnas pa'i phyir de nyid kyi rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob pas rim gyis de'i mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par sbyangs pa yang med ces bya ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa med do // mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pa thob cing de la gnas pa'i phyir de nyid kyi rnam par dag pa rab tu 'thob pas rim gyis de'i mthar thug pa thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase there is no purification means that there is no perfection of the spiritual levels.üîΩThe phrase there is no arrival means that there is no final arrival at the culmination of the spiritual levels.üîΩThe phrase the bodhisattva who is skilled in the stages refers to the bodhisattva who is skilled in the stages of the spiritual levels.

original: sa nas sa su 'pho ba bstan pa'i phyir mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sa nas sa su 'pho ba bstan pa'i phyir mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yongs su dag na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva who is skilled in the stages refers to the bodhisattva who is skilled in the stages of the spiritual levels.

original: sa de 'thob kyang sa gong ma 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: sa de 'thob kyang sa gong ma 'thob pa ste /
translated: Even though one attains that stage, one attains a higher stage.

original: bsam gtan thob kyang gong ma thob pa lta bu'o ;
analyzed: bsam gtan thob kyang gong ma thob pa lta bu'o ;
translated: Even though one attains the meditative concentration, one attains a higher one.

original: / ji ltar bsam gtan thob kyang gong ma ma thob pas de yongs su sbyangs nas gong ma thob par byed do //
analyzed: / ji ltar bsam gtan thob kyang gong ma ma thob pas de yongs su sbyangs nas gong ma thob par byed do //
translated: Just as one attains the meditative concentration but does not attain a higher one, one perfects it and attains a higher one.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: In the same way, here also, the process is similar.

original: bskal pa mang pos sa yongs su spyod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bskal pa mang pos sa yongs su spyod par byed pa yin no //
translated: One perfects the stage over many eons.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni thob pa dang dag pa cig car yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa ni thob pa dang dag pa cig car yin te /
translated: The abiding of the TathƒÅgata is the simultaneous attainment and purification,

original: bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yang rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yang rtsom pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is unsurpassed and because there is no further undertaking.

original: de'i phyir bstod pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstod pa /
translated: Therefore, in praise, it is said:

original: shing la bya rnams gnas 'cha' bzhin du khyod kyis skad cig gcig la de 'dir brnyes //
analyzed: shing la bya rnams gnas 'cha' bzhin du khyod kyis skad cig gcig la de 'dir brnyes //
translated: The birds make their nests in the trees, but you attain it here in a single moment.

original: zhes bstan pa yin te zung du 'jug par brnyes pa la dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa yin te zung du 'jug par brnyes pa la dgongs pa yin no //
translated: This is taught with the intention of attaining the union.

original: mi slob pa'i sas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir de'i dag pa nyid rim gyis 'thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sas bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir de'i dag pa nyid rim gyis 'thob pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it is included in the stage of no more learning, it is not gradually attained,

original: yang bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang bslab par bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing more to learn.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bstan to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs bstan to //
translated: The purity of superior intention is taught as the state.

original: gnas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: gnas pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: The state itself is taught as the essence,

original: de'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not differentiated.

original: bsam pa dag pa'i gzhis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i gzhis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The basis of the purity of intention is taught as the cause.üîΩJust as the ≈õrƒÅvaka who is perfect in view has pure intention and naturally possesses morality, so it is for the bodhisattva whose intention is completely pure.

original: ji ltar nyan thos lta ba phun sum tshogs pa bsam pa dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pa bzhin du bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yin no zhes bya bar de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos lta ba phun sum tshogs pa bsam pa dag pa ni rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pa bzhin du bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yin no zhes bya bar de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The purity of the basis is taught as the result.

original: rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skyes shing skyes pa thams cad du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa med par yang dag par ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la skyes shing skyes pa thams cad du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa med par yang dag par ldan pa ste /
translated: They are endowed with the possession of the ten wholesome courses of action, which are not relinquished at any time, in all their births.

original: sa de dag la lus la sogs pa'i las dge ba'i las kyis bsdus pas kun du spyod pa la mang du gnas pa dang ldan @264b pa yin no //üîΩtshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so zhes bya ba nas yang ma zhig pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /üîΩting nge 'dzin yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i tshig gi bar gyis /
analyzed: sa de dag la lus la sogs pa'i las dge ba'i las kyis bsdus pas kun du spyod pa la mang du gnas pa dang ldan @264b pa yin no // tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so zhes bya ba nas yang ma zhig pa nyid dang zhes bya ba nas / ting nge 'dzin yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i tshul khrims zhes bya ba'i tshig gi bar gyis /
translated: On those stages, they are endowed with the practice of the wholesome courses of action, which are included in the wholesome actions of body, etc.üîΩBy the words, ‚Äúone who possesses morality attains meditative concentration,‚Äù up to, ‚Äúone who is not heedless attains the realization of the powers,‚ÄùüîΩby the words, ‚Äúthe morality that accomplishes meditative concentration,‚Äù

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i gzhi las ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i gzhi las ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug cing gnas pa'o //
translated: one should understand the purity of morality as the basis for attaining and maintaining meditative concentration.

original: 'jig rten pa'i zhes smos pa ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / de dag las byung ba'i yon tan sa der bstan pa rnams ni de'i sa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i zhes smos pa ni bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / de dag las byung ba'i yon tan sa der bstan pa rnams ni de'i sa zhes bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúof the mundane sphere‚Äù is mentioned in order to indicate that the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment is not only supramundane.

original: yang dang yang du bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa de lta bu ni dge ba'i chos la kun du spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa de lta bu ni dge ba'i chos la kun du spyod pa yin no //
translated: The repeated entry into the meditative concentrations and the meditative attainments and the possession of these is the practice of the wholesome dharmas.

original: de'i phyir gnas pa zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa zhes rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Therefore, it is described as the station that is the result of meditative development.

original: thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to all the other stations.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sngar nas thob pa'i lhag pa'i sems la brten nas te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sngar nas thob pa'i lhag pa'i sems la brten nas te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin dependence upon meditative concentration‚Äù refers to the possession of the higher mental states that have been previously attained.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The words ‚Äúone who is concentrated knows and sees things as they are‚Äù are stated in this regard.

original: de ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is described as the station that is the result of thorough analysis.

original: sa de la ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgom pa la mang du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: sa de la ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sgom pa la mang du gnas pa yin no //
translated: In this spiritual level, the bodhisattva is one who is mostly engaged in the meditative development of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas bden pa rab tu rtogs pa yin pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas pa
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas bden pa rab tu rtogs pa yin pa ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brten nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i gnas pa
translated: Just as the sravakas realize the truth by first cultivating the factors that contribute to enlightenment, so the bodhisattvas also, on the basis of full discernment, abide in the realization of the truth.

original: ste / bden pa so sor rig pa'i rnam pas sa de la ni bden pa la lta ba mang du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: ste / bden pa so sor rig pa'i rnam pas sa de la ni bden pa la lta ba mang du gnas pa yin no //
translated: The stage is called the stage of the realization of the truth because the bodhisattva abides in the contemplation of the truth through the aspect of the discernment of the truth.üîΩThe bodhisattva who possesses the knowledge of the truth, by the process of engagement and disengagement, discerns the truth through the certainty that suffering will cease by the cause of the knowledge of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa'i rgyus sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pas bden pa shes pa dang ldan pa ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rim gyis so sor rtog par byed do zhes bya bas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa gtsor byed pa'i dbang duüîΩbyas nas smras pa ;
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa'i rgyus sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nges pas bden pa shes pa dang ldan pa ni 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rim gyis so sor rtog par byed do zhes bya bas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa gtsor byed pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa ;
translated: Thus, with reference to the preeminence of the realization of the truth, it is said:

original: de ma shes pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa so sor ma rtogs pas so //
analyzed: de ma shes pas zhes bya ba ni bden pa so sor ma rtogs pas so //
translated: By not knowing that, i.e., by not discerning the truth, one is not liberated.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba rgyu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba'i rgyu ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The cause of the occurrence of suffering is the afflictions and the defilement by karma.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par mtshan ma med par @265a * //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs par mtshan ma med par @265a * //
translated: The training in higher wisdom should be cultivated as signless.

original: bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa rnam pa de gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa rnam pa de gsum gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The three aspects are mentioned in the verse beginning with ‚Äúthe three aspects.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called ‚Äúthe application with exertion.‚Äù

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, it is said:

original: rtsol bas zhes bya ba la /üîΩrgyun chags su bar chad med par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtsol bas zhes bya ba la / rgyun chags su bar chad med par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWith effort‚Äù meansüîΩ‚Äúwithout interruption‚Äù means

original: skad cig ma rgyun chags su'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma rgyun chags su'o //
translated: without a break in the continuum of moments.

original: chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn all phenomena‚Äù refers to unconditioned phenomena and so forth.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bsgom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa shes bya'i mchog la rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa ltar de la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang de dang 'dra bar rnamüîΩpar mi rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab bsgom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin nyid rnam par mi rtog pa shes bya'i mchog la rnam par rtog pa thams cad med pa ltar de la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang de dang 'dra bar rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
translated: Possessing the cultivation of nonconceptual wisdom means that just as suchness is nonconceptual, without any conceptualization whatsoever with regard to the supreme object of knowledge, the wisdom that focuses on it is also like that, nonconceptual.

original: de'i rnam par bsgom pa ni shes rab bsgom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par bsgom pa ni shes rab bsgom pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Its cultivation is called possessing the cultivation of wisdom.

original: de la 'di dang gnyis pa'i khyad par ni /
analyzed: de la 'di dang gnyis pa'i khyad par ni /
translated: The difference between this and the second is as follows.

original: sngar bstan pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab shas cher bsgom pas mngon par 'du byed pa dang rtsol ba med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rnam pa can gyi lam du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab shas cher bsgom pas mngon par 'du byed pa dang rtsol ba med par rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i rnam pa can gyi lam du gyur pa yin no //
translated: By cultivating the nonconceptual wisdom taught above, it becomes a path that naturally engages without effort and fabrication, with a continuous aspect.

original: shes rab dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes rab ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: shes rab dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag pa'i shes rab ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Possessing the concentration of wisdom means the meaning of the wisdom of one who is equipoised in concentration.

original: bstan pa'i chos ni so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i phyir shes rab kyang rgya che ba'i phyir blo gros chen po rgya che ba rjes su 'thob pa yin no //üîΩdes na chos smra ba chen po yin pa'i phyir chos yang dag par ston ba bla na med pa zhes bya ba la /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbang bskur ba chen po thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la dbang ba nyid kyi phyir chos kyi dbang bskur ba chen po thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of mastery over unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, it is called attaining the great consecration of Dharma.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis su bstan ba'i phyir skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis su bstan ba'i phyir skye ba gcig gis thogs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Also, in order to teach that in two aspects, it says who are obstructed by one birth and so on.

original: de ltar gnas pa rnams kyi ngo bo bstan nas bsgom pa'i rnam pa'i khyad @265b par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa rnams kyi ngo bo bstan nas bsgom pa'i rnam pa'i khyad @265b par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having taught the nature of those who are abiding, in order to teach the distinctive aspects of meditation,

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it says,

original: 'di'i lus la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las rnams ni 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin na sa la zhugs pa la ltos nas bya ba chung ngu dang ldan pa yin gyi rgya che ba ma yin zhing tshad med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i lus la sogs pa'i bya ba'i las rnams ni 'jig rten pa thams cad dang / nyan thos la sogs pa las khyad par du 'phags pa yin na sa la zhugs pa la ltos nas bya ba chung ngu dang ldan pa yin gyi rgya che ba ma yin zhing tshad med pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the activities of the body and so on of those who are abiding are superior to all worldly people and to the ≈õrƒÅvakas and so on. However, in relation to those who have entered the levels, they have little activity, not extensive activity, not immeasurable activity.

original: rgyun chags pa ma yin par byed pa ni res 'ga' ni byed la res 'ga' mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun chags pa ma yin par byed pa ni res 'ga' ni byed la res 'ga' mi byed pa'o //
translated: They are not continuous, sometimes acting and sometimes not acting.

original: nges par mi byed pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: nges par mi byed pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The one who does not definitely practice is the one who regresses.

original: yang bya dgos shing sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: yang bya dgos shing sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: He must practice again, and he is one who is only engaged.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe regresses.‚Äù

original: sa la zhugs pa'i ni rgya cher byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i ni rgya cher byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The one who has entered the stages practices extensively,

original: dpag tu med par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpag tu med par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but not immeasurably.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba ni rgyun chags su byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba ni rgyun chags su byed pa'o //
translated: He is engaged in continuous practice, and he is one who practices uninterruptedly.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur pa ni nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur pa ni nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: He does not regress, and he is one who definitely practices.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i lam la gnas pa'i khyad par med pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i lam la gnas pa'i khyad par med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAs is appropriate‚Äù means without distinction in the special training and path.

original: lhag ma gsum gyis rnam pa 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag ma gsum gyis rnam pa 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The remaining three are taught as being similar in type.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang po nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa dang po nas bzung ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The first stage of the signless is taken up, and so on.

original: de'i skad cig gcig la bskyed pa'i dge ba yang dpag tu med pa yin pa'i phyir tshad med par byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i skad cig gcig la bskyed pa'i dge ba yang dpag tu med pa yin pa'i phyir tshad med par byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the virtue generated in a single moment is immeasurable, it is called immeasurable practice.

original: gnas pa dang po gnyis ni sa la ma zhugs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnas pa dang po gnyis ni sa la ma zhugs pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The first two stages are taught to be the stage of not entering the grounds.

original: yang dag par rtsom pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rtsom pa yin par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúone should know that they are correctly engaged. ‚Äù

original: chos bdag med par rab tu rtogs par rab tu sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med par rab tu rtogs par rab tu sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are engaged in fully realizing the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sa drug po rnams su chos bdag med pa la sbyor pa'o //
analyzed: sa drug po rnams su chos bdag med pa la sbyor pa'o //
translated: On the six grounds, they are engaged in the selflessness of phenomena.

original: thog pa rnams khyad par du 'phel ba ni 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thog pa rnams khyad par du 'phel ba ni 'grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The increase of the superior qualities is called ‚Äúaccomplishment. ‚Äù

original: 'phel ba mthar thug par 'gyur pa ni yongs su dag pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba mthar thug par 'gyur pa ni yongs su dag pa'o //
translated: The culmination of that increase is ‚Äúpurification. ‚Äù

original: 'bras bu so sor myong ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos smra ba chen po nyid 'thob ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu so sor myong ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i chos smra ba chen po nyid 'thob ba'o //
translated: The experience of the result is the attainment of the state of a great Dharma teacher who is free of misdeeds.

original: bcu pa la ni dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la ni dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
translated: On the tenth, they attain consecration.

original: yang gnas pa 'di dag gis so so'i rnam pa la sogs pa bstan pa ni gnas pa de dag la gnas pa legs par mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gnas pa 'di dag gis so so'i rnam pa la sogs pa bstan pa ni gnas pa de dag la gnas pa legs par mtshon par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the teaching of the individual aspects and so on of these stages is in order to fully illustrate those stages.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa gsum ni don gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa gsum ni don gcig pa nyid do //
translated: The three, aspect and so on, are the same in meaning.

original: de lta de ltar snang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de lta de ltar snang ba'i phyir //
translated: Because of the appearance of this and that,

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa'o //
translated: this is the aspect.

original: 'dis mtshon par byed shes par byed pas na rtags so //üîΩmtshan @266a * //
analyzed: 'dis mtshon par byed shes par byed pas na rtags so // mtshan @266a * //
translated: The sign is that which causes the indication and knowledge of that.üîΩThe mark is that which is marked.

original: mar gyur pas mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: mar gyur pas mtshan ma'o //
translated: The sign is that which is marked by the mark.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa rnams mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par bya'o //üîΩrigs la gnas pa la med pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de 'di la ldan pa dang / sa la gnas pa rnams la skyon gang med pa de 'di la yod pa dang / de la yod pa'i yon tan gyi phyogs gcig 'di la yod pa dang /
