analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa rnams mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par bya'o // rigs la gnas pa la med pa'i yon tan gang yin pa de 'di la ldan pa dang / sa la gnas pa rnams la skyon gang med pa de 'di la yod pa dang / de la yod pa'i yon tan gyi phyogs gcig 'di la yod pa dang /
translated: In brief, the aspect and so on are to be established as fourfold.

original: rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi skyon gang yin pa'i phyogs gcig 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa rnams kyi skyon gang yin pa'i phyogs gcig 'di la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The qualities that do not exist in one who is established in the lineage exist in this one, the faults that do not exist in those who are established in the stages exist in this one, one part of the qualities that exist in those who are established in the stages exists in this one, and one part of the faults that exist in those who are established in the lineage does not exist in this one.

original: rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don la so sor brtags nas 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can gyi don la so sor brtags nas 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are established in the lineage do not engage in the benefit of sentient beings after analysis.

original: 'di ni yang rab tu sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni yang rab tu sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: This is the highest application. This is the distinction.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sa la zhugs pa bas dman par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sa la zhugs pa bas dman par bstan pa'o //
translated: Not by nature. This shows that he is inferior to one who has entered the stages.

original: brtan pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa ni don gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: brtan pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su mi nyams pa ni don gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Stability, etc. and non-regression have the same meaning.

original: thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de la ni yongs su nyams pa srid pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnas pa de la ni yongs su nyams pa srid pa yin no //
translated: But not attainment. In this state of abiding, regression is possible.

original: 'dis ni sa la zhugs pa bas dman par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa la zhugs pa bas dman par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is inferior to one who has entered the stages.

original: de bzhin du 'jigs pa rnams las kyang yang dag par 'das pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jigs pa rnams las kyang yang dag par 'das pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Similarly, he has not transcended all fears.

original: sems can gyi don rnams la yang sbyor ba dag la so sor brtags te sbyor bar byed kyi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i bsam pa'i med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi don rnams la yang sbyor ba dag la so sor brtags te sbyor bar byed kyi zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i bsam pa'i med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He applies himself to the welfare of sentient beings, but only after careful consideration. This shows that he lacks the attitude of sameness with regard to self and others.

original: ched 'ga' ni log par yang bsgrub po zhes bya ba ni mi phan pa dang sdug bsngal yang bskyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni log par yang bsgrub po zhes bya ba ni mi phan pa dang sdug bsngal yang bskyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Sometimes, they are also practiced wrongly. This means that they also generate harm and suffering.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang kun du spyod pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang kun du spyod pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: The paths of the ten unwholesome actions are also practiced.

original: ched 'ga' ni lhag par zhen par gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs ma mthong bas chags pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la yongs su spyod par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni lhag par zhen par gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs ma mthong bas chags pa'i dbang gis 'dod pa la yongs su spyod par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Sometimes, they become excessively attached. This means that, not seeing the faults of desire, they engage in the enjoyment of desire under the power of attachment. This is taught in detail.

original: kun du 'dzin par yang snang ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos kyang yod la slong mo pa nye bar lhags kyang sbyin pa la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: kun du 'dzin par yang snang ngo zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya ba'i chos kyang yod la slong mo pa nye bar lhags kyang sbyin pa la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: They also appear to be grasping. This means that there are objects to be given, and beggars have approached, but they do not engage in giving.

original: dad pas 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis drangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dad pas 'gro bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rkyen gyis drangs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They go out of faith. This means they are drawn by the conditions of others.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'am zhes bya ba la sngar bstan pa'i don brgyad po la gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug pa nyid @266b do ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i mthu'am zhes bya ba la sngar bstan pa'i don brgyad po la gzhan gyi dbang gis 'jug pa nyid @266b do ;
translated: In dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.

original: / sa la zhugs pa'i shes pa la ltos nas chung ngu dang ldan pa yin pa dang / dran pa brjed ngas pa dang ldan pas ched 'ga' brjed ngas pa dang / dman pa'i lam dang ldan pa yang yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / sa la zhugs pa'i shes pa la ltos nas chung ngu dang ldan pa yin pa dang / dran pa brjed ngas pa dang ldan pas ched 'ga' brjed ngas pa dang / dman pa'i lam dang ldan pa yang yin zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.

original: mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.

original: 'dun pa drag po med do zhes bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩbrtson 'grus 'bar ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dun pa drag po med do zhes bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir / brtson 'grus 'bar ba ma yin no //
translated: In dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power.

original: zab mo la dga' ba legs par gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zab mo la dga' ba legs par gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: In dependence on those who have entered the levels, they are of small power.üîΩIn dependence on those who have not entered the levels, they are of great power

original: yul rnams la brjed ngas pa ni 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa rnams la chags pa dang / sdang ba ngag gis sems phyin ci log pa nyid do //
analyzed: yul rnams la brjed ngas pa ni 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa rnams la chags pa dang / sdang ba ngag gis sems phyin ci log pa nyid do //
translated: Forgetfulness of objects is the perversion of the mind by speech, in the form of attachment to desirable objects and aversion to undesirable objects.

original: skye ba gzhan du skyes pa nas 'das pa'i lus mi dran pa dang / chos rnams la bzung nas ring du lon pa'am byas nas ring du long pa'i chos rnams mi dran pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan du skyes pa nas 'das pa'i lus mi dran pa dang / chos rnams la bzung nas ring du lon pa'am byas nas ring du long pa'i chos rnams mi dran pa'o //
translated: It is the non-recollection of the body of the previous birth, and the non-recollection of the Dharma, having taken it up, for a long time, or having done it, for a long time.

original: yid gzhungs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pas chos rnams len pa la sogs par nus pa la ched 'ga' dran pa brjed ngas par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid gzhungs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pas chos rnams len pa la sogs par nus pa la ched 'ga' dran pa brjed ngas par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the forgetfulness of the Dharma, although one is capable of taking it up, etc., because of having a sharp mind, memory, and wisdom.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems can 'dul ba'i thabs ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du thabs la mkhas pa dang bral ba yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems can 'dul ba'i thabs ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is completely devoid of skill in means, it says, ‚Äúhe does not know the methods of guiding sentient beings, etc.‚Äù

original: nan gyis chos ston cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa'i stobs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nan gyis chos ston cing zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa'i stobs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase he teaches the Dharma with great insistence means that he teaches the Dharma with the power of others' requests.

original: 'bras bu med par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu grub pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu med par yang 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu grub pa med pa'o //
translated: The phrase there would be no result means that there would be no accomplishment of the result.

original: de'i phyir dpe bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example is stated.

original: kha cig tu smon lam yang gtong bar byed la /
analyzed: kha cig tu smon lam yang gtong bar byed la /
translated: In some cases, he even abandons his aspirational prayers.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa nyid kyang gtong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa nyid kyang gtong ngo //
translated: In the same way, he even abandons the acceptance of the morality of restraint.

original: ched 'ga' ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len par mi byed do //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyis byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par len par mi byed do //
translated: In some cases, he does not accept the morality of restraint of a bodhisattva with a mind that is fearful.

original: ched 'ga' ni sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyus sems can gyi don las ldog par yang byed do //
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyus sems can gyi don las ldog par yang byed do //
translated: In some cases, he turns away from benefiting sentient beings because of the suffering that is caused by their ingratitude.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase from the very bottom of his heart means naturally.

original: so sor brtags te zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: so sor brtags te zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase he carefully considers means that he carefully considers.

original: bdag gi 'khrul pa yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi spong bar de bzhin du @267a * //
analyzed: bdag gi 'khrul pa yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi spong bar de bzhin du @267a * //
translated: Just as one does not abandon one's own error once it is fully understood, one should not abandon the error of others.

original: yang 'khrul pa la spyod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yang 'khrul pa la spyod pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as he does not abandon his own error, so he acts in error, just like the one who is ignorant of his own error.

original: 'di las khrid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen ngan pas theg pa chen po las 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las khrid par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i bshes gnyen ngan pas theg pa chen po las 'dun pa zlog par byed pa'o //
translated: He is led away from this, that is, from the Great Vehicle, by a bad spiritual teacher who turns him away from his intention.

original: skrag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad du phyin ci log tu sbyor bas log pa la nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: skrag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi thams cad du phyin ci log tu sbyor bas log pa la nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: He is frightened, that is, he is seized by error, because he is engaged in error in every way.

original: g-yo ba ni blo gros ngan pa skye bar 'gyur bas the tshom za ba nyid do //
analyzed: g-yo ba ni blo gros ngan pa skye bar 'gyur bas the tshom za ba nyid do //
translated: He is unsteady, that is, he is doubtful, because his bad understanding arises.

original: bsam pa'i khyad par ma thob pas snying rje chen pos kun du spyod pa yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa'i khyad par ma thob pas snying rje chen pos kun du spyod pa yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He abandons the practice of great compassion, because he has not attained the special thought.

original: gzhan gyi don gyi bya ba la sbyor ba yin na yang sbyor ba chung dus nye bar bsgrub pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don gyi bya ba la sbyor ba yin na yang sbyor ba chung dus nye bar bsgrub pa ste /
translated: Even when he is engaged in the work of others, he accomplishes little, because he is not skilled in means.

original: bsam pa chung ba'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / de bzhin du rtags dang / phyogs kyi sbyor ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam pa chung ba'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pa dang / de bzhin du rtags dang / phyogs kyi sbyor ba dang / lhag pa'i bsam pa med pa yin no //
translated: because of his small aspiration, he does not have the training which has the characteristics as taught, and likewise, he does not have the signs, the application of the side, and the superior intention.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang ring ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang ring ba nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is far from the perfect Buddha.

original: ched 'ga' ni bdag tu lta ba la kun du spyod par yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ched 'ga' ni bdag tu lta ba la kun du spyod par yang 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that sometimes he even engages in the view of self, it is said:

original: bdag nyid kyang ring bar 'dzin to zhes bya ba la des na 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i bsam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang ring bar 'dzin to zhes bya ba la des na 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i bsam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: He also considers himself as far away. Thus, it is shown that he has the idea of wandering in cyclic existence.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa'i 'di dag gnyen po'i dbang gis chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa'i 'di dag gnyen po'i dbang gis chen po dang 'bring dang chung ngu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that these aspects, etc. are taught as great, middling, and small due to the power of their antidotes,

original: bzod pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa chung ngu la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúThe one who is established in the small patience,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la bzod pa chung du'i gnas skabs na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa la sogs pa chen po yin la //
analyzed: de la bzod pa chung du'i gnas skabs na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa la sogs pa chen po yin la //
translated: At the time of lesser patience, the aspects of the adverse side are great,

original: gnyen po'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i yin no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs ni chung ngu'i yin no //
translated: and the aspects of the remedial side are small.üîΩWhen one enters into greater patience, all of these are completely abandoned.

original: bzod pa chen po la zhugs par gyur pa'i tshe 'di dag ma lus par rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro zhes des na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas ba la 'jug par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzod pa chen po la zhugs par gyur pa'i tshe 'di dag ma lus par rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro zhes des na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas ba la 'jug par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in order to teach the entry into the state of utmost joy, it says,

original: 'thob pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i tshul gyis 'jug par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚Äúone should understand that one enters by way of attainment.‚Äù

original: mos pas spyod pha na 'di la bstan pa las bzlog nas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la bar chad de dag thams cad mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pha na 'di la bstan pa las bzlog nas rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa la bar chad de dag thams cad mi 'byung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that on the level of earnest aspiration these are taught in the reverse order, and that on the ground of utmost joy all of these hindrances do not occur,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du zhes bya ba la /
translated: it says, ‚Äúin every way.‚Äù

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa 'thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa 'thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are adverse to the attainment of the state of utmost joy.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi chos rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa'i rnam pa la @267b sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyi gnyen po'i phyogs kyi chos rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa'i rnam pa la @267b sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the aspects of the Joyful Level, etc., which are the remedies for the factors that are incompatible with the teachings as they have been presented, he says:

original: de dag dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Endowed with these, etc.

original: 'on te mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs na yang lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa yod kyang ci'i phyir der rnam par gzhag bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs na yang lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa yod kyang ci'i phyir der rnam par gzhag bar mi bya zhe na /
translated: But if the pure superior attitude exists even in the situation of the stage of action in faith, why is it not posited there?

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Hence he says:

original: yod mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Although it does exist, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du byas pa'i phyir de'i lhag par mos pa de bsam pa dag par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas nyon mongs pa can du byas pa'i phyir de'i lhag par mos pa de bsam pa dag par rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since it is defiled by defilement, that superior attitude is not posited as pure attitude.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: The Joyful Level is not defiled,

original: bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a pure attitude.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i gnas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i gnas pa rdzogs so /
translated: The stage of action in faith is complete.

original: // / khyad par gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: // / khyad par gyi rnam pa la sogs pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Distinguishing the aspects and so on, he says:üîΩWhat are the aspects?

original: rnam pa ni gang dag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa ni gang dag yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: sngon gyi smon lam btang nas sngon med pa'i smon lam yongs su bzung nas rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam btang nas sngon med pa'i smon lam yongs su bzung nas rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir zag pa med pa'i don dam pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid do //
translated: Having given up previous aspirations and taken up new aspirations, he enters the stage of joy, which is taught to be the generation of the uncontaminated ultimate thought of awakening.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gtong ba'i rgyu nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gtong ba'i rgyu nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The cause of giving up previous aspirations is taught:

original: rnam pa bzhis dman ba nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis dman ba nyid de /
translated: inferiority in four ways.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi che ba'i bdag nyid yang dag pa ni lta ba bzhin rtogs pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi che ba'i bdag nyid yang dag pa ni lta ba bzhin rtogs pa las skyes pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The greatness of perfect complete awakening is not born from the realization of the view as it is,

original: byang chub par bya ba'i thabs legs pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub par bya ba'i thabs legs pa rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: and so it is not the realization of the excellent means of awakening.

original: de bzhin du sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ma shes pa'i phyir byang chub kyi thabs legs par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs kyi che ba'i bdag nyid ma shes pa'i phyir byang chub kyi thabs legs par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, because of not knowing the greatness of the means, such as the stages and perfections, they do not understand the means to enlightenment.

original: gzhan la yid ches pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yid ches pa'i dbang gis 'gro ba'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúgoing by the conditions of others‚Äù because they go by the power of trusting in others.

original: rang gis nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag ni dman pa ste /
analyzed: rang gis nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba de dag ni dman pa ste /
translated: They are called ‚Äúuncertain‚Äù because they do not experience it themselves.

original: des na spangs nas zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: des na spangs nas zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: They are inferior, and so it is said to abandon them.

original: sar pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i don dam pa'o //
analyzed: sar pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i don dam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother fresh one‚Äù is the uncontaminated ultimate.

original: rnam pa drug po de las gzhan pa'i dkar bo'o phyogs kyi smon lam thams cad las shin tu 'das pa nyid dang / mtshungs pa med pa nyid dang / 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de las gzhan pa'i dkar bo'o phyogs kyi smon lam thams cad las shin tu 'das pa nyid dang / mtshungs pa med pa nyid dang / 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa nyid dang /
translated: It is said to be ‚Äúbeyond all aspirations for the bright side that are other than those six aspects,‚Äù ‚Äúincomparable,‚Äù ‚Äúhaving a unique result,‚Äù ‚Äúcompletely beyond the domain of all worlds,‚Äù ‚Äúthe domain of the buddhas,‚Äù and ‚Äúthe domain of the bodhisattvas.‚Äù

original: 'gyur ba med pa nyid dang / khyad par du bsgoms pa nyid @268a * //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa nyid dang / khyad par du bsgoms pa nyid @268a * //
translated: 1. unchangeability, 2. special cultivation.

original: do ; / mdor bsdu na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa'i rnam pa ni brgyad du bstan te /üîΩshin tu rnam par nges pa nyid dang / sems bskyed pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pas mngon par bsgrub pa nyid dang / gnas yongs su sbyong ba nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i gnas pa thams cad shes par byed pa dang /
analyzed: do ; / mdor bsdu na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa'i rnam pa ni brgyad du bstan te / shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid dang / sems bskyed pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang / yang dag pa'i smon lam dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pas mngon par bsgrub pa nyid dang / gnas yongs su sbyong ba nyid dang / de las gzhan pa'i gnas pa thams cad shes par byed pa dang /
translated: In brief, the aspects of the stage of extreme joy are taught as eight:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sbyong ba nyid dang / skye ba nying dang / mthu nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su sbyong ba nyid dang / skye ba nying dang / mthu nyid do //
translated: 1. extreme certainty, 2. the four aspects of generating the mind, 3. the accomplishment of the correct aspiration, 4. accomplishment through the exertion of effort, 5. thorough clearing away of the abode, 6. thorough clearing away of the roots of virtue, 7. birth, and 8. power.

original: de la shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni rnam par drug po bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la shin tu rnam par nges pa nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni rnam par drug po bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to that, the teaching from the perspective of extreme certainty is the six aspects of activity and so on.

original: shin tu rnam par des pa ni /
analyzed: shin tu rnam par des pa ni /
translated: Extreme certainty

original: rang gi dbang gis 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi dbang gis 'gro ba'o //
translated: is going by one's own power.

original: rang gi dbang gis 'gro ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde las gzhan pa'i smon lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi dbang gis 'gro ba ni bsgoms pa las byung ba'i phyir ro // de las gzhan pa'i smon lam thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: It is self-powered because it arises from meditation.üîΩIt is beyond all other vows.

original: de dag las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúbeyond‚Äù because it is beyond all other vows.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad dang mi mnyam pas na mtshungs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad dang mi mnyam pas na mtshungs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is incomparable because it is not common to all ≈õrƒÅvakas, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa'i phyir 'bras bu thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is uncommon because the result is immeasurable.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob par rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi rnam pas ni 'jig rten pa yin par snang ba'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal yongs su skyob par rjes su zhugs pa nyid kyi rnam pas ni 'jig rten pa yin par snang ba'o //
translated: It is seen to be mundane because it is engaged in the aspect of protecting all sentient beings from suffering.

original: 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir skye ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad kyi yul las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir skye ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It is known to be supramundane because it transcends the domain of all mundane states.

original: de skad cig gcig tsam skyes pa'i mthu khyad par can yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de skad cig gcig tsam skyes pa'i mthu khyad par can yin par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it has the special power to arise in just one instant, he says:

original: chos kyi rang bzhin de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chos kyi rang bzhin de dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The nature of the Dharma, etc.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid nge /
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid nge /
translated: The nature of the Dharma is the Dharma itself.

original: chos rnams kyi nus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi nus pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The power of the Dharma is the meaning of the term.

original: dkar po'i chos kyi sdug pa'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dkar po'i chos kyi sdug pa'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The immeasurable pleasant results of the wholesome dharmas refers to the homogeneous result.

original: sdug pa'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas ba'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i 'bras bu dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas ba'o //
translated: The immeasurable pleasant results refers to the karmic maturation result.

original: 'gyur ba med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems brjed pas ni yongs su nyams pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur ba med pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba med pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub kyi sems brjed pas ni yongs su nyams pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the immutability, it says, there is no regression. One should understand that regression is due to forgetting the spirit of enlightenment.

original: gzhan dag 'gyur ba ni smon lam yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'gyur ba ni smon lam yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: The other changes are due to giving up one's aspirational prayers.

original: zad mi shes pa @268b nyid bstan pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zad mi shes pa @268b nyid bstan pa ni khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inexhaustibility, it says, it is conducive to the attainment of distinction.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun pa nyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The aspect that is conducive to distinction is twofold:

original: 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du sems can gyi don gyi bya ba nyams su len pas phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du spyod pa dang / rang gi rgyud la 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa byang chub chen po'i bar du bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du sems can gyi don gyi bya ba nyams su len pas phyi ma'i mtha'i bar du spyod pa dang / rang gi rgyud la 'bras bu khyad par du 'phags pa byang chub chen po'i bar du bsgrub pa'o //
translated: one practices until the end of time, by taking up the activity of benefiting sentient beings for as long as cyclic existence lasts; and one accomplishes the exalted result in one's own continuum, up to great enlightenment.

original: sgrub pa de ltar shin tu nges par byas pa'i smon lam shin tu rnam par dag pa de ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa de ltar shin tu nges par byas pa'i smon lam shin tu rnam par dag pa de ni sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: That extremely pure aspiration, which is the determination to be accomplished in that way, is called the generation of the mind of enlightenment,

original: yon tan gyis sems mngon par 'du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyis sems mngon par 'du byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the formation of the mind with the excellence.

original: smon lam yang byang chub don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa nyid yin no //üîΩsems bskyed pa mdor bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: smon lam yang byang chub don du gnyer ba'i rnam pa nyid yin no // sems bskyed pa mdor bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: And the aspiration is the very aspect of striving for enlightenment.üîΩIn brief, the generation of the mind of enlightenment is fourfold,

original: sems bskyed pa de ni mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni bcu tshan bzhis sa bcu'i mdo las shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa de ni mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi ni bcu tshan bzhis sa bcu'i mdo las shes par bya ste /
translated: as it is taught in the Sutra of the Ten Stages.

original: rten nyid dang / dmigs pa nyid dang / rnam pa nyid dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon nyid do //
analyzed: rten nyid dang / dmigs pa nyid dang / rnam pa nyid dang / 'bras bu'i phan yon nyid do //
translated: 1) the basis, 2) the object, 3) the aspect, and 4) the benefit of the result.

original: rten gang las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rten gang las skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: From what basis do they arise?

original: smras pa / ji lta bu dag las skye zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ji lta bu dag las skye zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: from what kind of basis do they arise?

original: ci'i don du skyed par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci'i don du skyed par byed ce na /
translated: For what purpose are they generated?

original: smras pa / ci la dmigs nas skye ba dang // zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ci la dmigs nas skye ba dang // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said: what is the object of observation when they arise?

original: ngo bo nyid ni ji lta bu //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ji lta bu //
translated: What is their nature?

original: rgyu ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is their cause?

original: smras pa / ji lta bu'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / ji lta bu'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said: what kind of characteristics, and so on.

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: From the perspective of the benefit of the result, it is said:

original: phan yon cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan yon cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the benefit?

original: ji lta bu dag las skye bar 'gyur ba mdor bstan par bya ste /üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa tshogs shin tu bsags pa /
analyzed: ji lta bu dag las skye bar 'gyur ba mdor bstan par bya ste / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa tshogs shin tu bsags pa /
translated: How they arise from what kind of basis will be explained in brief.

original: spyad pa shin tu spyad pa /
analyzed: spyad pa shin tu spyad pa /
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, there, for those sentient beings who have accumulated roots of virtue, who have accumulated the accumulations, who have engaged in conduct, who have purified the aspirations, who have been ripened by the buddhas, who have been cared for by spiritual friends, who have great faith and interest, who have great compassion, who have great perseverance, who have great wisdom, who have great merit and wisdom, who have great power of aspiration, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit, who have great power of wisdom, who have great power of merit,

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la shin tu bsnyen bkur byas pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba la shin tu bsnyen bkur byas pa /
translated: (1) they have served well the appearance of the Buddhas;

original: chos dkar po shin tu bsdus pa /
analyzed: chos dkar po shin tu bsdus pa /
translated: (2) they have accumulated well the bright dharmas;

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis shin tu gzung ba /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis shin tu gzung ba /
translated: (3) they have been well taken hold of by the spiritual friends;

original: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa /üîΩlhag pa'i bsam pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bsam pa shin tu rnam par dag pa / lhag pa'i bsam pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: (4) they have a very pure intention;üîΩ(5) they have a vast superior intention;

original: mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: mos pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: (6) they have a vast aspiration;üîΩ(7) they have a vast practice;üîΩ(8) they have a vast realization;üîΩ(9) they have a vast abandonment;üîΩ(10) they have compassion and are full of mercy.

original: snying brtse ba dang / snying rje mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ste bcu po 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: snying brtse ba dang / snying rje mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ste bcu po 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the summary, he says:

original: mdor bsdu na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya @269a * //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams zhes bya @269a * //
translated: In brief, the bodhisattvas are those who have dedicated to complete enlightenment.

original: ba la ; sangs rgyas 'byung ba la shin tu mnyes par byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis shin tu gzung ba zhes bya ba gnyis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: ba la ; sangs rgyas 'byung ba la shin tu mnyes par byas pa dang / dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis shin tu gzung ba zhes bya ba gnyis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Here, the two, ‚Äúthey have served well the appearance of the Buddhas‚Äù and ‚Äúthey have been well taken hold of by the spiritual friends‚Äù are taught by ‚Äúthey have accumulated well the roots of virtue.‚Äù

original: lhag ma rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nges par 'byung ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la nges par 'byung ba zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The remaining perfections are taught by the verse: ‚ÄúThe perfection of patience, the perfection of zeal, the perfection of power, the perfection of meditation, the perfection of wisdom, the perfection of skillful-means, the perfection of vows, the perfection of knowledge, and the perfection of transference.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba shin tu bsags pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la /
translated: ‚Äù The phrase ‚Äúhaving accumulated the roots of virtue‚Äù is a statement.

original: yang de'i bshad pa ni lhag ma dgu yin no //
analyzed: yang de'i bshad pa ni lhag ma dgu yin no //
translated: The remaining nine verses are its explanation.

original: tshul khrims 'khor dang bcad pa la legs par spyad pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'khor dang bcad pa la legs par spyad pa nyid de /
translated: The perfection of morality is the practice of morality together with its attendant factors.

original: tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'o /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'o /
translated: Morality is the restraint of body and speech.

original: de'i 'khor ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pa nas 'dod pa chung ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i 'khor ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la sogs pa nas 'dod pa chung ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Its attendant factors are the restraint of the sense-faculties, etc., up to the practice of fewness of wishes.

original: yang spyad pa shin tu spyad pa zhes bya ba ni legs par spyad pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yin te /
analyzed: yang spyad pa shin tu spyad pa zhes bya ba ni legs par spyad pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'di yin te /
translated: The perfection of meditation is the practice of meditation together with its attendant factors.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni sems rtse gcig pa'o //
translated: Meditation is one-pointedness of mind.

original: de'i 'khor ni zas kyi tshod rig pa nas sgrib pa rnam par sel ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de'i 'khor ni zas kyi tshod rig pa nas sgrib pa rnam par sel ba'i bar du ste /
translated: Its attendant factors are the knowledge of the proper and the improper, etc., up to the knowledge of non-production.

original: nang dang phyi'i g-yeng ba spangs nas dmigs pa la spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩyan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i g-yeng ba spangs nas dmigs pa la spyod pa nyid kyi phyir ro // yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'am /
translated: Because he practices with an object of meditation by abandoning internal and external distractions.

original: ma tshang yang rung /
analyzed: ma tshang yang rung /
translated: The branches are complete or incomplete.

original: dngos gzhi dang nye bar gyur pa ni bsam gtan la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi dang nye bar gyur pa ni bsam gtan la spyod pa'o //
translated: The actual basis and the proximate basis are the practice of concentration.

original: yang bsnyen bkur shin tu byas pa ni thos pa legs par byas pa'i shes pa nyid dang / yongs su bsdus pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas legs par bsdus pa /
analyzed: yang bsnyen bkur shin tu byas pa ni thos pa legs par byas pa'i shes pa nyid dang / yongs su bsdus pa ni bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pas legs par bsdus pa /
translated: Again, very well attended to means the knowledge that is well attended to by listening, and well collected means well collected by the knowledge that arises from reflection.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos nyid do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba'i chos nyid do //
translated: It is the virtuous qualities such as the perfections.

original: yang yongs su bzung bas shin tu bsam pa ni de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba bsgoms pa'i gdams ngag legs par thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang yongs su bzung bas shin tu bsam pa ni de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba bsgoms pa'i gdams ngag legs par thob pa nyid do //
translated: Again, very well contemplated by being well grasped means the attainment of the instruction of the cultivation of application to the realization of thatness.

original: yang bsam pa dag pa shin tu bsam pa ni de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang bsam pa dag pa shin tu bsam pa ni de kho na nyid mngon par rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Very pure intention is the realization of thatness.

original: yang shin tu rgyas pa shin tu bsam pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang shin tu rgyas pa shin tu bsam pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, the extremely vast intention is the very intention to act for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: yang lhag par mos pa shin tu bsam pa ni /
analyzed: yang lhag par mos pa shin tu bsam pa ni /
translated: Moreover, the extremely resolute intention is

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mngon par mos pa nyid de /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la mngon par mos pa nyid de /
translated: the very resolute intention for the knowledge of all aspects.

original: lhag par mos pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni mngon par mos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par mos pa'i 'bras bu nyid ni mngon par mos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of resolute intention is itself resolute intention.

original: yang mngon du gyur pa shin tu bsam pa ni snying brtse ba dang / @269b snying rje mang du gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang mngon du gyur pa shin tu bsam pa ni snying brtse ba dang / @269b snying rje mang du gnas pa nyid de /
translated: Moreover, the extremely manifest intention is the very abundant dwelling in compassion and pity.

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las brtsams pa ni snying brtse ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal las brtsams pa ni snying brtse ba zhes bya'o /
translated: That which begins with the suffering of suffering and the suffering of change is called compassion.

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal las brtsams pa ni snying rje zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal las brtsams pa ni snying rje zhes bya'o //
translated: That which begins with the suffering of conditioned states is called pity.

original: gang yang dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir phyi ma la yang dag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang yang dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir phyi ma la yang dag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate the objective support, he says, ‚Äúin the future, with regard to the perfection of wisdom,‚Äù and so on.

original: bcu tshan gnyis pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i don gzung ba nyid ni dmigs pa rnam pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: bcu tshan gnyis pa'i mdor bsdus pa'i don gzung ba nyid ni dmigs pa rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: The summary meaning of the second set of ten is the five aspects of the object.

original: de la bcu tshan ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la bcu tshan ni 'di yin te /
translated: The ten are as follows:

original: rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par 'dod par bya ba'i phyir dang / stobs bcu'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi 'jigs pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mnyam pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par 'dod par bya ba'i phyir dang / stobs bcu'i stobs thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi 'jigs pa chen po thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos mnyam pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to aspire to the wisdom of the Buddha in all aspects, in order to attain the power of the ten powers, in order to attain great fearlessness, in order to attain the equality of the Buddha's qualities,

original: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i phyir dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / phyogs bcu ma lus par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la thogs pa med par yongs su spyad par bya ba'i phyir dang dus gsum skad cig gcig gis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba'i phyir dang / snying brtse ba dang / snying rje chen po rnam par dag pa'i phyir dang / phyogs bcu ma lus par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad la thogs pa med par yongs su spyad par bya ba'i phyir dang dus gsum skad cig gcig gis khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to protect all beings, in order to have loving kindness and great compassion, in order to attain knowledge of all the ten directions, in order to be unimpeded in all buddha-fields, in order to understand the three times in a single instant,

original: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba la 'jigs pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba la 'jigs pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in order to be fearless in turning the great wheel of the Dharma.

original: de la dang po bzhis ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan te /
analyzed: de la dang po bzhis ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba bstan te /
translated: Among these, the first four show the completion of the accumulations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par mos par gyur na myur du byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la mngon par mos par gyur na myur du byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: When one has become intent on the knowledge of the Buddha, one quickly completes all the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi tshos mnyam pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi tshos mnyam pa nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to ‚Äúin order to attain the equality of the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma.‚Äù

original: gcig gis ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig gis ni sems can rnams kyi don gyi bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: One verse on the completion of the aims of beings.

original: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba zhes bya bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to protect all beings‚Äù

original: gcig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bstan te /
analyzed: gcig gis ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bstan te /
translated: One verse on unexcelled enlightenment.

original: de'i rgyu ni snying brtse ba dang / snying rje yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni snying brtse ba dang / snying rje yongs su sbyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThrough the purification of compassion and mercy‚Äù is the cause of that.

original: gsum gyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o //üîΩrnam pa thams cad dang sangs rgyas dang / chos @270a * //
analyzed: gsum gyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam pa thams cad kyis yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'o // rnam pa thams cad dang sangs rgyas dang / chos @270a * //
translated: Three verses on the perfection of all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: gsum du rnam par gzhag pa la /
analyzed: gsum du rnam par gzhag pa la /
translated: The establishment of the three, the Buddha, the Dharma, and the community,

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs pa'i phrin las can ni dang po ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la gzigs pa'i phrin las can ni dang po ste /
translated: is the function of the Buddha eye‚Äôs observation of the world.

original: phyogs bcu ma lus par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: phyogs bcu ma lus par shes pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In order to attain knowledge of all the ten directions.

original: zhing thams cad yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis thams cad la thogs pa med pa /
analyzed: zhing thams cad yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi ye shes kyis thams cad la thogs pa med pa /
translated: In order to purify all fields, the unobstructed knowledge of a Buddha

original: nyon mongs pa med par sprul pa 'jug pa'i las can te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par sprul pa 'jug pa'i las can te /
translated: has the function of engaging in emanations without afflictions.

original: ye shes ngang sems thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ye shes ngang sems thogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the continuum of consciousness is unobstructed in knowledge.üîΩThis is the second.

original: gnyis pa'o // de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'o // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: All the qualities of a Buddha, etc.

original: rnam pa ma lus par mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes te /
analyzed: rnam pa ma lus par mkhyen pa ni sangs rgyas kyi ye shes te /
translated: Knowledge of all aspects is the knowledge of a Buddha.

original: dus gsum gyi sems can de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal skad cig gcig la mkhyen pa'i las can te /
analyzed: dus gsum gyi sems can de rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal skad cig gcig la mkhyen pa'i las can te /
translated: It has the function of knowing in a single instant the thoughts and latent tendencies of all sentient beings of the three times.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos gsum pa'o //
translated: This is the third quality of a Buddha.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dus gsum skad cig gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum skad cig gcig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three times in a single instant, etc.

original: gcig gis ni sangs rgyas kyi phri na las mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: gcig gis ni sangs rgyas kyi phri na las mdzad pa yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: One is the completion of the deeds of a Buddha.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar dus gcig tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgyar dus gcig tu chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar byed pa'o //
translated: He turns the wheel of the Dharma at the same time in a hundred million Jambudvipas.

original: de'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos kyi 'khor lo chen po rab tu bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúhe turns the great wheel of the Dharma,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig yin zhe na //
translated: What is it like?

original: yang dag par myur du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par myur du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúCorrectly, quickly,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la mdo'i tshig bcu pa gsum pa ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su gzung ba dang / bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam ba bstan pa /
analyzed: de la mdo'i tshig bcu pa gsum pa ni snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba shes rab dang ye shes kyi dbang du gyur pa dang / thabs la mkhas pas yongs su gzung ba dang / bsam pa dang lhag pa'i bsam ba bstan pa /
translated: Among them, the third verse of the sutra is about the teaching of the intention and superior intention, which is preceded by great compassion, is governed by wisdom and knowledge, is taken up by skillful means, and is the cause of the perfection of the Buddha‚Äôs qualities.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa snying brtse ba'i stobs dang / blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam par 'byed pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dpag tu med pa dang ldan pa snying brtse ba'i stobs dang / blo'i stobs kyis shin tu rnam par phye ba'i rnam par 'byed pa dang ldan pa /
translated: He is endowed with the immeasurable powers of the Tathagata, with the power of compassion, and with the power of intelligence, which is the power of discernment.

original: rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa /
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes dang mthun pa /
translated: He is in accord with the wisdom of self-arising.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la shes rab dang ye shes kyi gdams ngag yang dag par tshol ba /
translated: He is the one who seeks the instructions of wisdom and knowledge with regard to all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rgyas pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings shin tu rgyas pa dang / nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs pa /
translated: He is the one who is in accord with the vast realm of phenomena, with the realm of space,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i mur thug pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and with the ultimate limit of the future.

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because he is preceded by great compassion,

original: @270b byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: @270b byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: he is in accord with the entire accumulation of enlightenment.

original: gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba dang mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang gsum pa dang / bzhi pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba dang mthun pa yin no //
translated: The second, third, and fourth [lines] are in accord with the activities of the bodhisattva.

original: lnga pa dang drug pa dang / bdun pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang byung gi ye shes 'thob pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: lnga pa dang drug pa dang / bdun pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rang byung gi ye shes 'thob pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The fifth, sixth, and seventh are in accord with the attainment of the self-arisen gnosis of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: lhag ma gsum ni sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma gsum ni sangs rgyas kyi phrin las mdzad pa dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: The remaining three are in accord with the performance of the Buddha's activities.

original: phan yon gang yin zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: phan yon gang yin zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to what the benefits are, it is said:

original: sems de skyes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems de skyes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By giving rise to that thought... and so on.

original: 'di'i mdo'i tshig rnams kyang mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i mdo'i tshig rnams kyang mdo ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: The words of this sutra are just as they are in the sutra.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byis pa'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byis pa'i sa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa'o //
translated: The stage of the childish bodhisattva is the stage of practice through belief.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sa ni rigs kyi sa ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sa ni rigs kyi sa ste /
translated: The stage of ordinary beings is the stage of lineage.

original: de dag gnyi ga las shin tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga las shin tu 'das pa'o //
translated: They have gone beyond both of those.

original: de las shin tu 'das nas 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa //
analyzed: de las shin tu 'das nas 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam thob pa //
translated: Having gone beyond that, they have attained the noble supramundane path.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngal du zhugs pa bzhin du zhugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pa la zhugs pa yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngal du zhugs pa bzhin du zhugs pa bstan to //
translated: He has entered into the faultlessness of the bodhisattva. This shows that he has entered like one entering the womb.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang po bstan te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang po bstan te /
translated: The first supramundane thought is shown.

original: dang po mngal du 'jug par dang chos mthun pa'o //üîΩrigs su skyes pa yin zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi skye ba dang chos mthun par de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs las skyes pa'i sras yin gyi /
analyzed: dang po mngal du 'jug par dang chos mthun pa'o // rigs su skyes pa yin zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi skye ba dang chos mthun par de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs las skyes pa'i sras yin gyi /
translated: It is similar to the first entry into the womb.

original: mngal nas ni ma yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngal nas ni ma yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: He is born into the family. This shows that he is born into the family of the Tathagata, born from the heart of the Tathagata, not from the womb.

original: mnang smad pa'i skyon med pa yin zhes bya ba ni mo'i rigs kyi skyon las kyang shin tu 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: mnang smad pa'i skyon med pa yin zhes bya ba ni mo'i rigs kyi skyon las kyang shin tu 'das pa yin te /
translated: He is free from the fault of being despised. He is also free from the fault of being a woman,

original: rigs mnyam pa las skyes pa'i bu dang chos mthun par theg pa chen po'i spyod pa nges pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mnyam pa las skyes pa'i bu dang chos mthun par theg pa chen po'i spyod pa nges pa las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and is similar to a son born from a womb of equal caste, because he is born from the practice of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba thams cad las phyir log pa ste /
translated: He has turned away from all worldly paths.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan btang nas gzhan len pa dang chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'gro bar zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba gzhan btang nas gzhan len pa dang chos mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe has entered the supramundane life‚Äù means that he has given up the other life and taken up another, just as one does in the ordinary life.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin to /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa yin to /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is established in the reality of the bodhisattva‚Äù means that he is established in the reality of the bodhisattva.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid can yin pas gzhan gyi bya ba nyid bdag gi bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid can yin pas gzhan gyi bya ba nyid bdag gi bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúHe is compassionate‚Äù means that he is compassionate by nature, and the activities of others are his own activities.

original: bdag gi lus dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag gi lus dang chos mtshungs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúHe is like his own body‚Äù means that he is like his own body.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs la @271a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs la @271a * //
translated: ‚ÄúHe is established in the stage of the bodhisattva‚Äù means that he is established in the stage of the bodhisattva.

original: rab tu gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnas pa las rab tu 'das par bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa yin zhes bya ba ni gnas pa las rab tu 'das par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúHe has transcended the stage‚Äù means that he has transcended the stage.

original: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pa la thabs la mkhas pa ni skyes pa'i gnas skabs dang chos mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba yongs su mi gtong ba dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can yang ma yin pa la thabs la mkhas pa ni skyes pa'i gnas skabs dang chos mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe does not abandon cyclic existence‚Äù means that he does not abandon cyclic existence. ‚ÄúHe is not defiled‚Äù means that he is not defiled by the addictions. ‚ÄúHe is skilled in means‚Äù means that he is skilled in means. ‚ÄúHe is born‚Äù means that he is born in cyclic existence. ‚ÄúHe is not defiled‚Äù means that he is not defiled by the addictions. ‚ÄúHe is skilled in means‚Äù means that he is skilled in means. ‚ÄúHe is born‚Äù means that he is born in cyclic existence.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyis rab tu 'da' bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid du rtogs pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyis rab tu 'da' bar bya ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúHe has realized the equality of the three times‚Äù means that he has realized the equality of the three times. ‚ÄúHe has transcended equality‚Äù means that he has transcended equality.

original: 'das pa la sogs pa la stong pa nyid rjes su zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir skyes nas 'tsho ba la brten ba dang chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa la sogs pa la stong pa nyid rjes su zhugs pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir skyes nas 'tsho ba la brten ba dang chos mthun pa yin no //
translated: Because they are endowed with the noble wisdom that penetrates emptiness, etc., they are similar to those who live by what is born.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni nges par rab tu 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su nges shing rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gzhol ba yin zhes bya ba 'dis ni nges par rab tu 'das pa yin te /
translated: They are certain to belong to the Tathagata lineage and are intent on perfect enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rigs las mi nyams pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mchog tu gzhol ba'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa dang chos mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rigs las mi nyams pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mchog tu gzhol ba'i phyir phun sum tshogs pa dang chos mthun pa yin no //
translated: They are similar to those who are perfect because they do not fall away from the lineage of the Buddhas and are intent on supreme Nirvana.

original: 'di dag las 'das pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag las 'das pa'i phyir so so'i skye bo'i sa las shin tu 'das pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught that they transcend the level of ordinary beings because they transcend these.

original: da ni sa'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyi sgo nas bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni sa'i nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyi sgo nas bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the etymology of the stages will be taught.

original: mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin pa ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba mang ba yin pa ni rab tu dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the stage of the joyous because it is the stage of the abundant joy of the bodhisattvas.

original: ji lta bu'i mchog tu dga' ba zhig gis rab tu dga' ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i mchog tu dga' ba zhig gis rab tu dga' ba yin zhe na /
translated: What is the supreme joy by which he is delighted?

original: mdo nas bstan pa'i bcu tshan gcig gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo nas bstan pa'i bcu tshan gcig gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught by the eleven groups of ten taught in the sutra.

original: de la mchog tu dga' ba'i dga' ba ni sems mgu ba ste /
analyzed: de la mchog tu dga' ba'i dga' ba ni sems mgu ba ste /
translated: Therein, the joy of supreme joy is the delight of mind,

original: yid kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: which is included in the mental faculty.

original: de yang rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Moreover, it is ninefold.

original: dang ba mang ba'i dga' ba ni dkon mchog gi yon tan rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang ba mang ba'i dga' ba ni dkon mchog gi yon tan rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The joy of abundant faith is due to the recollection of the virtues of the Three Jewels.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dang ba mang ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang ba mang ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is abundant faith.‚Äù

original: rab tu dga' ba de nyid mtshon pa'i phyir de shes nas dad pa thob nas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba de nyid mtshon pa'i phyir de shes nas dad pa thob nas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to illustrate that very joy, he says: ‚ÄúHaving understood that, having attained faith.‚Äù

original: dga' ba'i dga' ba ni dmigs pa la dga' bas tshim par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba'i dga' ba ni dmigs pa la dga' bas tshim par gyur pa'o //
translated: The joy of joy is the satisfaction of delighting in the objective support.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: dga' ba mang ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba mang ba yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is abundant joy.‚Äù

original: rangs pa mang ba'i dga' ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i khyad par gyis bskul bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rangs pa mang ba'i dga' ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i khyad par gyis bskul bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The joy of abundant delight is the stimulation by the distinctive clear realization.

original: mgu ba mang ba'i dga' ba ni rang gi lus dang sems kyis bsdus pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do //
analyzed: mgu ba mang ba'i dga' ba ni rang gi lus dang sems kyis bsdus pa'i sangs rgyas nyid do //
translated: The joy of much satisfaction is the state of Buddhahood, which is included in one's own body and mind.

original: dga' rlabs @271b kyi dga' ba ni rang gi lus dang sems la phan pas khyab pa'i //
analyzed: dga' rlabs @271b kyi dga' ba ni rang gi lus dang sems la phan pas khyab pa'i //
translated: The joy of the wave of joy is the pervasion of one's own body and mind with benefit.

original: spro ba mang ba'i dga' ba ni byang chub dang nye bas bskul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spro ba mang ba'i dga' ba ni byang chub dang nye bas bskul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The joy of much delight is the joy of being urged on by the nearness of enlightenment.

original: mi 'khrugs pa mang ba'i dga' ba ni 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa na kun nas mi 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa mang ba'i dga' ba ni 'bel ba'i gtam gtan la 'bebs pa na kun nas mi 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The joy of much imperturbability is the imperturbability of one who is authoritative in settling discussions.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba med ba'i dga' ba ni gzhan yongs su smin par byed cing sems can yang dag par sdud pa'i dus su snying rje dang nges pas gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba med ba'i dga' ba ni gzhan yongs su smin par byed cing sems can yang dag par sdud pa'i dus su snying rje dang nges pas gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'o //
translated: The joy of nonviolence is the protection of the minds of others through compassion and conscientiousness in the work of gathering and maturing others.

original: khong khro ba med pa'i dga' ba ni sems can rnams log pa sgrub pa'i dus su bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khong khro ba med pa'i dga' ba ni sems can rnams log pa sgrub pa'i dus su bzod pa'o //
translated: The joy of nonanger is the patience of one who is working to gather living beings and who is reviled by the ungrateful.

original: mdo'i dang po dang tha ma'i tshig blangs pas ni dga' ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo'i dang po dang tha ma'i tshig blangs pas ni dga' ba'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first and last phrases of the verse are taken as they are in the sutra, in order to indicate the special nature of the joys.

original: shes nas dad pa thob nas mchog tu dga' ba nas khong khro ba med pa'i dga' ba'i bar gyis sems can la nyon mongs pa mi bskyed par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shes nas dad pa thob nas mchog tu dga' ba nas khong khro ba med pa'i dga' ba'i bar gyis sems can la nyon mongs pa mi bskyed par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Having understood, one attains faith, and from supreme joy to the joy of non-anger, it shows that one does not generate afflictions towards sentient beings.

original: ji lta bu'i dga' ba dang ldan pa yin pa de bstan nas /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i dga' ba dang ldan pa yin pa de bstan nas /
translated: Having shown what kind of joy one has,

original: ji lta bu'i dmigs pa la dga' ba skye ba bstan pa'i phyir de la mdo'i tshig gis bstan pa ni rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i dmigs pa la dga' ba skye ba bstan pa'i phyir de la mdo'i tshig gis bstan pa ni rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang /
translated: in order to show what kind of object the joy arises towards, the s≈´tra's words are taught: The bodhisattva who abides in supreme joy has joy towards the blessed buddhas, the buddhadharmas, the bodhisattvas,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par dang / byang chub sems dpa' mi 'phrogs pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnams dang / pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par dang / byang chub sems dpa' mi 'phrogs pa nyid dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag dang / rjes su bstan pa dang /
translated: the bodhisattva practices, the purification of the perfections, the distinctions of the bodhisattva levels, the irreversibility of the bodhisattvas, the instructions and follow-up teachings of the tathƒÅgatas,üîΩand the complete and perfect enlightenment of the buddhas.

original: sems can gyi don yang dag par thob par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba rjes su dran zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don yang dag par thob par byed pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba rjes su dran zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: And they are mindful of the application to the attainment of the true aims of sentient beings and to the attainment of the knowledge of a tathagata.

original: tshig bcu po 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig bcu po 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the ten terms,üîΩin every way means

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: in all ways.

original: yang mdo 'di las ni rim pa gzhan du bstan te /
analyzed: yang mdo 'di las ni rim pa gzhan du bstan te /
translated: In this sutra, the ten topics are taught in a different order.

original: 'dir ni don gyi go rims bzhin du mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir ni don gyi go rims bzhin du mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: Here, the meaning is taught in brief according to the order of the words.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don gyi bya ba zhes bya ba gnyis kyis ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don gyi bya ba zhes bya ba gnyis kyis ni /
translated: The two lines, the bodhisattvas‚Äô activities for the sake of sentient beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod @272a * //üîΩpa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kho na sems can gyi don bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod @272a * // pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to // byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa kho na sems can gyi don bya ba ste /
translated: indicate the bodhisattvas and their activities.

original: gzhan gyi don nyid bdag gis bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid bdag gis bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The activities of the bodhisattvas are the activities for the sake of sentient beings because the benefit of others is what is to be done.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par dang / byang chub sems dpa' mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i khyad par dang / byang chub sems dpa' mi 'phrogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyis ni tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa bstan to //
translated: The three terms ‚Äúperfections,‚Äù ‚Äústages of the bodhisattva,‚Äù and ‚Äúunshakable bodhisattva‚Äù indicate the completion of the equipment.

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni byang chub bstan la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgras ni byang chub bstan la /
translated: The term ‚ÄúBuddha‚Äù indicates enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the term ‚ÄúBuddha qualities‚Äù is

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang zhes bya ba'i sgra nyid kyis bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang zhes bya ba'i sgra nyid kyis bstan to //
translated: indicated by the term ‚ÄúBuddha qualities.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dang / yang dag par thob par byed pa dang / ye shes la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyi don ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa dang / yang dag par thob par byed pa dang / ye shes la 'jug pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba'i tshig gsum gyi don ni /
translated: The three terms ‚Äúinstruction and counsel of the TathƒÅgata,‚Äù ‚Äúrealization,‚Äù and ‚Äúapplication to the knowledge of entry‚Äù indicate

original: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi phrin las sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the accomplishment of the activity of the Buddha.

original: mdo las ni dang por dga' bar bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: mdo las ni dang por dga' bar bya ba bstan to //
