translated: In the s≈´tra, the first is taught in order to delight.

original: 'dir don gyi go rims kyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir don gyi go rims kyis bstan te /
translated: Here, it is taught in order of the meaning.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dang byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don gyi bya ba dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa ni rgya chen po rjes su dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dang byang chub sems dpa'i sems can gyi don gyi bya ba dang / tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa ni rgya chen po rjes su dran par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva and the bodhisattva's activity for the welfare of sentient beings and the completion of the collections are the vastness that is recalled.

original: de dag gnyi ga sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga sngar bstan zin to //
translated: Both of those have already been taught above.

original: de ltar ma 'ongs pa la dmigs nas dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs pa la dmigs nas dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the arising of joy by observing the future,

original: da ltar gyi la dmigs nas dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: da ltar gyi la dmigs nas dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: now, in order to teach the arising of joy by observing the present,

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it says, with a pure superior intention, and so on.üîΩThe words of the sutra are:

original: de'i mdo'i tshig ni phyir zhing mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i mdo'i tshig ni phyir zhing mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Again, he is endowed with supreme joy,üîΩthinking, 'I have turned away from all destinations.'

original: bdag gi 'gro ba thams cad kyi yul las phyir log go zhes bya ba la mchog tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gi 'gro ba thams cad kyi yul las phyir log go zhes bya ba la mchog tu dga' ba skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Supreme joy arises.

original: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar zhugs so zhes bya ba nas bdag ni 'jigs pa dang / dang nga ba dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mchog tu dga' ba skyed par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni sangs rgyas kyi sa dang nye bar zhugs so zhes bya ba nas bdag ni 'jigs pa dang / dang nga ba dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mchog tu dga' ba skyed par byed do //
translated: I am close to the Buddha-stage up to I am free from fear, anxiety, and trembling.

original: dmigs pa byas shing zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir mos pas 'jug pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa byas shing zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir mos pas 'jug pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: In order to show the meaning of having taken the object as objective support, he says by means of resolute engagement.

original: tshig de dag gis bsdus pa'i don ngo bo gcig par bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos 'di myur @272b du yang dag par 'grub pa dang / mthun par bdag nyid yang dag par mthong zhing zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis bsdus pa'i don ngo bo gcig par bstan par bya ba'i phyir chos 'di myur @272b du yang dag par 'grub pa dang / mthun par bdag nyid yang dag par mthong zhing zhes bya ba ni //
translated: In order to show the single essence of the meaning included by those words, he says I see myself as suitable for quickly and perfectly accomplishing this Dharma.

original: bstan ma thag pa'i chos rnams myur du yang dag par 'grub pa dang mthun par bdag nyid mthong ba dang / yul thams cad las phyir log pa nas 'jigs pa dang / dang nga ba dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes bya ba'i bar dang mthun par bdag nyid yang dag par mthong bas mchog tu dga' ba mang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa'i chos rnams myur du yang dag par 'grub pa dang mthun par bdag nyid mthong ba dang / yul thams cad las phyir log pa nas 'jigs pa dang / dang nga ba dang / bag tsha ba dang bral lo zhes bya ba'i bar dang mthun par bdag nyid yang dag par mthong bas mchog tu dga' ba mang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He sees himself as being in accord with the rapid and perfect accomplishment of the qualities just mentioned. He sees himself as being in accord with the absence of fear, anxiety, and trembling, up to the absence of dread, in regard to all objects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba mthong ba dang / dge ba'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa mthong ba dang / byang chub rgya chen po mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis mngon par 'byung ba dang nye bar mthong ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi don bya ba mthong ba dang / dge ba'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa mthong ba dang / byang chub rgya chen po mthong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyis mngon par 'byung ba dang nye bar mthong ba dang /
translated: He sees the benefit of beings, the accomplishment of the stores of merit and knowledge, the greatness of enlightenment, the manifestation of the qualities of a Buddha,

original: zang zing med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mthong bas mtshungs pa med pa dang / bsam pa dag pa'i lus dang sems kyis rjes su bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mthong bas mtshungs pa med pa dang / bsam pa dag pa'i lus dang sems kyis rjes su bsdus pa yin no //
translated: and the absence of material considerations in the activity of a Buddha. He is incomparable in his purity of thought and body.

original: byang chub dang nye ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub dang nye ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that he is close to enlightenment,

original: dge ba'i chos 'bar ba dag dang ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos 'bar ba dag dang ldan no zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he is endowed with the blazing of virtuous qualities, etc.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gcig tu mos pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub la gcig tu mos pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: He has a pure superior attitude, because he is intent only on perfect enlightenment.

original: 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das par mdo nas bstan pa'i cho ga'i rnam pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga las yang dag par 'das par mdo nas bstan pa'i cho ga'i rnam pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: The procedure for transcending the five fears should be understood as it is taught in the scriptures.

original: des bdag med par mthong bas gang zag la bdag med par lta ba legs par bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: des bdag med par mthong bas gang zag la bdag med par lta ba legs par bsgom pa yin no //
translated: Since he sees selflessness, he cultivates well the view of the selflessness of persons.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu 'du shes pa yang mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu 'du shes pa yang mi 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, he does not even have the notion of self,

original: yang bdag tu lta ba 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: yang bdag tu lta ba 'byung bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: so how could he have the view of self?

original: de med pa'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag tu lta ba dang / lus la sred pa yang med de bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba las bdag gir lta ba yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag tu lta ba dang / lus la sred pa yang med de bdag tu lta ba sngon du song ba las bdag gir lta ba yang 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that view does not exist, there is no craving for a body that is preceded by the view of self, because the view of mine arises from the view of self that precedes it.

original: de gnyis sngon du song ba las srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad la chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis sngon du song ba las srid pa dang srid pa'i yo byad la chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the prior existence of those two, there is attachment to existence and to the requisites of existence.

original: de med pas de dag la chags pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med pas de dag la chags pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since those two do not exist, attachment to them also does not exist.

original: de'i phyir de la 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa yang mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the fear of having no livelihood does not arise for him.

original: rnyed pa la sogs pa gzhan la ltos par gyur na tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung na /
analyzed: rnyed pa la sogs pa gzhan la ltos par gyur na tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa 'byung na /
translated: If he were to depend on others for gain and so on, the fear of not being praised would arise.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la sogs pa @273a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lus la sogs pa @273a * //
translated: But the bodhisattva has dedicated his body and so on

original: yang sems can rnams la bsngos pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang sems can rnams la bsngos pa'i phyir /
translated: to sentient beings.

original: de la ltos pa med pas tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ltos pa med pas tshigs su bcad pa med pa'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since he does not depend on others, the fear of not being praised does not arise.

original: bdag tu lta ba dang bral bar bdag gi 'du shes med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag tu lta ba dang bral bar bdag gi 'du shes med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since he is free from the view of self, he has no notion of self.

original: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the fear of death does not arise for him.

original: 'di las shi 'phos par gyur nas nges par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ngan song du 'gro ba'i 'jigs pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di las shi 'phos par gyur nas nges par sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang 'grogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / ngan song du 'gro ba'i 'jigs pa yang med do //
translated: Because after death, he will definitely be reborn in the company of the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas, and he will not be afraid of going to the evil destinies.

original: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad dang 'di bsam pa mnyam pa yang med na lhag pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ma gtogs pa gzhan thams cad dang 'di bsam pa mnyam pa yang med na lhag pa lta ga la yod /
translated: He is not even equal to all the others, much less superior, because they are not equal in intention.

original: thams cad bsam pa ma dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad bsam pa ma dag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: All the others are impure in intention.

original: des na 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na 'khor gyi nang du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, he is not afraid of being criticized in the assembly.

original: de yang mdo nas bstan pa de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba dang / bag tsha ba dang / spu zing zhes bya ba med pa'i zhes bya pa la /üîΩ'jigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de yang mdo nas bstan pa de ltar 'jigs pa dang / dngang ba dang / bag tsha ba dang / spu zing zhes bya ba med pa'i zhes bya pa la / 'jigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: As the S≈´tra declares, ‚ÄúHe is without fear, terror, or trembling.

original: spu zing zhes bya ba'i bar so so'i don rim pa bzhin bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: spu zing zhes bya ba'i bar so so'i don rim pa bzhin bshad par bya ste /
translated: ‚Äù Fear, terror, and trembling should be explained according to their individual meanings.

original: 'jigs pa lnga spangs pa ni 'jigs pa ngang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs pa lnga spangs pa ni 'jigs pa ngang bral ba yin no //
translated: He is without fear because he has abandoned the five fears.

original: chos zab mo ston pa la 'jigs par mi 'gyur ba ni skrag pa dang bral pa'o //
analyzed: chos zab mo ston pa la 'jigs par mi 'gyur ba ni skrag pa dang bral pa'o //
translated: He is not afraid of teaching the profound Dharma.

original: bdag nyid mthong bar gyur kyang bdag la bstod pa med pas khengs pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid mthong bar gyur kyang bdag la bstod pa med pas khengs pa dang bral ba zhes bya'o //
translated: He is not puffed up, for he does not praise himself even when he is seen to be virtuous.

original: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa dang / log par sgrub pa thams cad la zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa dang / log par sgrub pa thams cad la zhe sdang dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: He is free from hatred, for he is not angry at any harm or offense committed by others.

original: de'i phyir spu zing zhes byed pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spu zing zhes byed pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, he is free from the bristling of the hairs of his body.

original: 'jig rten gyi zang zing thams cad dga' ba mi bskyed pas 'du 'dzi la dga' ba spangs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi zang zing thams cad dga' ba mi bskyed pas 'du 'dzi la dga' ba spangs pa ste /
translated: He is free from delight in society, for he is not delighted by any worldly gain.

original: gang yang mdo las bstan pa /
analyzed: gang yang mdo las bstan pa /
translated: And as the sutra teaches,

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa ma nyams pa dang / mi dma' ba zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa ma nyams pa dang / mi dma' ba zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: he is not of low resolve, for he is not discouraged.

original: de'i don bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i don bstan pa ste /
translated: The meaning of that is explained:

original: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: He is not defiled, for he is preceded by great compassion.

original: des na nyams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na nyams pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he is not discouraged.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir phal pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir phal pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is not ordinary because it is very purified,

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not in common with all sentient beings.

original: mdo las gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: mdo las gsungs pa ni /
translated: The sutra states:

original: lhag @273b pa'i bsam pa ma nyams pa dang / mi dma' bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i phyir shin tu brtson par byed de /
analyzed: lhag @273b pa'i bsam pa ma nyams pa dang / mi dma' bas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sdud pa'i phyir shin tu brtson par byed de /
translated: Because of the superior intention that is not damaged and not low, one is very diligent in order to gather all the roots of virtue.

original: yid ces pa'i dbang gi phyir dang zhes byas nas kye rgyal ba'i sras dag su sbyong ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yin te zhes byaüîΩba'i bar du ste //
analyzed: yid ces pa'i dbang gi phyir dang zhes byas nas kye rgyal ba'i sras dag su sbyong ba'i rnam pa 'di lta bu dag dang yang dag par ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba'i bar du ste //
translated: Having said, ‚ÄúBecause of the power of the mind,‚Äù it says, ‚ÄúO children of the Victor, the bodhisattva who is endowed with these kinds of purifications is abiding in the bodhisattva ground Very Joyful.‚Äù

original: mdo'i tshig 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig 'di dag gis bsdus pa'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: These words of the sutra teach the summarized meaning.

original: dad pa dang ldan pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dbang gis tshe 'di la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: dad pa dang ldan pa ni brtson 'grus rtsom par byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis dad pa sngon du 'gro ba'i dbang gis tshe 'di la yang dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad yang dag par sgrub par byed la /
translated: The words of the sutra, ‚ÄúOne who has faith makes effort‚Äù show that through the power of faith coming first, one accomplishes all the roots of virtue in this life and

original: phyi ma la yang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs ba rtsom par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyi ma la yang byang chub sems dpa'i brtson 'grus rnam pa thams cad du yongs su rdzogs ba rtsom par byed do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in the next life one makes effort in the bodhisattva deeds, accomplishing them in every way.

original: sngar bstan pa'i smon lam chen bo bcu bo gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i smon lam chen bo bcu bo gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The ten great aspirations taught above

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pas rab tu sgrub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pas rab tu sgrub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: are accomplished by one who is on the ground of Supreme Joy

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa la gnas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by one who is on the level of earnest aspiration.

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩbsam ba dag pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir // bsam ba dag pa la brten nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: To explain the cause of that, it saysüîΩ‚ÄúBased on a pure attitude.‚Äù

original: bsam pa dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of having a pure attitude,

original: gnas pa 'di la de'i smon lam 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di la de'i smon lam 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: the aspirations are accomplished on this ground

original: bsam pa ma dag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ma dag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not by one with an impure attitude.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i'o //
translated: The first is for the one practicing with devoted interest.

original: de yang dge slong dag pa rnam par dag pa'i sems kyis smon pa ni 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: de yang dge slong dag pa rnam par dag pa'i sems kyis smon pa ni 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: And that is accomplished by the power of the vow of one who is pure, a monk, with a pure mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i dbang du byas pa'i smon lam dang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mchod pa'i 'os yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa'i dbang du byas pa'i smon lam dang po ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid mchod pa'i 'os yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The first vow, in terms of worship of the Tathagata, is for the purpose of showing that the Tathagata himself is the proper object of worship.

original: sems can thams cad kyi mchog yon gyi gnas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi mchog yon gyi gnas /
translated: He is the best of all beings, the recipient of offerings,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa ni chos kyi mnga' bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa ni chos kyi mnga' bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya'o //
translated: because he is the teacher of gods and men, the lord of Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyis pa'o //üîΩde nyid dga' ldan na bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis go rims bzhin du 'jug par byed pa'i @274a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos yang dag par 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas gnyis pa'o // de nyid dga' ldan na bzhugs pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis go rims bzhin du 'jug par byed pa'i @274a * //
translated: The second is in terms of upholding the holy Dharma.

original: dbang du byas pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: dbang du byas pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is in terms of engaging in the stages of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs life in Tu·π£ita Heaven and so on.

original: dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos gnas par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa spyad pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is for the purpose of practicing the bodhisattva deeds in order to preserve the holy Dharma.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i dbang du byas pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is from the point of view of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mthus nye bar 'gro ba'i dbang du byas pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du mthus nye bar 'gro ba'i dbang du byas pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is from the point of view of going by means of power to all the buddha-fields.

original: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i dbang du byas pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba'i dbang du byas pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is from the point of view of purifying one's own buddha-field.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mi 'bral pa'i dbang du byas pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang mi 'bral pa'i dbang du byas pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is from the point of view of not being separated from the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don bya ba'i dbang du byas pa ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth is from the point of view of working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i dbang du mdzad pa ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba'i dbang du mdzad pa ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is from the point of view of manifesting complete enlightenment.

original: 'di dag gi gzhung ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi gzhung ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The texts of these should be understood in accordance with the sutra.

original: mdo las sems can gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa lta bu dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rgyun mi 'chad par bstan pa bzhin du byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i tshe rabs thams cad du bdag gi smon lam 'di dag thob pa dang /
analyzed: mdo las sems can gyi khams gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa rgyun mi 'chad pa lta bu dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rgyun mi 'chad par bstan pa bzhin du byang chub kyi mthar thug pa'i tshe rabs thams cad du bdag gi smon lam 'di dag thob pa dang /
translated: The sutra teaches that just as the continuum of the element of sentient beings is uninterrupted and just as the continuity of mundane phenomena is uninterrupted, in the same way, at the time of attaining enlightenment, these aspirations of mine will be obtained in all one's lifetimes,

original: mi brjed pa dang / mi 'bral ba'i dbang du byas nas 'dir smon lam nyid la smon lam 'debs pa bstan pa'i phyir mdo'i tshig rnams kyis bstan te /
analyzed: mi brjed pa dang / mi 'bral ba'i dbang du byas nas 'dir smon lam nyid la smon lam 'debs pa bstan pa'i phyir mdo'i tshig rnams kyis bstan te /
translated: and in terms of not being forgotten and not being separated, the sutra teaches that aspirations are made in relation to aspirations themselves.

original: de la mdo'i tshig ni mthar thug pa med pa'i gnas bcur mngon par bsgrub ste /
analyzed: de la mdo'i tshig ni mthar thug pa med pa'i gnas bcur mngon par bsgrub ste /
translated: The words of the sutra are taught in terms of ten ultimate bases:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang zhes bya nas /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi mthar thug pa dang zhes bya nas /
translated: The ultimate of the element of sentient beings,

original: ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur cig cas bya ba'i bar la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi rgyud kyi khams kyi mthar thug pa zhes bya ba dang / bdag gi dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di dag kyang mthar thug pa med par gyur cig cas bya ba'i bar la /
translated: up to the ultimate of the element of the continuum of wisdom, and these roots of virtue of mine will be ultimate.

original: thob pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa ni yongs su mi nyams pa'o //
translated: Attainment is not losing it completely.

original: mi brjed pa ni dran pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mi brjed pa ni dran pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Not forgetting is being established in mindfulness.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du smon lam dang mi 'bral ba ni mi 'bral ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du smon lam dang mi 'bral ba ni mi 'bral ba'o //
translated: Not being separated is never being separated from the aspiration, in any way.

original: dad po ni dngos po la smon lam 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: dad po ni dngos po la smon lam 'debs pa'o //
translated: Aspiration is aspiring to the thing.

original: gnyis pa ni smon lam nyid la smon lam 'debs pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni smon lam nyid la smon lam 'debs pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The second is aspiring to the aspiration itself.üîΩThe former is aspiring to the object of aspiration.

original: snga ma ni smon par bya ba'i don la smon pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te 'di dag ni rtsa ba'i smon lam yin no //
analyzed: snga ma ni smon par bya ba'i don la smon pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te 'di dag ni rtsa ba'i smon lam yin no //
translated: These are the root aspirations.üîΩThe others should be known as immeasurable.

original: @274b de las gzhan pa ni dpag tu med par rig par bya'o zhes mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa ni smon lam chen po 'di dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @274b de las gzhan pa ni dpag tu med par rig par bya'o zhes mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas bstan pa ni smon lam chen po 'di dag la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: These great aspirations and so on are taught in accordance with the sutra.

original: chos bcu la kun du spyod pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni phyi ma la ni smon lam gyi stobs skye la /
analyzed: chos bcu la kun du spyod pa'i rgyu bstan pa ni phyi ma la ni smon lam gyi stobs skye la /
translated: The cause of engaging in the ten dharmas is taught as follows. In the future, the power of aspiration arises.

original: tshe 'di la ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa ste /
translated: In this life, one undertakes effort.

original: phyi ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: phyi ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The latter is taught by the verse beginning with ‚Äúand then‚Äù.

original: chos 'di dag gi skye ba'i rim pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos 'di dag gi skye ba'i rim pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of these dharmas should be understood according to the sutra.

original: go rims kyi rgyu bstan pa ni de la re zhig dang por ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: go rims kyi rgyu bstan pa ni de la re zhig dang por ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la mngon par yid ches pa skyes pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: The cause of the order is taught: first of all, faith in the Buddha‚Äôs Dharma arises, which is faith.

original: sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs pa la lta ba ni snying rje'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi sdug bsngal gyi gnas skabs pa la lta ba ni snying rje'o //
translated: The view of the situation of sentient beings‚Äô suffering is compassion.

original: sdug bsngal can la phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa ni byams pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal can la phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa ni byams pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment of benefit for the suffering is love.

original: sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pas bdag nyid la ltos pa med pa ni yongs su gtong ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i bsam pas bdag nyid la ltos pa med pa ni yongs su gtong ba'o //
translated: The thought to protect from suffering, without regard for oneself, is giving.

original: sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la mi skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir bstan bcos thams cad shes par bya ba thob pa dang / yongs su dag par byed pa ni bstan bcos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su tshol ba la mi skyo ba dang skyo ba med pa'i phyir bstan bcos thams cad shes par bya ba thob pa dang / yongs su dag par byed pa ni bstan bcos zhes bya'o //
translated: In order to protect sentient beings, they are indefatigable in seeking the qualities of the Buddha. Because they are indefatigable, they attain and purify the knowledge of all the treatises.

original: 'jig rten ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten ji ltar 'jug pa lta ba bzhin shes pa ni 'jig rten shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten ji ltar 'jug pa lta ba bzhin shes pa ni 'jig rten shes pa'o //
translated: Knowledge of the world is the knowledge of how the world comes into being and how it ceases to be, just as it is.

original: 'jig rten shes par gyur nas dus dang tshod shes pa la sogs pas spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ngo tsha zhing khrel yod pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten shes par gyur nas dus dang tshod shes pa la sogs pas spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / ngo tsha zhing khrel yod pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: Having become knowledgeable about the world, they have perfect conduct through knowing the right time and occasion, etc. They are endowed with a sense of shame and decency.

original: sran thub pa'i stobs bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sran thub pa'i stobs bskyed pas de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They generate the power of patience in order to make offerings to the Tathagatas.

original: yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par blangs nas gnas pa zhes bya ba ni ma thob pa thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: Having taken it up, they abide means that they attain what has not been attained.

original: lan mang du byed do zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams gnas shid 'phel bar byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lan mang du byed do zhes bya ba ni thob pa rnams gnas shid 'phel bar byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The phrase he cultivates them frequently refers to the practice of maintaining and increasing the attainments.

original: gnas pa thams cad la yang lam gyi yon tan te //
analyzed: gnas pa thams cad la yang lam gyi yon tan te //
translated: The phrase in all the stages refers to the qualities of the path.

original: sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase the antidotes to the resistant tendencies of the stages refers to the antidotes to the resistant tendencies of the stages.

original: skyon ni sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
analyzed: skyon ni sa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs so //
translated: The phrase the resistant tendencies of the stages refers to the resistant tendencies of the stages.

original: yongs su tshol bar byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las nyan pa dang / the tshom dri ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol bar byed pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams las nyan pa dang / the tshom dri ba'o //
translated: The phrase he seeks them refers to listening to the teachings from the Buddhas and bodhisattvas and asking questions to resolve doubts.

original: de lta bu ni @275a * //
analyzed: de lta bu ni @275a * //
translated: The phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.

original: yongs su tshol ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba yin no //
translated: The phrase he seeks them refers to the method of seeking.

original: 'dir mdos bstan pa ni /üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nyid kyi rnam pa dang / thos par bya ba dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag dang /
analyzed: 'dir mdos bstan pa ni /üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpas byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po nyid kyi rnam pa dang / thos par bya ba dang / rgyu mthun pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' dag dang /
translated: The phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.üîΩThe phrase in this way refers to the method of seeking.

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams las yongs su btsal bar bya /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen rnams las yongs su btsal bar bya /
translated: He should seek them from spiritual friends.

original: yongs su dri bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: yongs su dri bar bya zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He should ask them questions.

original: de de ltar shes pas sems can gyi 'dren pa phal po che ye shes kyi grong khyer chen por phyin par byed cing /
analyzed: de de ltar shes pas sems can gyi 'dren pa phal po che ye shes kyi grong khyer chen por phyin par byed cing /
translated: Thus, knowing this, he leads many beings to the great city of pristine awareness.

original: byang chub sems dpas yongs su mi skyo bar sa yongs su sbyong ba'i khyad par la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas yongs su mi skyo bar sa yongs su sbyong ba'i khyad par la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should strive to purify the stages without becoming weary.

original: de shes nas kyang zhes bya ba ni lam gyi yon tan dang skyon shes pa'o //
analyzed: de shes nas kyang zhes bya ba ni lam gyi yon tan dang skyon shes pa'o //
translated: Having understood this, he should know the good qualities and faults of the path.

original: bde blag tu zhes bya ba ni dka' ba med par ro //
analyzed: bde blag tu zhes bya ba ni dka' ba med par ro //
translated: He should know the path easily, without difficulty.

original: lam chud mi za ba ni lam gyi yon tan shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam chud mi za ba ni lam gyi yon tan shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He should not waste the path, because he knows the good qualities of the path.

original: de ni don nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni don nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the meaning of that, he says:

original: legs par gzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: legs par gzung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He should properly grasp the path, and so on.

original: legs par gzung ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa nyid kyi lam chud mi za ba'i rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni lam gyi yon tan rnam par shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par gzung ba'i rnam pa la sogs pa nyid kyi lam chud mi za ba'i rnam pa dang zhes bya ba ni lam gyi yon tan rnam par shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The aspect of not wasting the path is due to the very retention of the aspects and so on, because it is for the sake of knowing the qualities of the path.

original: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to teach just that meaning,

original: mtshan ma legs par bzung la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa la sogs pa legs par gzung ba'i phyir lam chud mi za ba'o zhes bya bar /
analyzed: mtshan ma legs par bzung la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rnam pa la sogs pa legs par gzung ba'i phyir lam chud mi za ba'o zhes bya bar /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúHaving well apprehended the sign,‚Äù and so on. Because of well apprehending the aspects and so on, the path is not wasted.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sa'i rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa ni sa dang po las gyen du bskyod nas sa bcu pa'i bar du thob par bya ba la lam du thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sa'i rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa la mkhas pa ni sa dang po las gyen du bskyod nas sa bcu pa'i bar du thob par bya ba la lam du thogs pa med par 'gro ba dang /
translated: O sons of the Victor, in the same way, the bodhisattva who is skilled in accomplishing the aspects of the bh≈´mis, having risen from the first bh≈´mi, goes to the path without impediment in order to attain up to the tenth bh≈´mi.

original: sa shes pa'i snang bas ye shes kyi snang ba yang thob po zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sa shes pa'i snang bas ye shes kyi snang ba yang thob po zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the s≈´tra, ‚ÄúWith the light of knowing the bh≈´mis, he also attains the light of wisdom,‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyis kyang gnas pa thams cad mnan nas zhes bya ba sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis kyang gnas pa thams cad mnan nas zhes bya ba sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúHaving himself ascended all the abodes,‚Äù and so on.

original: ded dpon mkhas pa'i dpe bstan pa nas /
analyzed: ded dpon mkhas pa'i dpe bstan pa nas /
translated: The meaning of the verse is taught from the example of the wise caravan leader

original: 'khor ba'i nags khungs yang ba bgrod dka' ba las brgal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi grong khyer chen po'i bar du phyin par byed cing @275b zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i nags khungs yang ba bgrod dka' ba las brgal te thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi grong khyer chen po'i bar du phyin par byed cing @275b zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: up to the great city of omniscient wisdom.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i ded dpon yang 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas sems can rnams sgrol bar byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i ded dpon yang 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas sems can rnams sgrol bar byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The caravan leader of the great multitude of sentient beings also liberates sentient beings from the wilderness of cyclic existence.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi don bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi don bstan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the aspects and so on should be taught.

original: gang ye shes kyi rnam pas sam bsgom pa'i rnam pas kyang rung sa dang po la 'jug pa de ni rnam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang ye shes kyi rnam pas sam bsgom pa'i rnam pas kyang rung sa dang po la 'jug pa de ni rnam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which enters the first ground by way of the aspect of wisdom or the aspect of meditation is called an aspect.

original: grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the aspect of the path that enters a city.

original: de nyid 'jug pa ni 'thob pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa ni 'thob pa ste //
translated: That very entry is attainment.

original: grong khyer du 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grong khyer du 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like entering a city.

original: zhugs nas kyang 'bras bu chen po'i phan yon 'grub cing yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang 'bras bu chen po'i phan yon 'grub cing yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyong ba'i chos grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And having entered, he accomplishes the great fruit, the benefit, and the perfect accomplishment, which means the accomplishment of the purification of the stage.

original: 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid 'jug par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid 'jug par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment means the establishment of their very entry.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni sangs rgyas mang po bltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni sangs rgyas mang po bltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this bodhisattva stage, the bodhisattva sees many buddhas,

original: lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i don bstan pa ni gnas pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i don bstan pa ni gnas pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: because of the power of his vast vision and his vow. The meaning of the sutra passage is presented in the verse that begins, ‚ÄúIn this abode. ‚Äù

original: snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bltar snang bar zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bltar snang bar zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúHe sees‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúhe sees many buddhas. ‚Äù

original: rgya che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the vastness of that vision,

original: thos pa dad bsam pa'i sgo nas so ;
analyzed: thos pa dad bsam pa'i sgo nas so ;
translated: the verse says, ‚ÄúThrough hearing, faith, and thought. ‚Äù

original: / sems kyis mos pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir thos pa med kyang de lta na 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dbag tu med pa bzhugs so zhes rang nyid mos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / sems kyis mos pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir thos pa med kyang de lta na 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dbag tu med pa bzhugs so zhes rang nyid mos par byed pa'o //
translated: By the aspiration of his mind means that, even though he has not heard it, he himself aspires to the fact that in this way, there are innumerable Buddha-Bhagavats dwelling in the various world-realms.

original: rgya che ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of vastness,

original: dad pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dad pa rgya chen po dang ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, with a mind endowed with vast faith.

original: 'dod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: To aspire means to strive for.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de'i zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dag pa de'i ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de'i zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dag pa de'i ste /
translated: The one who is like that means the one whose intention is pure.

original: sangs rgyas la bskrun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bskrun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: The wholesome roots dedicated to the Buddha means the wholesome roots that are dedicated to the Buddha.

original: de ltar rgya che bas bsdus pa'i rgyu dang po bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgya che bas bsdus pa'i rgyu dang po bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the first cause that is included in vastness,

original: smon lam gyi stobs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the power of vow,

original: de ltar yang sems kyis smon par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de ltar yang sems kyis smon par byed de zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, in this way, he aspires with his mind, and so on.

original: gang du 'byung ba der zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten der zhes bya ba'o //üîΩrnam pa thams cad du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / @276a * //
analyzed: gang du 'byung ba der zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten der zhes bya ba'o // rnam pa thams cad du sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / @276a * //
translated: ‚ÄúWherever it occurs‚Äù means ‚Äúin that world.‚Äù

original: sgrub pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is accomplished in every way‚Äù means that it is included in gain, honor, and practice.

original: bde ba'i yo byad ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad ces mdo nas bstan pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba'i yo byad ces bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byad ces mdo nas bstan pa'i tshig bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe requisites of happiness‚Äù are mentioned in the sutra.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byang gang gis byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'jig rten rnams thun mod du 'gyur ba'i yongs su mkho ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bde ba'i yo byang gang gis byang chub sems dpa' dang / 'jig rten rnams thun mod du 'gyur ba'i yongs su mkho ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The requisites of happiness of the bodhisattva are the necessities that arise from the necessities of the bodhisattva and the world.

original: dge 'dun la yang bkur sti byed do zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi tshogs la bkur sti byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig bstan pas dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang bkur sti byed do zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi tshogs la bkur sti byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig bstan pas dge slong gi dge 'dun dang / byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe also honors the community‚Äù means that he honors the assembly of the community, as stated in the sutra. He makes offerings and serves the community of monks and the assembly of bodhisattvas.

original: chos kyang nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyang nyan pa dang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod nyan pa'o //
translated: And he listens to the Dharma means he listens to the Bodhisattva Canon.

original: 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni brjed pa med par ro //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed do zhes bya ba ni brjed pa med par ro //
translated: He takes it up means he does not forget it.

original: bsgom pa'i sgo nas ni nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i sgo nas ni nan tan gyis sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: By means of meditation he accomplishes it through practice.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chen por yongs su sdo bar byed do zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni der sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag thams cad kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub chen por yongs su sdo bar byed do zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni der sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: And he dedicates all those wholesome roots to the great, supreme, perfect enlightenment means he brings beings to maturity there.

original: don mthun pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don mthun pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words of the Sutra up to ‚Äúhe is one who practices the perfection of wisdom‚Äù show the four means of unification.

original: dpe'i sgo nas de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa de dag rab tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / ci dgar las su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i sgo nas de ltar dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du yongs su bsngos pa de dag rab tu byang ba dang / yongs su dag pa dang / ci dgar las su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, by way of example, it is shown that all roots of virtue are thoroughly dedicated to omniscience, and they become purified, completely purified, and fit for any use.

original: de ltar bstan du zin kyang ngag pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bstan du zin kyang ngag pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though it is shown in that way, in order to teach the cause of that,

original: de'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyu gsum po de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúby those three causes of its purification,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la mchod pa yongs su gzung ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i bar gyis te /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa la mchod pa yongs su gzung ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba dang / byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i bar gyis te /
translated: It is by the thorough acceptance of the worship of the TathƒÅgatas and so on as they have been taught, by the maturation of sentient beings, and by the dedication to enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur gyis ni rab tu byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur gyis ni rab tu byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By the worship and service of the TathƒÅgatas, it becomes purified.

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas ni yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pas ni yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the maturation of sentient beings, it becomes completely purified.

original: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa ni las su rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub tu yongs su bsngos pa ni las su rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: When it is dedicated to enlightenment, it becomes serviceable,

original: de 'thob pa la @276b mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'thob pa la @276b mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is favorable to its attainment.

original: de'i phyir mdo las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar 'dod par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu ji ltar 'dod par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sutra teaches that it should be applied to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, as one wishes.

original: bsgral pa du ma bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi bar du zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i dus chen po nyid bstan to //
analyzed: bsgral pa du ma bye ba khrag khrig phrag 'bum gyi bar du zhes bya ba 'dis ni sa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i dus chen po nyid bstan to //
translated: The phrase, ‚Äúhaving liberated many quintillions of beings‚Äù indicates the great length of time required to purify the stage.

original: dper na zhes bya bas ni dpe ston par byed do //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya bas ni dpe ston par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúfor example‚Äù introduces the simile.

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung khungs nas byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'byung khungs nas byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnaturally occurring‚Äù means that it comes from a mine.

original: gser mgar mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su sbyong ba la ma khas pa'o //
analyzed: gser mgar mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su sbyong ba la ma khas pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa skilled goldsmith‚Äù means that it is well refined.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phal cher 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag por 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa ni de la gnas pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' phal cher 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag por 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa ni de la gnas pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words of the sutra ‚ÄúThe bodhisattvas who dwell there mostly become lords of Jambudvipa‚Äù is ‚Äúthere‚Äù and so on.

original: dbang phyug chen po la dbang rab tu 'thob pa la chos rjes su srung zhing gtong zhing gtong ba chen pos sems can rnams sdud ba'i zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa ni ser sna'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug chen po la dbang rab tu 'thob pa la chos rjes su srung zhing gtong zhing gtong ba chen pos sems can rnams sdud ba'i zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa ni ser sna'i dri ma thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the words of the sutra ‚ÄúHaving obtained mastery over Mahesvara, he protects the Dharma and attracts beings through generosity and great generosity‚Äù is ‚Äúfree from all stains of stinginess‚Äù and so on.

original: sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma zlog pa la mkhas pa yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni ser sna'i dri ma sel ba'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi ser sna'i dri ma zlog pa la mkhas pa yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni ser sna'i dri ma sel ba'i bdag por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of the meaning of the sutra ‚ÄúHe is skilled in removing the stain of stinginess of beings‚Äù is ‚Äúhe becomes the lord who removes the stain of stinginess‚Äù and so on.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i sgo nas bsags pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa mdo nas gsungs pa bstan pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi gang ci rtsom yang rung zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i sgo nas bsags pa'i dge ba yid la byed pa mdo nas gsungs pa bstan pa ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi gang ci rtsom yang rung zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Whatever the four principles for gathering a following are undertaken,üîΩThe mental attention to the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha is taught by the words:

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la byed pa bstan pa ni dkon mchog dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la byed pa bstan pa ni dkon mchog dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Jewels.

original: lhag mas ni byang chub yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mas ni byang chub yang dag par 'grub pa'i rnam pa thams cad du rtogs pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The remaining [lines] are mental attention to the realization of all aspects of the accomplishment of enlightenment.üîΩIn order to teach the meaning of these mental attentions, [the text] says:

original: yid la byed pa 'di dag gi don bstan pa'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yid la byed pa 'di dag gi don bstan pa'i phyir bdag sems can thams cad kyi mchog ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: I am the foremost of all sentient beings, and so on.

original: 'di ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la byed par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la byed par shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as mental attention to the ultimate Buddha and so on.

original: gang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos nyid yid la byed pas gang yang bdag gis sbyin par bya'o //üîΩ'di la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gang sangs rgyas la sogs pa'i chos nyid yid la byed pas gang yang bdag gis sbyin par bya'o // 'di la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: By means of mental attention to the reality of the Buddha and so on, one should give everything.üîΩHere, one should give.

original: 'di sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di sbyin par bya'o //
translated: This should be given.

original: 'di'i don du sbyin par bya'o zhes rlom sems med pa'o //üîΩde lta na yang @277a * //
analyzed: 'di'i don du sbyin par bya'o zhes rlom sems med pa'o // de lta na yang @277a * //
translated: For this purpose, I will give.

original: las thams cad la yang byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / bya bar rlom sems med par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las thams cad la yang byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / bya bar rlom sems med par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is shown that in all actions, one should be free of the conceit of an agent, an action, an instrument, and an object.

original: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang byang chub tu yongs su sngo bar byed do //
translated: And all of them are dedicated to enlightenment.

original: de la mchog ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mchog ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, supremacy is twofold:

original: mchog nyid ni yon tan rab tu 'bar ba nyid do //
analyzed: mchog nyid ni yon tan rab tu 'bar ba nyid do //
translated: Supremacy is the state of having the most excellent qualities.

original: gtso bo nyid ni gnyis pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gtso bo nyid ni gnyis pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Superiority is the state of being without a second.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: mchog tu 'gyur /
analyzed: mchog tu 'gyur /
translated: One becomes supreme,

original: gtso bor 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtso bor 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one becomes superior.

original: mchog nyid kyi rnam pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: mchog nyid kyi rnam pa yang gnyis te /
translated: Supremacy is also twofold:

original: phul du gyur pa ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phul du gyur pa ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The best is the state of having the most excellent wisdom.

original: dam par 'gyur ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam par 'gyur ba ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest is the state of having the most excellent abandonment.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /üîΩphul du 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / phul du 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, it is said:üîΩOne becomes the best,

original: dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: dam par 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: one becomes the highest.

original: gtso bo yang rnam pa gnyis nyid da /
analyzed: gtso bo yang rnam pa gnyis nyid da /
translated: The principal is also twofold.

original: rab mchog tu gyur pa nyid ni de dang mnyam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab mchog tu gyur pa nyid ni de dang mnyam pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the best because it is without equal.

original: gong mar gyur pa nyid ni de'i gong na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong mar gyur pa nyid ni de'i gong na gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the highest because there is nothing higher than it.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rab mchog tu 'gyur gong mar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rab mchog tu 'gyur gong mar 'gyur zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is the best and the highest.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rton pa'i bar du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don thams cad rtogs par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la rton pa'i bar du 'gyur zhes bya ba ni don thams cad rtogs par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam mo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Up to relying on the knowledge of a knower of all aspects means thinking, ‚ÄúHow good it would be if I could realize all objects!‚Äù

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa'i rnam par smin pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par bstan to //
translated: Thus the special benefits of the result of bodhisattvas‚Äô retention of the ripening of their householder state have been taught.

original: yang rab tu byung ba rnams kyis ni bsam gtan gtsor byed pa'i las te //
analyzed: yang rab tu byung ba rnams kyis ni bsam gtan gtsor byed pa'i las te //
translated: For those who have gone forth, the action is primarily meditative concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang ting de 'dzin gyi las so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang ting de 'dzin gyi las so //
translated: It is the action of meditative concentration and meditative absorption.

original: ting nge 'dzin ni skad cig gcig la ting nge 'dzin brgya thob pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin ni skad cig gcig la ting nge 'dzin brgya thob pa'o //
translated: Concentration is the attainment of a hundred concentrations in a single moment.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: 'dod na yud tsam cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod na yud tsam cig la ting nge 'dzin brgya la snyoms par 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf he wishes, in an instant he can enter a hundred concentrations.‚Äù

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi las ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi las ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The action of concentration is that by which he sees a hundred Buddhas, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brgya mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du khyab pa'i lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brgya mthong ba dang zhes bya ba la sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad du khyab pa'i lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ngo //
translated: He sees the TathƒÅgatas in all the Buddha-fields with the divine eye that pervades all the Buddha-fields.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni sprul pas byin gyis rlob pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' de dag gis byin gyis brlabs pa ni sprul pas byin gyis rlob pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas and bodhisattvas bless him with their blessings, and he blesses with his emanations.

original: 'jig rten gyi @277b khams brgya yang g-yo bar byed ces bya ba ni sems can rnams bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi @277b khams brgya yang g-yo bar byed ces bya ba ni sems can rnams bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He causes a hundred world-realms to shake, in order to gather beings.

original: lus kyis kyang 'gro bar byed pa ni 'gro ba dang snang ba dag gis so //
analyzed: lus kyis kyang 'gro bar byed pa ni 'gro ba dang snang ba dag gis so //
translated: And by the body, because of going and illumination.

original: song nas snang par byas pas kyang yongs su smin bar byed do //
analyzed: song nas snang par byas pas kyang yongs su smin bar byed do //
translated: Having gone, he ripens by means of illumination.

original: sprul pa brgyas 'dul ba'i sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa ni skye ba'i khyad par gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa brgyas 'dul ba'i sems can brgya yongs su smin par byed pa ni skye ba'i khyad par gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The ripening of a hundred beings to be disciplined by a hundred emanations is included in the special birth.

original: gnas par byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgya la sogs par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas par byin gyis rlob pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa brgya la sogs par gnas pa'o //
translated: The consecration of the abode is the abiding for a hundred eons, etc.

original: bskal pa brgyar yang ye shes mthong ba 'jug go zhes bya ba ni skye pa'i khyad par gyis yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: bskal pa brgyar yang ye shes mthong ba 'jug go zhes bya ba ni skye pa'i khyad par gyis yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: The penetration of the vision of intuition for a hundred eons is included in the special birth.

original: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams sdig pa spong du 'jug pa'i dbang du byas nas las dang 'gro ba nye bar bstan pas skye ba snga ma'i rgyu'i nye par tshogs pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams sdig pa spong du 'jug pa'i dbang du byas nas las dang 'gro ba nye bar bstan pas skye ba snga ma'i rgyu'i nye par tshogs pa shes par bya ste /
translated: The past and future is the knowledge of the proximate assemblage of causes in former lives, on the part of beings who are being caused to abandon evil, by the teaching of karma and destiny.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is for the sake of generating future roots of virtue.

original: chos kyi sgo brgya yang rab tu rnam par 'byed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sgo brgya yang rab tu rnam par 'byed do zhes bya ba ni rang gi blo yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: He also opens a hundred Dharma doors means for the sake of ripening one's own mind.

original: phung po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: The aggregates, etc. refers to the teachings of the noble Aksayamati and so on.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams don mang po myur du byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams don mang po myur du byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that bodhisattvas quickly accomplish many goals,

original: lus brgya yang sprul par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus brgya yang sprul par byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: he emanates a hundred bodies and so on.

original: smon lam dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: smon lam dang ye shes kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par gang yin pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the special benefits of the results of aspiration and wisdom,

original: 'di las lhag par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di las lhag par yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it is said more than this and so on.

original: de dag kyang dpag tu med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag kyang dpag tu med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that those are also immeasurable,

original: smon lam de dag gi grangs ni bcad par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam de dag gi grangs ni bcad par sla ba ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said the number of those aspirations is not easy to determine and so on.

original: yang gnas pa 'di'i mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ni de'i rnam pa ni rnam pa brgyad de gzhung las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yang gnas pa 'di'i mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ni de'i rnam pa ni rnam pa brgyad de gzhung las shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this abiding is summarized in its aspects, which should be understood from the text as eight in number.

original: mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa'i bye brag bcu ni sa bcu dang mthun par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gnas pa'i bye brag bcu ni sa bcu dang mthun par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The ten types of abiding of the bodhisattvas who have attained realization are taught in accord with the ten stages.

original: sa bcu'i mdo sde las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩyongs su gzung ba'i don gyis ni sa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'jig rten pa yin pa ltar de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang @278a * //
analyzed: sa bcu'i mdo sde las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // yongs su gzung ba'i don gyis ni sa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'jig rten pa yin pa ltar de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang @278a * //
translated: As it is said in the sutra, ‚Äújust as it is taught in the Sutra of the Ten Stages.‚Äù

original: chos de dag gis yongs su gzung ba yin no zhes byas nas te /üîΩgnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos de dag gis yongs su gzung ba yin no zhes byas nas te / gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of stage is that just as the world is sustained by the four continents, so the bodhisattva is sustained by these dharmas.

original: nye bar longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi don gyis sa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyod pa'i gnas kyi don gyis sa ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The meaning of stage is that of a basis for the enjoyment of the fruits of the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du chos de dang de la gnas pas bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos de dang de la gnas pas bde bar gnas pa gang yin pa de ni gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the state of abiding is that by which one abides in bliss in this and that spiritual state.

original: yang na bde bar gnas ba'i don gyis ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bzhin nam dka' thub kyi gnas bzhin du gnas kyi don du blta'o //
analyzed: yang na bde bar gnas ba'i don gyis ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa bzhin nam dka' thub kyi gnas bzhin du gnas kyi don du blta'o //
translated: Or else, the meaning of abiding should be understood as the meaning of dwelling in bliss, like the dwelling in the bliss of the present life, or like the dwelling of an ascetic.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa'o //
translated: The state of joy.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la yang dag par brten nas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas pa gnyis pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam la yang dag par brten nas tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas pa gnyis pa rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with clear realization should establish the second state on the basis of the supramundane path, taking the purity of morality as its subject matter.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This purity of morality is twofold in brief:

original: kun nas slong bas dag pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas slong bas dag pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis dag pa'o //
translated: pure in its motivation and pure in its substance.

original: de la kun nas slong bas dag pa ni sems kyi bsam pa bcus bstan to //
analyzed: de la kun nas slong bas dag pa ni sems kyi bsam pa bcus bstan to //
translated: The purity of motivation is indicated by ten mental dispositions.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Purity by nature is threefold:

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint, the morality of acquiring virtuous factors, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i tshul khrims ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam bstan pa'o //
translated: The morality of restraint is taught in the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: de nyid ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims rnam par dag pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the purity of the morality of restraint.

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gnyis pa ni de'i gong du yang de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par bsgrub tu 'dra ba las rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes de las shas cher de 'di
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa gnyis pa ni de'i gong du yang de lta bas na bdag gis mngon par bsgrub tu 'dra ba las rnam pa thams cad du yongs su sbyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes de las shas cher de 'di
translated: The second purity of morality is taught in the verse beginning with ‚Äúsince it is the same in the future as it is now, I should strive to purify and accomplish it in every way.‚Äù

original: ltar yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mdo nas bstan pa'i cho gas bstan pa yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltar yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba'i bar gyis mdo nas bstan pa'i cho gas bstan pa yin no zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, he trains himself correctly, up to ‚Äúin this way, he should know that it is taught by the method taught in the sutra.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gsum pa ni de'i yang gong du de sems can rnams la phan pa'i sems nyid dang / bde ba'i sems nyid dang zhes bya ba nas ston pa'i sems nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi tshig bcus bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la gsum pa ni de'i yang gong du de sems can rnams la phan pa'i sems nyid dang / bde ba'i sems nyid dang zhes bya ba nas ston pa'i sems nyid ces bya ba'i bar gyi tshig bcus bstan pa yin no //
translated: the mind of benefit, the mind of happiness, and so on up to the mind of teaching, which are higher than the previous three.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims ma lus pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas @278b rnam par gzhag pa brgyad du bstan te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims ma lus pa'i dbang du byas nas gnas @278b rnam par gzhag pa brgyad du bstan te /
translated: The eight points are taught in terms of the whole of superior morality.

original: rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma thams cad bral ba nyid dang / las kyi lam thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu shes pas so sor rtogs pa nyid dang / dge ba'i las la gzhan dag yang dag par 'gong pa la dga' pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma thams cad bral ba nyid dang / las kyi lam thams cad kyi rgyu dang 'bras bu shes pas so sor rtogs pa nyid dang / dge ba'i las la gzhan dag yang dag par 'gong pa la dga' pa nyid dang /
translated: The absence of all stains of immorality due to possessing natural morality, the thorough understanding of all the paths of action through knowledge of their causes and effects, the delight in correctly encouraging others to virtuous actions, the delight in the confession of immorality, the delight in the rejoicing in the virtuous roots of all beings, the delight in the request to the Buddhas to turn the wheel of the Dharma, the delight in the supplication to the Buddhas not to pass into Nirvana, the delight in the dedication of virtuous roots to supreme enlightenment, and the delight in the correct view of the knowledge of the means of attaining all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: snying brtse ba rgya chen por rab tu thob pa nyid dang // sems can gyi khams kyi las las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba la rnam par blta ba nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa nyid dang / skye ba nyid dang /
analyzed: snying brtse ba rgya chen por rab tu thob pa nyid dang // sems can gyi khams kyi las las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyis mnar ba la rnam par blta ba nyid dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa nyid dang / skye ba nyid dang /
translated: He has attained great compassion, he sees the torment of the realm of sentient beings by the suffering born of karma, he has pure roots of virtue, he is born in the family of the Tathagata, and he has power.

original: mthu dbye ba nyid do //
analyzed: mthu dbye ba nyid do //
translated: The divisions of power.

original: thog ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma nyid du zhes bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: At the very outset means at the stage of The Utterly Joyful One.

original: gnas pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos kyi rim pa smras pa /
analyzed: gnas pa gnyis pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos kyi rim pa smras pa /
translated: The Dharma stages in the second stage are stated:

original: sems kyi bsam pa rnam pa bcus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa rnam pa bcus zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: By means of the ten kinds of mental orientation, etc.

original: bsam pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis bsam pa rnam par dag pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa rnam pa bcu po 'di dag gis bsam pa rnam par dag pa chen po thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By means of these ten kinds of orientation, he attains the great purity of orientation.

original: de thob pas gnas gnyis pa rnam par gnon par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de thob pas gnas gnyis pa rnam par gnon par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: By attaining it, he attains the second stage, The Stainless.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang po la legs par yongs su sbyang ba byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gnyis pa la mngon par 'dod pa yin te /
translated: O sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who has thoroughly purified the first bodhisattva stage and is intent on the second bodhisattva stage

original: de'i sems la bsam pa rnam pa bcu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i sems la bsam pa rnam pa bcu 'byung ngo //
translated: has ten mental attitudes.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta lte /
analyzed: 'di lta lte /
translated: They are
