original: drang po'i bsam pa nyid dang / 'jal ba'i bsal pa nyid dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / dul ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / zhi ba'i bsam pa nyid dang ; dge ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / ma 'dres pa'i bsam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: drang po'i bsam pa nyid dang / 'jal ba'i bsal pa nyid dang / las su rung ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / dul ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / zhi ba'i bsam pa nyid dang ; dge ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / ma 'dres pa'i bsam pa nyid dang /
translated: the attitude of honesty, the attitude of evaluation, the attitude of suitability, the attitude of self-control, the attitude of peace, the attitude of virtue, the attitude of non-mixture,üîΩthe attitude of non-regard, the attitude of greatness, and the attitude of superiority.

original: mi lta ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / rlabs po che'i bsam pa nyid dang / che ba nyid kyi bsam pa nyid dang / sems kyi bsam pa bcu po de dag 'byung ste /
analyzed: mi lta ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / rlabs po che'i bsam pa nyid dang / che ba nyid kyi bsam pa nyid dang / sems kyi bsam pa bcu po de dag 'byung ste /
translated: These are the ten mental attitudes.

original: des nas gnyis pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des nas gnyis pa la gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he will stand on the second stage.

original: de dag gi don bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de dag gi don bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i lhag pa'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The bodhisattva's superior attitude is considered to be irreproachable,üîΩsincere,üîΩgentle,üîΩand serviceable.

original: sgyu dang g-yos slob dpon la sogs pa la mi slu ba nyid ni drang po'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yos slob dpon la sogs pa la mi slu ba nyid ni drang po'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The bodhisattva's superior attitude is considered to be irreproachable, because it is not deceptive toward the master, etc.,

original: chos mthun pa nyid yin @279a * //
analyzed: chos mthun pa nyid yin @279a * //
translated: It is sincere, because it is not hypocritical.

original: bas 'grogs na bde ba'i phyir 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: bas 'grogs na bde ba'i phyir 'jam pa'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: It is gentle, because it is pleasant to be with.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams zil gyis mnan nas de'i gnyen po'i phyogs la gnas par gyur pas na las su rung ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi las rnams zil gyis mnan nas de'i gnyen po'i phyogs la gnas par gyur pas na las su rung ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
translated: It is serviceable, because it is not overcome by the activities of the afflictions, secondary afflictions, and Mara, and it is established in the side of their antidotes.

original: dge ba'i chos sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i sems nyid kyis de'i sgom pa dang 'tsham pa ni las su rung ba'i bsam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sgom pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i sems nyid kyis de'i sgom pa dang 'tsham pa ni las su rung ba'i bsam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The mind that is not overcome by the resistances to the cultivation of the virtues is called serviceable, because it is suitable for the cultivation of virtue.

original: 'du byed thams cad kyi nyes dmigs mthong ba'i bsam pa nyid ni dul ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad kyi nyes dmigs mthong ba'i bsam pa nyid ni dul ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
translated: The very thought of seeing the faults of all compounded things is the very thought of self-control.

original: de dag las yid byung bar gyur nas dul bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: de dag las yid byung bar gyur nas dul bar 'gyur ro zhes byas nas so //
translated: Having become disgusted with them, one becomes self-controlled.

original: 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i rnam par mthong ba ni zhi ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi ba'i rnam par mthong ba ni zhi ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The very thought of seeing nirvana, the pacification of all compounded things, as peace is the very thought of peace.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa'i bsam pa ni dge ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams rtag tu bsgom pa'i bsam pa ni dge ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The very thought of always cultivating the factors of enlightenment is the very thought of virtue.

original: de dag bsgom pa la rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu dben pa'i bsam pa nyid ni ma 'dres ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag bsgom pa la rjes su mthun pa'i rab tu dben pa'i bsam pa nyid ni ma 'dres ba'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: The very thought of solitude that is conducive to their cultivation is the very thought of non-attachment.

original: 'du 'dzi kun du spyod pa'i ring du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi kun du spyod pa'i ring du spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the avoidance of the conduct of crowds.

original: khyim pas ni 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams dang / 'byor pa'i khyad par rnams la mi lta ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / rab tu byung ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pas ni 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams dang / 'byor pa'i khyad par rnams la mi lta ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / rab tu byung ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi lta ba'i bsam pa ste /
translated: The householder has the intention of not looking at the excellences of the sense objects and the excellences of wealth. The renunciate has the intention of not looking at gain and honor.

original: de ltar na lus dang gnas dang longs spyod la mi lta ba'i bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lus dang gnas dang longs spyod la mi lta ba'i bsam pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has the intention of not looking at body, place, and possessions.

original: theg pa dman pa spangs te /
analyzed: theg pa dman pa spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the Lesser Vehicle,

original: theg pa chen po la mos pa nyid ni rlabs po che'i bsam pa nyid do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la mos pa nyid ni rlabs po che'i bsam pa nyid do //
translated: he has the intention of the Great Vehicle, which is the intention of greatness.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i bsam pa nyid ni che ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i bsam pa nyid ni che ba'i bsam pa nyid de /
translated: He has the intention of working for the benefit of all sentient beings, which is the intention of magnanimity,

original: gzhan gyi don nyid bdag gi don du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid bdag gi don du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he makes the benefit of others his own benefit.

original: sems de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang po'i smon lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i sems so //
analyzed: sems de la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni gnas pa dang po'i smon lam gyis rab tu phye ba'i sems so //
translated: The thought of entering that is the thought of the first stage, distinguished by the vow.

original: de la gnas nas bsam pa 'dir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gnas nas bsam pa 'dir 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having remained there, he enters this intention.

original: de'i dbang gis bsam pa dag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis bsam pa dag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: By its power, he is said to have a pure intention.

original: che ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni sgom pa rab kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: che ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba ni sgom pa rab kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Because of its greatness means because it is the culmination of the highest meditation.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis 'phel ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis 'phel ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: Its intrinsic nature is its perfection.

original: rab tu dga' ba nyid kyis gnyis pa la 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba nyid kyis gnyis pa la 'jug pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By means of the second, he attains the entry to the second stage, the Joyous, because of the purity of his superior attitude.

original: rang @279b bzhin gyis tshul khrims 'chal ba kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can yin no //
analyzed: rang @279b bzhin gyis tshul khrims 'chal ba kun du spyod pa med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can yin no //
translated: He is naturally moral because he does not engage in immoral conduct by nature.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: chung ngu yang kun du mi spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: chung ngu yang kun du mi spyod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: If he does not engage in even the slightest, etc.

original: las kyi lam chung ngu ni de la kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags rnams la rnam par 'tsho bar mi byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi dge pa'i las kyi lam bcu'i mthar thug par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las kyi lam chung ngu ni de la kun du rtog pa tsam gyis kyang srog chags rnams la rnam par 'tsho bar mi byed na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi dge pa'i las kyi lam bcu'i mthar thug par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The path of action is slight if he does not engage in the ten unwholesome courses of action even by way of imagination, etc.

original: 'bring ngam chen po lta ci smos zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bring ngam chen po lta ci smos zhes bya ba la sogs pas kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: What need is there to speak of the middling or great?

original: dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu yongs su rdzogs pa dag la yang skye ba thams cad du snang ngo //
analyzed: dge ba'i las kyi lam bcu yongs su rdzogs pa dag la yang skye ba thams cad du snang ngo //
translated: The ten virtuous actions are also seen in all the births of those who have completed the ten virtuous actions.

original: de la mdo'i tshig ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la mdo'i tshig ni 'di yin te /
translated: The words of the sutra are:

original: sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar de
analyzed: sa dri ma med pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba nas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun la bsam pa nges pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar de
translated: The bodhisattva who is on the stainless stage is endowed with the ten virtuous actions by nature, up to: he is certain in his intention regarding the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Sa·πÖgha.

original: dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: rang bzhin gyis yang dag par snang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yang dag par snang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: They are seen by nature.

original: de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsrung zing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par bsrung zing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He always and uninterruptedly protects these ten virtuous actions, up to:

original: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa ni des de ltar rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gshin rje'i 'jig rten gyi 'gro ba yod par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa ni des de ltar rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims can gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of the passage from ‚ÄúThus, he who is naturally moral‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe should understand the presentation of the results of actions‚Äù has been explained.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni ngan 'gro rnams dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni ngan 'gro rnams dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe afflicted‚Äù refers to the miserable realms.

original: ngan song gsum mo //
analyzed: ngan song gsum mo //
translated: The miserable realms are the three lower miserable realms.

original: chung ngu la sogs pa rtsom pa'i las kun du spyod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bya ba rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chung ngu la sogs pa rtsom pa'i las kun du spyod pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bya ba rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHe should understand the presentation of the results of actions‚Äù means that he should understand the presentation of the results of actions that are performed by those who are afflicted and those who are not afflicted.üîΩThe meaning of the passage from ‚ÄúOne should understand that there are beings who are born up to the peak of existence due to the cause of taking up the path of the ten virtues‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe should understand the presentation of the results of actions‚Äù has been explained.

original: yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa ni bde 'gro rnams zhes bya ste /üîΩde'i rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus ni srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du skye ba yod par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa ni bde 'gro rnams zhes bya ste / de'i rnam par gzhag pa rab tu shes par bya'o ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe happy realms‚Äù refers to the higher realms.üîΩ‚ÄúHe should understand the presentation of the results of actions‚Äù means that he should understand the presentation of the results of actions that are performed by those who are not afflicted and those who are not afflicted.

original: / de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: / de'i gong du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag nyi tshe ba'i sems dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúAbove that, he should understand the presentation of the results of actions that are performed by those who are not afflicted and those who are not afflicted, and by those who are both afflicted and not afflicted, and by those who are neither afflicted nor not afflicted.‚Äù

original: rnam pa thams cad yongs su spyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gi don bstan pa ni /üîΩtheg pa gsum po rnam par gzhag @280a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad yongs su spyang zhing mngon par bsgrub pa nyid la brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gi don bstan pa ni / theg pa gsum po rnam par gzhag @280a * //
translated: One should strive to completely purify and accomplish all aspects.

original: pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of these is taught by ‚Äúone understands the presentation of the three vehicles.‚Äù

original: de bas kyang shas cher 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Even more, one trains correctly in this way, up to

original: de ltar na mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po tshad med pa sdud par 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way, these ten unwholesome courses of action lead to the great mass of suffering, to immeasurable suffering.

original: bdag gis mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag spangs te /
analyzed: bdag gis mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam 'di dag spangs te /
translated: I will abandon these ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: chos kyi kun dga' bas dga' bar gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' bas dga' bar gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: I will abide in delight through the joy of the Dharma.‚Äù

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i zhes bya ba smras pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is taught by ‚Äúthe ripened result and the result that corresponds to the cause.‚Äù

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni chen po dang / 'bring dang chung ngu'i rgyu las dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yid gags rnams su skye'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni chen po dang / 'bring dang chung ngu'i rgyu las dmyal ba dang / byol song dang / yid gags rnams su skye'o //
translated: The ripened result is birth in the hells, as an animal, or in the world of Yama, from a great, middling, or small cause.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas mi'i nang du skyes nas kyang tshe thung ba dang / sgyu dang g-yo la sogs pas spyod pa'i bar ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas mi'i nang du skyes nas kyang tshe thung ba dang / sgyu dang g-yo la sogs pas spyod pa'i bar ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: Then, after death and transmigration, even if born among humans, one has a short life and is deceitful, fraudulent, and so on. This is the result that corresponds to the cause.

original: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas shing gzhan rnams kyang de dag nyid la rab tu dgong ngo zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la gnas shing gzhan rnams kyang de dag nyid la rab tu dgong ngo zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúI myself will abide in the path of the ten wholesome courses of action and will inspire others to take them up‚Äù is the teaching on the opposite meaning.

original: bdag nyid kyang mi dge ba'i las spong ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang mi dge ba'i las spong ba dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúI myself will abandon unwholesome actions‚Äù and so on up to

original: yang dag par 'dzud par yang byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzud par yang byed do zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI will inspire others to take them up‚Äù is the teaching on the opposite meaning.

original: de'i gong du shas cher phan pa'i sems nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i gong du shas cher phan pa'i sems nyid dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúAbove all, with a mind of great benefit‚Äù and so on up toüîΩ‚ÄúI will inspire others to take them up‚Äù is the teaching on the opposite meaning.

original: bla na med pa'i theg po chen pa la dgod par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa ni /üîΩlas mi mthun pa kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bla na med pa'i theg po chen pa la dgod par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa ni / las mi mthun pa kun du spyod pa'i nyes pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
translated: I will establish them in the unsurpassed Great Vehicle.üîΩThe meaning of the passage from ‚ÄúThe fault of engaging in incompatible actions‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI will establish them in the unsurpassed Great Vehicle‚Äù is taught.

original: sdug bsngal ba yin par so sor rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yin par so sor rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the passage from ‚ÄúThe fault of engaging in incompatible actions‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI will establish them in the unsurpassed Great Vehicle‚Äù is taught.

original: 'di dag gi don ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi don ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of this should be understood by following the sutra.

original: sangs rgyas mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mthong ba ni rnam pa gnyis te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Seeing the Buddha is of two kinds, as before.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa yang rgyu rnam pa gsum ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa yang rgyu rnam pa gsum ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The purification of the roots of virtue also has three causes, as before.

original: de dpe'i khyad par ni tha dad do //
analyzed: de dpe'i khyad par ni tha dad do //
translated: The examples for these are different.

original: gser nge nyid nag tshur gyi nang du bcug nas bsregs na shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gser nge nyid nag tshur gyi nang du bcug nas bsregs na shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: When gold is put in the fire by a skillful smith and burned, it becomes very pure.

original: de bzhin du bskal pa brgya stong dpag tu med par bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ches rnam par dag par gyur pas ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma spangs pa dang / de dag gi gnyen po gtong ba dang / @280b tshul khrims rnam pang dag pas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bskal pa brgya stong dpag tu med par bsags pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ches rnam par dag par gyur pas ser sna dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma spangs pa dang / de dag gi gnyen po gtong ba dang / @280b tshul khrims rnam pang dag pas shes par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, it should be understood that the roots of virtue accumulated over a hundred thousand incalculable eons become extremely pure, and the stains of stinginess and immorality are abandoned, and their antidotes, generosity and morality, are purified.

original: bsam pa dag pa'i sems kyis zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa'i sems kyis zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has entered with a pure intention.

original: sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher gling bzhi pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phal cher gling bzhi pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal por 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this bhumi usually becomes a wheel-turning king of the four continents.

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la dgod par bya ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams la dgod par bya ba la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He is skilled in establishing beings in the path of the ten virtues.

original: skye bas phal cher gling bzhi pa'i 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye bas phal cher gling bzhi pa'i 'khor los sgyur bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: To demonstrate this meaning, it says, He is usually born as a wheel-turning king of the four continents, and so on.

original: snga ma las bcu 'gyur du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin stong rab tu thob cing zhes mdo nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma las bcu 'gyur du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la ting nge 'dzin stong rab tu thob cing zhes mdo nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood that the latter is ten times greater than the former.

original: gnas pa ma lus pa'i don mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa ma lus pa'i don mdor bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to briefly teach the meaning of all the stations, he says:

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi rnam pa ni don bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa de dag gi rnam pa ni don bstan pa'i rjes su 'brang nas shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas, etc. Their aspects should be understood in accordance with the explanation of their objects.

original: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma rnam pa thams cad sel ba dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni tshul khrims 'chal ba'i dri ma rnam pa thams cad sel ba dang zhes bya'o //
translated: The teaching of their verbal expressions is: the removal of all the stains of immorality.

original: tshul khrims lhag par gyur pa de dag ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims lhag par gyur pa de dag ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who have the preeminence of morality are said to be in the station of the preeminence of morality.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the station of the preeminence of morality.

original: // / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa'i rjes thogs la /
analyzed: // / tshul khrims rnam par dag pa ni sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gnas pa'i rjes thogs la /
translated: Since the mind becomes concentrated through the purity of morality, immediately after the station of the preeminence of morality, there is the station of the preeminence of mind.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: It is the establishment of the superior meditative development of mind.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba kun nas slong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba kun nas slong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'bras bu'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: It is from the point of view of the instigation of the meditative development of the absence of signs, the meditative development of the absence of signs, the absence of signs itself and the result of the absence of signs.

original: de la dang po ni sems kyi bsam pa ni yid la byed par shes par bya'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba ni ji srid du bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pas mi gnas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sems kyi bsam pa ni yid la byed par shes par bya'o // 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sbyor ba ni ji srid du bsam gtan la snyoms par zhugs pas mi gnas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Here, the intention of mind should be understood as mental attention.üîΩThe meditative development of the absence of signs is the meditative development that is not fixed in the attainment of the meditative absorption.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa'o //
translated: The absence of signs itself is the attainment of the meditative absorption and the formless attainments.

original: 'bras bu ni tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni tshad med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result is the immeasurables and so on.

original: gnas pa gsum pa 'di ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas pa gsum pa 'di ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: This third meditative state should be established as eightfold:

original: sems kyi yid la byed pa rdzogs par bya ba la 'jug pa nyid dang / byang chub @281a * //
analyzed: sems kyi yid la byed pa rdzogs par bya ba la 'jug pa nyid dang / byang chub @281a * //
translated: It is to engage in perfecting mental attention.üîΩIt is to fully understand up to enlightenment.üîΩIt is to seek with that method.üîΩIt is to seek the Dharma.üîΩIt is to abide in the superknowledges.

original: kyi bar du rab tu rtogs pa dang / thabs de dang des yang dag par tshol ba nyid dang / chos yongs su tshol ba nyid dang / de mngon par shes pa la gnas pa nyid dang / gang du 'dod pa der skye ba nyid dang /
analyzed: kyi bar du rab tu rtogs pa dang / thabs de dang des yang dag par tshol ba nyid dang / chos yongs su tshol ba nyid dang / de mngon par shes pa la gnas pa nyid dang / gang du 'dod pa der skye ba nyid dang /
translated: It is to be born wherever one wishes.üîΩIt is the purity of the roots of virtue.üîΩIt is birth.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa nyid dang / skye ba nyid dang / mthu nyid do //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa nyid dang / skye ba nyid dang / mthu nyid do //
translated: It is power.

original: de yang kyi  rgyal ba'i sras dag sa gnyis pa lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa gnon te /
analyzed: de yang kyi  rgyal ba'i sras dag sa gnyis pa lhag pa'i bsam pa shin tu sbyangs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa gnon te /
translated: ‚ÄúNoble sons, bodhisattvas who have purified superior intention in that way, who have attained the second bodhisattva ground, the Immaculate, will attain the third bodhisattva ground, the Luminous.

original: des sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcus gnon no //
analyzed: des sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcus gnon no //
translated: They will attain it through ten mental contemplations.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste ;
translated: They are as follows:

original: dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / brtan pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / skyo ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: dag pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / brtan pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / skyo ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: the attitude of a pure mind, the attitude of a stable mind, the attitude of a weary mind, the attitude of a mind free from attachment,

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / sra ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / sbyangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / rang dbang gi sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / sra ba'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / sbyangs pa'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / rang dbang gi sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang /
translated: the attitude of an irreversible mind, the attitude of a firm mind, the attitude of a trained mind, the attitude of an independent mind,

original: rlabs po che'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / che ba nyid kyi sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: rlabs po che'i sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa dang / che ba nyid kyi sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: the attitude of a vast mind, and the attitude of a great mind.

original: sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu po de dag gis gnon te zhes mdo na sa gsungs pa 'di dag gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa yid la byed pa bcu po de dag gis gnon te zhes mdo na sa gsungs pa 'di dag gi don bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to explain the meaning of these ten mental attitudes mentioned in the sutras,

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lhag pa'i sems la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o ;
translated: Here, the bodhisattvas‚Äô superior mind is called ‚Äúabiding in the mind of enlightenment.‚Äù

original: / bsam pa dag pa bcu po zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis par bstan pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: / bsam pa dag pa bcu po zhes bya ba ni sa gnyis par bstan pa'i yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The ten pure attitudes are the mental attentions taught in the second ground.

original: rtogs par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i gnas pas rim pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rtogs par gyur pa'i zhes bya ba'i bar ni thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i gnas pas rim pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving realized‚Äù is in terms of the stages of the abidings of learning, reflection, and meditation.

original: gzhan rnam pa bcus zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i bsam pa dag pa yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas rtogs par gyur pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnam pa bcus zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i bsam pa dag pa yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba nas rtogs par gyur pa'i bar du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy other aspects‚Äù refers to the pure attitudes, mental attentions, and so on up to ‚Äúhaving realized.‚Äù

original: de nas sems kyi yid la byed pa de dag bsgom pa chen po la gnas pa'i phyir dang / ma lus pa mdor bstan pas gnas pa gnyis pa las shin tu 'das nas gnas gsum la 'jug par @281b 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas sems kyi yid la byed pa de dag bsgom pa chen po la gnas pa'i phyir dang / ma lus pa mdor bstan pas gnas pa gnyis pa las shin tu 'das nas gnas gsum la 'jug par @281b 'gyur te /
translated: Then, because of abiding in the great meditation of those mental attentions, having transcended the second ground by a concise presentation of the entirety, one enters the third ground.

original: rnam pa bcus bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa dag par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcus bdag gi sems kyi bsam pa dag par 'gyur ro snyam pa'i yid la byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni dang po'o //
translated: The first is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúMy mind will become pure through ten aspects.‚Äù

original: 'di las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: 'di las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba'i cha ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o /
translated: The second is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúThis is not the level from which there is a fall.‚Äù

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing mi mthun par yang gnas so snyam pa'i yid la byed pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos rnams la sems mi 'jug cing mi mthun par yang gnas so snyam pa'i yid la byed pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúMy mind does not enter into and does not agree with contaminated things.‚Äù

original: sgom pa sems la brtan pa yid la byed pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: sgom pa sems la brtan pa yid la byed pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúMeditation is firm in the mind.‚Äù

original: gnyen po 'di las nyams par 'gyur ba ni cha ma yin no snyam du yid la byed pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen po 'di las nyams par 'gyur ba ni cha ma yin no snyam du yid la byed pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúThere is no level from which there is a fall in this antidote.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gnyen po brtan par gyur pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bskyod par mi nus pa ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyen po brtan par gyur pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis bskyod par mi nus pa ni drug pa'o //
translated: The sixth is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúSince the antidote is firm, it cannot be shaken by the opposing side.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'dun pa rgya chen po yid la byed pa ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la 'dun pa rgya chen po yid la byed pa ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the attention that thinks, ‚ÄúThere is a vast aspiration for all the qualities of a Buddha.‚Äù

original: dka' ba spyod pa thams cad kyis mi gnod par yid la byed pa ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa thams cad kyis mi gnod par yid la byed pa ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the attention that is not harmed by any difficult practices.

original: theg pa chen po rgya chen po la mos pa yid la byed pa ni dgu pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa chen po rgya chen po la mos pa yid la byed pa ni dgu pa'o //
translated: The ninth is the attention that is intent on the vastness of the Great Vehicle.

original: sems can gyi don bya bar mngon par dga' ba'i yid la byed pa ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya bar mngon par dga' ba'i yid la byed pa ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the attention that delights in working for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag par so sor rtog go zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la gnas pa byang chub sems dpa' 'du byed du gyur pa thams cad la mi rtag par so sor rtog go zhes bya ba nas /
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, the bodhisattva who is on the third bodhisattva stage examines all conditioned things as impermanent, as stated in the sutra.

original: skye bo mang po yongs su skyob pa nyid du yang dag par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bo mang po yongs su skyob pa nyid du yang dag par mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the sutra passage that begins ‚ÄúHe sees that they are a great protection for many beings,‚Äù

original: 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs mthong bas sun 'byin par byed /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la nyes dmigs mthong bas sun 'byin par byed /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúHe is disgusted by seeing the faults in all conditioned things.

original: yid skyo bar byed ces bya ba nas 'dod pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du smras so //
analyzed: yid skyo bar byed ces bya ba nas 'dod pa bskyed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du smras so //
translated: He is saddened by the mind, and so on up to ‚Äòhe generates the desire.‚Äô

original: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar gnod pa med pa mthong nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: des de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes de ltar gnod pa med pa mthong nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Having seen that the wisdom of the Tathagatas is thus unobstructed, beginning from here,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la 'god par nus so snyam nas zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bde ba la 'god par nus so snyam nas zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /

original: snying thag pa nas 'dun pas sems can gyi khams la sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal bar rnam par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: snying thag pa nas 'dun pas sems can gyi khams la sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyis sdug bsngal bar rnam par blta'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of that, it says, ‚Äúwith a mind that is intent from the very marrow of his bones, he sees the realm of sentient beings as suffering from various kinds of suffering.‚Äù

original: de de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes la rtog pas sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba la brtson zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi don bstan pa'i @282a * //

translated: Thus, with such an understanding of the wisdom of the Tathagatas, he strives to protect all sentient beings.

analyzed: phyir / sems can de dag thams cad la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: don la rton pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: A mind that is concerned with the meaning.

analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi nyes dmigs mthong bas ni bag yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By seeing the faults of conditioned things, one becomes conscientious.

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir skye ba med pa la spyod pa'o //

analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúConcentration, liberation, ‚Äù and so on up to

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du yid la byed pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams ni 'di ltar chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa la brten pa yin gyi zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de la mdo las ni ji skad thos pa'i chos rnams la tshul bzhin du so sor rtog pa'i rang bzhin can yin te zhes bya ba nas tshig gi las yongs su dag pa 'ba' zhig gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no
translated: In this regard, the sutra states: ‚ÄúOne is of the nature of proper discernment of the teachings as they have been heard, up to the point that one is not merely of pure verbal activity.‚Äù

translated: From beginning with meditative stabilization and meditative absorption up to except for the prayers that are made, and because of possessing a mind-stream that is accomplished through skill in means.

translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate the cause for the one who is free from the passion of the desire realm being born again in the desire realm,üîΩit is said,

translated: Because he is free from attachment to the desire realm, he abandons the fetters of desire.

original: bsam gtan bzlog pa ma mkhas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzlog pa ma mkhas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because he is skilled in reversing meditative attainment,

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'i 'ching ba rnams spangs pa yin no //
translated: he abandons the fetters of existence of the form and formless realms.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nyid nas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la mos pa'i phyir lta bas byas pa'i 'ching ba rnams bsrabs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa nyid nas chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la mos pa'i phyir lta bas byas pa'i 'ching ba rnams bsrabs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because he has conviction in the thatness of all phenomena from the level of resolute conduct onward, he reduces the fetters created by view.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: That is stated in the sutra:

original: sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sa 'od byed pa 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One who abides on this illuminating groundüîΩwill abandon nonvirtue for many quintillions of eons.üîΩHe will reduce wrong desire,

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mar log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig 'bum phrag du mar log pa'i 'dod chags 'grib par bya ba ma yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: he will reduce wrong hatred,üîΩhe will reduce wrong confusion.

original: log pa'i gti mug 'grib par chos yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: log pa'i gti mug 'grib par chos yin par spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the meaning of that, the text says:

original: log pa'i 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: log pa'i 'dod chags dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúWrong desire‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir log pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa byed par zhugs par gyur pa'i phyir log pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is wrong because it is engaged in harming oneself and others.

original: de la bye brag ni 'di yod do zhes bya ba ni dpe 'di'o //
analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod do zhes bya ba ni dpe 'di'o //
translated: This is the example of ‚Äúthere is this difference.‚Äù

original: tshad bzhin du 'dug go zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshad bzhin du 'dug go zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúit is the same as before‚Äù is explained as follows.

original: skye 'bri med par tshad mnyam pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skye 'bri med par tshad mnyam pa de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as it is the same size without increase or decrease, so it is.

original: de bzhin du sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa yang snga ma dang 'dra bar rnam par dag par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa yang snga ma dang 'dra bar rnam par dag par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattva who is on this stage are purified as before.

original: skye bas bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye bas bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the inclusion of birth,

original: skye pas na phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye pas na phal cher zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is said, ‚Äúfor the most part he is born in the desire realm.‚Äù

original: sa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sa'i nges pa'i tshig bstan pa ni /
translated: The definition of the stage is taught as follows.

original: thos pa'i rnam pa'i chos rnams kyi snang ba gsal ba nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba gsal bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: thos pa'i rnam pa'i chos rnams kyi snang ba gsal ba nyid dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi snang ba gsal bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir 'od byed pa zhes bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is called the Luminous because it is distinguished by the illumination of the Dharma in the aspect of hearing and the illumination of concentration.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sems rnam par dag pa la nye bar bstan pa'i 'di yod pas zhes bya ba nas so /
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi sems rnam par dag pa la nye bar bstan pa'i 'di yod pas zhes bya ba nas so /
translated: It is taught that this is due to the inner purity of mind.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi gnas rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi gnas rdzogs so /
translated: The Stage of Superior Mind is complete.

original: // / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas ba'i dbye ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: // / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas ba'i dbye ba ni gsum ste /
translated: The stage of superior wisdom is threefold:

original: khyad par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: khyad par bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of its distinction is:

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs bsgom pa dang / yang dag par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: The cultivation of the factors of enlightenment is the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment and the possession of them.

original: @283b sa bzhi pa yang ji ltar thos pa'i don gyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: @283b sa bzhi pa yang ji ltar thos pa'i don gyis bsdus pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnam par dag pa'i ye shes rnam par dag pas rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The fourth stage is distinguished by the purity of wisdom in the concentration that includes the meaning of what is heard.

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as being established in four aspects:

original: rnam par dag pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / rnam par dag pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / de dag gi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / rnam par dag pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / de dag gi 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
translated: The presentation of the cause of the increase of the cultivation of the counteragent of purification, the presentation of the increase of purification, the presentation of the increase of the cultivation of the counteragent, and the presentation of their result.

original: de la rnam par dag pa gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu ni chos snang ba la 'jug pa bcu thob pa yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par dag pa gnyen po bsgom pa 'phel ba'i rgyu ni chos snang ba la 'jug pa bcu thob pa yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therein, the cause of the increase of the cultivation of the counteragent of purification is the attainment of the ten kinds of entry into the light of the Dharma.

original: mang du thos pa yongs su btsal ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mang du thos pa la brten nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mang du thos pa yongs su btsal ba'i dbang du byas nas zhes bya ba ni mang du thos pa la brten nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With reference to the thorough search for much learning, means: on the basis of much learning.

original: chos kyi snang ba'i dngos po bcu po bstan pa ni chos la snang ba 'jug pa bcu thob pa yin te zhes brjod do //
analyzed: chos kyi snang ba'i dngos po bcu po bstan pa ni chos la snang ba 'jug pa bcu thob pa yin te zhes brjod do //
translated: The teaching of the ten kinds of entity of the light of the Dharma is the attainment of the ten kinds of entry into the light of the Dharma.

original: de dag che ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa nyid ni de'i sa gnon pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag che ba dang / yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa nyid ni de'i sa gnon pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that the increase and completion of those is the very cause for ascending to that stage,

original: lhag pa'i sems la gnas ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la gnas ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúabiding in superior mind‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag gi mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan cing brjod pa'i phyir smras pa /üîΩgzhung gi mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la snang ba bzhin du yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de /
analyzed: de dag gi mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan cing brjod pa'i phyir smras pa / gzhung gi mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gsum pa la snang ba bzhin du yongs su dag pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de /
translated: In order to teach and express the meaning of those in brief, he says,üîΩ‚Äúone should know them as they are described in the text.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa non te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa non te /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúO sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who has purified the third bodhisattva stage through the light of Dharma ascends to the fourth bodhisattva stage.

original: de chos la snang bas 'jug pa bcus gnon no //
analyzed: de chos la snang bas 'jug pa bcus gnon no //
translated: He ascends through ten kinds of engagement with the light of Dharma.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ; 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / nam mkha'i khams dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams dang ; 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang /
translated: Similarly, it is the entrance by the light of the analysis of the realm of the world, the realm of the Dharma-element, the realm of space, the realm of consciousness, the realm of desire, the realm of form, and the formless realm.

original: bsam pa rlabs po che'i mos pa'i khams dang / bsam pa chen po nyid kyi mos pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa rlabs po che'i mos pa'i khams dang / bsam pa chen po nyid kyi mos pa'i khams rnam par dpyad pa la snang bas 'jug pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the entrance by the light of the analysis of the realm of aspiration of the vast mind, and the realm of aspiration of the great mind.

original: gang dag 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang dag 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Those who are designated are

original: khams dang skye gnas kyis bsdus pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: khams dang skye gnas kyis bsdus pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: sentient beings included in the realms and modes of birth.

original: de lta bu'i 'jig rten de rnam par brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'jig rten de rnam par brtag pa'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa ni /
translated: The world is taught in terms of such analysis.

original: sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa snang bas 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams rnam par dpyad pa snang bas 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is the entrance by the light of the analysis of the realm of sentient beings.

original: de dag ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par 'dogs par byed do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩde'i rjes la @284a * //
analyzed: de dag ni nam mkha'i khams kyi mthas gtugs par 'dogs par byed do zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir / de'i rjes la @284a * //
translated: In order to demonstrate that,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the world-realms are mentioned immediately following that.

original: don de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: don de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of that is taught:

original: gang du 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang du 'dogs pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: where they are designated.

original: yang sems can dang 'jig rten de dag ni de bzhin du ro gcig pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang sems can dang 'jig rten de dag ni de bzhin du ro gcig pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, those sentient beings and worlds are, in the same way, of one taste,

original: don dam par ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes smras so //
analyzed: don dam par ni chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid do zhes smras so //
translated: ultimately, the essence of the dharma-dhƒÅtu.

original: yang de dag ni don dam par nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang de dag ni don dam par nam mkha' dang mnyam pa'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that they are ultimately equal to space,

original: nam mkha'i khams rnam par dpyod pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams rnam par dpyod pa la snang bas 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: the analysis of the space element is mentioned: ‚Äúby the light that enters through the eye.

original: de ltar btags pa tsam du yod pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar btags pa tsam du yod pa'i sems can gyi khams rnams kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byad ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚Äù In that way, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the complete affliction and purification of the realm of sentient beings, which exists as mere designation,

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams bstan te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams bstan te /
translated: the consciousness element is taught.

original: sems kun nas nyon mongs pas sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: sems kun nas nyon mongs pas sems can rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: The mind is defiled by the defilements, and sentient beings are defiled by the mind.

original: sems rnam par dag pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sems rnam par dag pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gis so //
translated: The mind is purified by purity, and sentient beings are purified by the mind.

original: khams gsum ni kun du spyod pa'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams smos pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum ni kun du spyod pa'i nyon mongs pas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa'i khams smos pa yin no //
translated: The realms of desire, etc. are mentioned in order to show that the three realms are defiled by the defilements of the activities.

original: gang du rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can yang yongs su mi gtong ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: gang du rnam par dag par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / sems can yang yongs su mi gtong ba'i dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwhere there is purification‚Äù refers to the absence of defilement and the non-abandonment of sentient beings.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i don gyis ni bsam pa rlabs po che nyid kyis byang chub chen po la 'dod pa nyid kyi rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i don gyis ni bsam pa rlabs po che nyid kyis byang chub chen po la 'dod pa nyid kyi rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great resolve is the desire for great enlightenment, which is not shared in common with the disciples, etc. Purification is due to the great resolve.

original: che ba nyid kyi bsam pa ni sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: che ba nyid kyi bsam pa ni sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The great resolve is taught as the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten nas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brten nas rnam par byang bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it shows that purification is based on the full maturation of the Buddha qualities and the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: de yang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba nas brtsams nas de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pa'i phyir zhes bya bi'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang kye rgyal ba'i sras dag ces bya ba nas brtsams nas de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pa'i phyir zhes bya bi'i bar gyi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of that, beginning from ‚ÄúO sons of the victors!‚Äù up to ‚Äúbecause they have attained the qualities of that nature,‚Äù

original: de ni mi phyed pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa ye shes zhes bya ba la ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bcu dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni mi phyed pa'i bsam pa la sogs pa ye shes zhes bya ba la ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa'i chos bcu dang ldan pa nyid de /
translated: it says, ‚Äúthe ten qualities that bring about the full maturation of wisdom‚Äù and so on. The ten qualities that bring about the full maturation of wisdom are the ten qualities that bring about the full maturation of wisdom.

original: ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes yongs su smin par byed pa rnam pa bcu dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The full maturation of wisdom is endowed with ten aspects.

original: rab tu grub pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa 'phel ba'i dbang du byas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rab tu grub pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu grub pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag pa 'phel ba'i dbang du byas pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su rab tu grub pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFully accomplished‚Äù refers to the increase of purification, which is fully accomplished in the family of the tathƒÅgatas.

original: mang du thos pa la brten nas ye shes kyi mthar thug par gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: mang du thos pa la brten nas ye shes kyi mthar thug par gyur pa nyid do //
translated: and by relying on much learning, he has reached the culmination of intuition.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi chos rab tu thob pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: having attained the Dharma of that nature.

original: rnam pa thams cad du byang chub dang / sems can @284b la lta ba gtsor byas nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du byang chub dang / sems can @284b la lta ba gtsor byas nas /
translated: Having made the view of enlightenment and of sentient beings primary,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa mthar thug pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i mdo ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos bsgom pa mthar thug pa bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa'i mdo ni /
translated: the sutra teaches the culmination of the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment, from the point of view of the one who is teaching:

original: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la lta ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: having the view of all sentient beings, up toüîΩendowed with that great love.

original: byams pa chen po de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byams pa chen po de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni sems can la lta ba dang bcas pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches the view of sentient beings.üîΩHaving the special focus on the intuition of omniscience, up to

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la lhag par dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas thabs la mkhas pa chen pos rnam par dpyod pas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' la lta ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la lhag par dmigs pa dang zhes bya ba nas thabs la mkhas pa chen pos rnam par dpyod pas so zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni byang chub sems dpa' la lta ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: analyzing with great skill in means, teaches the view of the bodhisattva.

original: mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bas ni byang chub kyi phyogs bshom  pa yod du zin kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo nyid las 'byung ba bzhin bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bas ni byang chub kyi phyogs bshom  pa yod du zin kyang zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: One should meditate in accordance with what appears in the sutra itself. This shows that even though the factors of enlightenment are set forth, they are both with and without outflows.

original: thabs mkhas pa chen pos rnam par dpyod pas zhes bya ba nyid kyis thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyis yongs su zin par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //üîΩde 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: thabs mkhas pa chen pos rnam par dpyod pas zhes bya ba nyid kyis thabs la mkhas pa nyid kyis yongs su zin par bsgom par bya'o zhes bya bar rig par bya'o // de 'jig tshogs la lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i bdag dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: By saying one should meditate with great skill in analysis, it should be understood that one should meditate with the possession of skill in means.

original: 'jig rten gyi gnas rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad dang de bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gnas rnams gang yin pa de dag thams cad dang de bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the sutra passage from The view of the transitory collection precedes the self... up to All those who abide in the world are free from that is taught by

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba shin tu cha phra ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba shin tu cha phra ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: saying The subtle view of the transitory collection... and so on.

original: thams cad kun du mi spyod pas zhes bya ba ni bag chags tsam yang ma lus pa'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kun du mi spyod pas zhes bya ba ni bag chags tsam yang ma lus pa'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Because he does not engage in all things means that not even the imprints remain.

original: 'jig tshogs la lta bde nyid ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mngon par zhen par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta bde nyid ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mngon par zhen par gyur pa ste /
translated: The view of the transitory collection is the adherence to the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: gcig nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / spyod pa po nyid du gzung ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid dang / byed pa po nyid dang / spyod pa po nyid du gzung ba'o //
translated: It is the grasping of them as a single entity, as an agent, and as an experiencer.

original: des ni de dag spangs na de yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ni de dag spangs na de yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one abandons those, one also abandons that.

original: g-yo ba thams cad kun du mi spyod pas gtan du spong bar byed do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la lta ba sngon du song ba rnams so //üîΩyang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis smad pa'i las gang yin pa de thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: g-yo ba thams cad kun du mi spyod pas gtan du spong bar byed do zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la lta ba sngon du song ba rnams so // yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis smad pa'i las gang yin pa de thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: Because he does not engage in all movements, he abandons them permanently refers to those who have previously had views about the world.

original: de rnams spangs pas thams cad kyi thams cad du mi spyod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams spangs pas thams cad kyi thams cad du mi spyod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of he abandons all actions that are condemned by the perfect Buddha is taught by the phrase because he abandons those, he does not engage in them at all.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa'i las byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa de dag ni yang dag par blangs te gnas so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis bsngags pa'i las byang chub sems dpa'i lam gyi tshogs dang mthun pa de dag ni yang dag par blangs te gnas so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he has taken up and abides in the deeds praised by the perfect, complete Buddha, which are in accord with the accumulations of the bodhisattva path,

original: bsngags pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //üîΩde de bas kyang gang ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba nas @285a * //
analyzed: bsngags pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba nas ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to // de de bas kyang gang ji lta ji ltar zhes bya ba nas @285a * //
translated: he teaches from ‚Äúwhatever is praised‚Äù up to ‚Äújust as it is.‚Äù

original: brtsams nas / mthun par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtsams nas / mthun par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of the sutra that begins with ‚Äúto the extent that‚Ä¶‚Äù up toüîΩ‚Äúhe is one who holds it in accord,‚Äù

analyzed: de ltar gyur na de bas kyang shas cher zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: he teaches from ‚Äúin that case, even more so‚Äù up to

analyzed: dkar po'i chos rnam pas na tshogs dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to //
translated: ‚Äúhe becomes endowed with the accumulations of virtuous qualities.‚Äù

original: sa gong ma rnams yongs su sbyong ba'i las rnams kyang yang dag par tshol zhing brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po thob ste gnas so zhes bstan pa'i mdo'i tshig ni de de ltar dul ba dang ldan zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas tshul dang tshul ma yin pa
analyzed: sa gong ma rnams yongs su sbyong ba'i las rnams kyang yang dag par tshol zhing brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po thob ste gnas so zhes bstan pa'i mdo'i tshig ni de de ltar dul ba dang ldan zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas tshul dang tshul ma yin pa
translated: The words of the Sutra Teaching the Four Qualities state:üîΩ‚ÄúHaving such self-control,‚Äù and so forth, up to ‚Äúthe effort of discerning what is proper and improper

original: rnam par 'byed pa'i brtson 'grus dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩde de bas kyang shas cher bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa'i brtson 'grus dad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no // de de bas kyang shas cher bsam pa'i khams yongs su dag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nas /
translated: is faith.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi bsam pa dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro zhes 'di dag gi don bstan ba ni /üîΩgzhi des de'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa dang yang dag par ldan par 'gyur ro zhes 'di dag gi don bstan ba ni / gzhi des de'i bsam pa dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúHis mental continuum becomes even purer,‚Äù and so forth, up to ‚Äúhe becomes endowed with the thoughts of sentient beings.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of these is taught:

analyzed: mu stegs can dang / bdud thams cad kyis kyang mi 'phrogs shing mi bskyod par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan to//
translated: ‚ÄúOn that basis, his thoughts,‚Äù and so forth, up to ‚Äúhe becomes unmoved and unshaken by all the tirthikas and maras.‚Äù

original: dpe'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the distinction of the example, he says:

analyzed: de la bye brag ni 'di yod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: dpe gnyis pa bstan pa ni dper na nor bu rin po che snang ba rab tu gtong ba ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //

original: ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bar gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'od 'phro ba dang chos mthun pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od 'phro bar gyur pa dang zhes bya ba ni 'od 'phro ba dang chos mthun pa'i chos bstan pa'i phyir te /

original: chos bstan pas 'jig rten pa rnams la shes rab kyi snang ba byed pas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pas 'jig rten pa rnams la shes rab kyi snang ba byed pas zhes bya'o //

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa dang po rdzogs so /
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa dang po rdzogs so /
translated: The first station of the superior wisdom is completed.

original: // / sa lnga pa ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: // / sa lnga pa ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The fifth stage is to be established in three ways:

original: yid kyi gnyen po'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang // mi gnas pa'i lam so sor rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid kyi gnyen po'i khyad par rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang // mi gnas pa'i lam so sor rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa nyid dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa nyid do //

original: de la yid kyi gnyen po'i khyad par nyid ni /
analyzed: de la yid kyi gnyen po'i khyad par nyid ni /

original: sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu thob ste /
analyzed: sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu thob ste /

original: de'i yid la byed pa de ni ldog par mi 'gyur ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yid la byed pa de ni ldog par mi 'gyur ba dang bcas pa ste /

original: sngar yang chos rtogs so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen por gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar yang chos rtogs so snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen por gsungs pa yin no //

original: sa 'di la rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad du mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po nye bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: sa 'di la rnam par dag pa'i rgyud tha dad du mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi gnyen po nye bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /

analyzed: rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid bcu thob ces bya ba la /

original: mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub @285b sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad du 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub @285b sems dpa'i sa bzhi pa la lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la 'jug ste /
translated: O children of the buddhas, bodhisattvas who have completed the path on the fourth bodhisattva ground enter the fifth bodhisattva ground.

original: de rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bcus 'jug go //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa la sems kyi bsam pa mnyam pa nyid rnam pa bcus 'jug go //
translated: They enter it with ten mental attitudes that are focused on purity.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /

original: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'das pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / ma 'ongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / da ltar byung ba'i sangs rgyas kyi chos rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / sems rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang ; lta ba dang / som nyi dang / yid gnyis dang / 'gyod pa sel ba rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /

original: lam dang lam ma yin pa shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / lam gyis spong ba shes pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad gong ma gong mas rnam par 'jog pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid dang /

translated: the purity of intention in the purity of knowledge of the path and not the path, the purity of intention in the purity of knowledge of the abandonment by the path, the purity of intention in the purity of the higher and higher arrangement of all the factors of awakening,

analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa rnam par dag pa la bsam pa mnyam pa nyid de /
