translated: The meaning of the sutra is stated in the words: ‚Äúindividually cognized by oneself.‚Äù

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs pas mtshan nyid kyi bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: He fully understands the truth of characteristics because he realizes the specific and general characteristics.

original: de gnyi ga'i gnas las brtsams te gang bstan pa dang zhes bya ba yin te bstan pa'i chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas phyin ci ma log pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su gsal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas pa la 'jug pa nyid ni bstan pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga'i gnas las brtsams te gang bstan pa dang zhes bya ba yin te bstan pa'i chos dang / rtogs pa'i chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas phyin ci ma log pa'i rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su gsal bar byed pa'i dbang du byas pa la 'jug pa nyid ni bstan pa'i chos yin no //
translated: The meaning of the sutra is stated in the words: ‚Äúthat which is taught beginning with the basis of both.‚Äù The basis of the taught Dharma and the realized Dharma is the non-erroneous specific and general characteristics. The teaching that is based on that is the taught Dharma.

original: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pas rab tu phye ba nyid ni so so rang gis rig pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid la dmigs pas rab tu phye ba nyid ni so so rang gis rig pa'o //
translated: The individually cognized is that which is distinguished by the observation of reality.

original: gang gis bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang gis bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The words ‚Äúthat which is taught‚Äù refer to the taught Dharma.

original: mdo las / chos rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pas rtogs pas rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang ma mo las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: mdo las / chos rnam par dbye ba rnam par gzhag pas rtogs pas rnam par dbye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang ma mo las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The sutra states: ‚ÄúOne understands the truth of discrimination through the realization of the establishment of the discrimination of phenomena.‚Äù This refers to the sutra collection and the collection on observed phenomena.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang ma mo las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnam par gzhag pas rab tu phye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba dang ma mo las brtsams pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne understands the truth of realization through the discrimination of the establishment of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases‚Äù refers to the vinaya and the collection on observed phenomena.

original: de ltar na bstan pa dang zhes bya ba bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pa dang zhes bya ba bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained ‚Äúthe teaching,‚Äù

original: gang gis bstan pa dang zhes bya bas lhag @286b ma bden pa'i rnam pa rnams bstan pa'o //üîΩlus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang gis bstan pa dang zhes bya bas lhag @286b ma bden pa'i rnam pa rnams bstan pa'o // lus dang sems la gnod pa nyams su 'bab pas dngos po'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äúby whom the teaching‚Äù explains the remaining aspects of the truth.üîΩThe explanation of the meaning of ‚Äúone understands the truth of things through the experience of harm to body and mind‚Äù is:

original: de ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne understands the truth of things through the experience of harm to body and mind‚Äù means that one understands the truth of things through the experience of harm to body and mind.

original: 'gro bar mtshams sbyor ba rtogs pas rab tu skye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'gro bar mtshams sbyor ba rtogs pas rab tu skye ba'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: One understands the truth of complete arising through the realization of the connection with going. The meaning of this is taught by:

original: rgyu las ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu las ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of future suffering from a cause.

original: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad zhi bas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rims nad kyis yongs su gdung ba thams cad zhi bas zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig gi don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: One understands the truth of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising through the pacification of all the torments of fever. The meaning of this sutra passage is taught by:

original: rgyud zad pas de zad de mi skye ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyud zad pas de zad de mi skye ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The exhaustion of the continuum through the exhaustion of that.

original: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa mngon par bsgrubs pas lam shes pa la 'jug pa'i bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: One enters into the knowledge of the path through the accomplishment of non-duality. The truth of this sutra passage is taught by:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bar gyi bden pa rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: Up to one understands the truth of the arising of the Tathagata's wisdom. The meaning of this sutra passage is taught by:

original: de spang ba'i thabs bstan pa las brtsams nas ches ji ltar bstan pa ste zhes bya pa'o ;
analyzed: de spang ba'i thabs bstan pa las brtsams nas ches ji ltar bstan pa ste zhes bya pa'o ;
translated: Beginning from the explanation of the means of abandoning that, as it is taught.

original: /'du byed du gyur pa thams cad shes rab kyis yang dag par rnam par sun 'byin par byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: /'du byed du gyur pa thams cad shes rab kyis yang dag par rnam par sun 'byin par byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHe repudiates all conditioned things with wisdom‚Äù is a statement from a sutra.

original: de de ltar bden pa la mkhas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blo 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa dang slu ba'i chos can zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de de ltar bden pa la mkhas pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blo 'dus byas thams cad brdzun pa dang slu ba'i chos can zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúHe, having accomplished the skill in the truths, understands that all conditioned things are false and deceptive phenomena, up to

original: byis pa 'drid pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: byis pa 'drid pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: he understands as it truly is the deception of fools.‚Äù

original: sems can gyi khams la snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams la snying rje'i bsam pa rnam par 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: ‚ÄúHis thoughts of compassion for the realm of sentient beings increase‚Äù is a statement from a sutra.

original: de de bas na shas cher sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur zhing byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de de bas na shas cher sems can rnams la snying rje chen po mngon du 'gyur zhing byams pa chen po'i snang ba yang rab tu 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, he manifests great compassion for sentient beings and the light of great love shines forth.‚Äù

original: sems can byis ba'i log par sgrub pa yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las 'das par yang dag par rab tu rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: sems can byis ba'i log par sgrub pa yang sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' las 'das par yang dag par rab tu rtogs so zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the sutra are:

original: de de ltar ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa thob ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de de ltar ye shes kyi stobs bskyed pa thob ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having attained the generation of the power of wisdom, he thinks:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlas!

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong ba ngo mtshar che'i zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrugs pa'i sdug bsngal mang po nyams su myong ba ngo mtshar che'i zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: It is amazing that sentient beings experience the many sufferings of birth, aging, sickness, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, mental unhappiness, and agitation.‚Äù

original: de dag rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su gzung ba la sems kyis smon par byed cing zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig @287a * //
analyzed: de dag rnam par thar bar bya ba'i phyir bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po yongs su gzung ba la sems kyis smon par byed cing zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig @287a * //
translated: In order to liberate them, he mentally aspires to take up the great accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: ni ; mal bdag gis sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ni ; mal bdag gis sems can de ltar sdug bsngal gyis nyam thag pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action from faith is: I will accumulate the collections of merit and knowledge in such a way that I will attain the ultimate, which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge, and which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unattached with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge.

original: ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyis mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //üîΩde la gnas pa'i bsam pa yang dag par bsgrub po zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /üîΩde de ltar shin tu bsngags pa'i shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos zhes bya ba nas /üîΩsems can thams cad mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir rtsom ste zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: ye shes chags pa med pa'i bar gyis mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa de lta bu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsag par bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'i bar yin no // de la gnas pa'i bsam pa yang dag par bsgrub po zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni / de de ltar shin tu bsngags pa'i shes pas mngon par bsgrubs pa'i blos zhes bya ba nas / sems can thams cad mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir rtsom ste zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action from faith is: I will accumulate the collections of merit and knowledge in such a way that I will attain the ultimate, which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge, and which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unattached with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge.üîΩThe thought of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action from faith is: I will accumulate the collections of merit and knowledge in such a way that I will attain the ultimate, which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge, and which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unattached with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge.üîΩThe thought of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action from faith is: I will accumulate the collections of merit and knowledge in such a way that I will attain the ultimate, which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge, and which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unattached with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge.üîΩThe thought of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action from faith is: I will accumulate the collections of merit and knowledge in such a way that I will attain the ultimate, which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge, and which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unattached with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge.

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa la sogs pa yon tan mang po rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa la sogs pa yon tan mang po rnam pa sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The thought of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action from faith is: I will accumulate the collections of merit and knowledge in such a way that I will attain the ultimate, which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unobstructed with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge, and which is the attainment of the knowledge that is unattached with regard to all the varieties of objects of knowledge.üîΩThe

original: de ni de bas kyang shas cher brjod bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis dran pa dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ni de bas kyang shas cher brjod bar mi 'gyur ba'i chos nyid kyis dran pa dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He is endowed with mindfulness, because of the nature of not speaking too much.

original: thabs la mkhas pa chen pos 'jig rten du mtshams sbyor bar smon lam shin tu btab pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa chen pos 'jig rten du mtshams sbyor bar smon lam shin tu btab pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with a mind that has made extremely firm aspirations to be reborn in the world through great skill in means.üîΩHe ripens sentient beings through various means of ripening, and is free from other mental states.

original: yid la byed pa gzhan dang bral ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa gzhan dang bral ba dang / yongs su smin par bya ba'i thabs sna tshogs kyis kyang sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the sutra state:

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa la brtson pas nyin mtshan du sems gzhan yongs su spangs pa yin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par byed pa la brtson pas nyin mtshan du sems gzhan yongs su spangs pa yin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He is one who has abandoned all other mental states, striving to ripen all sentient beings, day and night.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par sgrub pas nye bar spyad pas bya ba la sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang sems can yongs su smin bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam par 'phrul pa chen po mngon par sgrub pas nye bar spyad pas bya ba la sbyor ba rnams kyis kyang sems can yongs su smin bar byed do zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: and by the application of those who are engaged in the performance of actions through the enjoyment of the accomplishment of great miraculous transformations, they bring beings to maturity.

original: de de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pas zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: de de ltar sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pas zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the passage beginning with ‚Äúthus, being intent on bringing beings to maturity‚Äù is as follows.

original: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yi ge dang / bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs la sogs pa bzo dang las kyi gnas rnams mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin bstan pa ni gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yi ge dang / bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs la sogs pa bzo dang las kyi gnas rnams mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin bstan pa ni gang dag yin pa de dag thams cad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The worldly crafts and occupations such as writing, treatises, seals, accounting, poetry, and so on, which are of benefit to beings, are taught in the s≈´tras. All of these are taught in the Ornament of Mahayana Sutras.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dang mthun par bya ba ni yi ge dang / bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs gang dag yod pa rnams dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad dang mthun par bya ba ni yi ge dang / bstan bcos dang / rgya dang / rtsis dang / shod thabs gang dag yod pa rnams dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin accordance with worldly conventions‚Äù refers to writing, treatises, seals, accounting, poetry, and so on.

original: dbul ba bsal bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dbul ba bsal bar bya ba dang zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya ste /
translated: The removal of poverty is the general characteristic of all of them.

original: rig pa'i gnas thams cad ni tshe 'di'i 'tsho ba'i cho ga tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas thams cad ni tshe 'di'i 'tsho ba'i cho ga tsam gyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For all the branches of learning are distinguished by their mere function of providing for the necessities of life in this world.

original: yang na dbul ba bsal ba'i thabs ni nor @287b bsgyur ba'i dpyad yin no //
analyzed: yang na dbul ba bsal ba'i thabs ni nor @287b bsgyur ba'i dpyad yin no //
translated: Or else, the means of removing poverty is the science of astrology.

original: khams ma snyoms pa dang mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i gnod pa'i par bya ba ni skem byed dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po'i gdon dang / dug dang / ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba dang gso ba'i cho ga'o //
analyzed: khams ma snyoms pa dang mi dang mi ma yin pas byas pa'i gnod pa'i par bya ba ni skem byed dang / brjed byed dang / 'byung po'i gdon dang / dug dang / ro langs kyi sbyor ba bsal ba dang gso ba'i cho ga'o //
translated: The removal of harm caused by imbalance of the elements, by humans and non-humans, is the science of healing, which is the method of curing consumption, epilepsy, possession by elemental spirits, poison, and zombies.

original: kha na ma thob med pa'i rtsed mo ni snyan dngags dang / gar thabs dang gtam rgyud dang / rol mo dang / de lta bu byung ba brjod pas rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
analyzed: kha na ma thob med pa'i rtsed mo ni snyan dngags dang / gar thabs dang gtam rgyud dang / rol mo dang / de lta bu byung ba brjod pas rab tu dga' bar bya'o //
translated: Play without fault is to be delighted by poetry, dance, storytelling, music, and the narration of past events.

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa ni chos ma yin pa la dga' ba las bzlog par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa ni chos ma yin pa la dga' ba las bzlog par bya ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of its cause is ‚Äúthe turning away from delight in what is not Dharma,‚Äù and so on.

original: khyim gyi yo byad 'dod pa rnams la tshogs chung dus khyim gyi yo byad bsgrub par bya ba ni grong dang / grong khyer dang / skyed mos tshal dang / 'bab chu dang / mtshe'u dang / rdzing dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang ;
analyzed: khyim gyi yo byad 'dod pa rnams la tshogs chung dus khyim gyi yo byad bsgrub par bya ba ni grong dang / grong khyer dang / skyed mos tshal dang / 'bab chu dang / mtshe'u dang / rdzing dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang ;
translated: For those who desire household goods, the accomplishment of household goods with a small amount of effort is the accomplishment of villages, cities, parks, waterfalls, ponds, lakes, flowers, fruits,

original: sman dang / nags tshal mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: sman dang / nags tshal mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: medicines, and forests.

original: rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa las yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gnod pa las yongs su bskyab par bya ba ni gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'u rya dang / dung dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / rin po che'i 'byung gnas rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: The protection from harm by kings, thieves, and so on is the teaching of the sources of gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch-shells, crystals, corals, and precious stones.

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i sbyor ba la gnang ba dag ga par bya ba ni zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dang / sa g-yo ba dang / gcan gzan gyi la nye ba dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i sbyor ba la gnang ba dag ga par bya ba ni zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / gza' dang / skar ma dang / rgyu skar dang / sa g-yo ba dang / gcan gzan gyi la nye ba dang /
translated: The application to the determination of what is possible and impossible is the knowledge of the moon, the sun, the planets, the stars, the lunar mansions, earthquakes, the approach of beasts of prey,

original: bya'i la nye ba dang / rmi ltas dang / ltas ston pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: bya'i la nye ba dang / rmi ltas dang / ltas ston pa shes pa'o //
translated: the approach of birds, dreams, and omens.

original: bkra shis pa dang / bkra mi shis pa'i dngos po blang ba dang dor ba la gzud pa ni yan lag dang nying lag thams cad kyi mtshan dang spyod yul gyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bkra shis pa dang / bkra mi shis pa'i dngos po blang ba dang dor ba la gzud pa ni yan lag dang nying lag thams cad kyi mtshan dang spyod yul gyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: The application to the acceptance and rejection of auspicious and inauspicious things is the knowledge of the marks of all the major and minor members of the body and the application to the sphere of activity.

original: tshe 'di la gcig la gcig mi 'khu ba dang / phyi ma la phyin ci ma log pa'i mngon par mtho ba'i lam bstan pa ni /
analyzed: tshe 'di la gcig la gcig mi 'khu ba dang / phyi ma la phyin ci ma log pa'i mngon par mtho ba'i lam bstan pa ni /
translated: The application to the teaching of the path to the higher realms that is irreproachable in this life and the next is

original: sdom pa'i cho gal gnas pa dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rnams bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa'i cho gal gnas pa dang / bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa dang / tshad med pa dang / gzugs med pa'i gnas rnams bstan pa'o //
translated: the teaching of the vows, the absorptions, the superknowledges, the immeasurables, and the formless states.

original: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: gzhan thams cad ni snga ma bzhin no /
translated: All the rest is as before.

original: // zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba la sogs pa'o / dpe'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba la sogs pa'o / dpe'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The seeing of the Buddha and so on.

original: nor bu spug gis byi dor byas shing spras pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor bu spug gis byi dor byas shing spras pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach the special example, he says, for example, like a well-polished crystal ornament, because it is incomparable.

original: spras pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu 'od gas la bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spras pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su dag pa dang / shin tu 'od gas la bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The ornament is the complete purification and the great radiance.

original: mi 'phrogs pa'i don bstan pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'phrogs pa'i don bstan pa ni mtshungs pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of being unassailable is taught by the phrase, because it is incomparable.

original: de nyid kyi dpe gnyis pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi dpe gnyis pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The second example for that is taught:

original: dper na zhes bya ba sogs pa la /
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba sogs pa la /
translated: for example, like the wind.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad mnyam par 'gro yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad mnyam par 'gro yang rlung gi dkyil 'khor thams cad kyis mi 'phrogs pa'o //
translated: Although all the wind-circles move equally, all the wind-circles are unassailable.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas gnyis pa rdzogs so /üîΩ// / chos mnyam pa @288a * //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas gnyis pa rdzogs so / // / chos mnyam pa @288a * //
translated: The second chapter on superior wisdom is completed.

original: nyid bcu 'thob ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyid bcu 'thob ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: One attains the ten equalities of phenomena.

original: de yang de chung du dang / 'bring gis sa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa las rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang de chung du dang / 'bring gis sa yongs su sbyang ba byas pa las rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the small and medium stages purify the stages, while the great stage is the path of penetration.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: chos mnyam pa nyid bcu 'thob ste zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chos mnyam pa nyid bcu 'thob ste zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHe attains the ten equalities of things.‚Äù

original: chen po'i rnam pas sa gnon pa'i lam dang mthun par rnam par gzhag pa ni des na smras pa /
analyzed: chen po'i rnam pas sa gnon pa'i lam dang mthun par rnam par gzhag pa ni des na smras pa /
translated: The great stage is established as the path of penetration because it is the path of penetration.üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: de dag che ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag che ba'i phyir dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are great, etc.‚Äù

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: As it is said in the sutra, etc.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig blangs nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig blangs nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: The words ‚Äúas it is said in the sutra‚Äù should be explained as the words of the sutra.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa lnga pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de byang chub sems dpa'i sa drug pa la 'jug ste /
translated: ‚ÄúO sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who has completed the path on the fifth bodhisattva stage enters the sixth bodhisattva stage.

original: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
analyzed: de chos mnyam pa nyid bcus 'jug go //
translated: He enters by means of ten equalities of things.

original: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten? They are:

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la de'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la de'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of that is taught:üîΩAll phenomena are the same in being ultimately signless in terms of an essence.

original: chos thams cad la don dam par yong pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: chos thams cad la don dam par yong pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan ma med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang yongs su grub pa'i chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The ultimate essence is also the basic element of the Dharma of complete accomplishment.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pas mtshan mar bya bar mi nus pas te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pas mtshan mar bya bar mi nus pas te /
translated: Moreover, it cannot be made into a sign by a conceptual consciousness,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the domain of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: de bas na de'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o zhes chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i ngo bo nyid kyis chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'o zhes chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that all phenomena are the same in being signless by nature.

original: de'i yul can ye shes kyang de bzhin du 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i yul can ye shes kyang de bzhin du 'dod do //
translated: The wisdom that is the subject of that is also asserted in the same way.

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The others should be understood in the same way.

original: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan nyid med par mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.

original: brjod du med par mngon par 'du byed par snang ba mtshan nyid med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjod du med par mngon par 'du byed par snang ba mtshan nyid med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.

original: brjod du med par snang pa ni brjod du med pa'i ngo bo'o //üîΩmngon par 'du byed par snang ba ni /
analyzed: brjod du med par snang pa ni brjod du med pa'i ngo bo'o // mngon par 'du byed par snang ba ni /
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i ngo bo'o //üîΩde dag gi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzung ba'i ngo bo'o // de dag gi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.

original: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir shin tu med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir shin tu med pa nyid de /
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.üîΩThe appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.

original: mtshan nyid des chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid des chos thams cad mtshan nyid med pa'o //
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the inconceivable.

original: de dag med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bor skye pa med pa nyid ni /üîΩde nyid mtshan nyid @288b med pas bdag nyid ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bor skye pa med pa nyid ni /üîΩde nyid mtshan nyid @288b med pas bdag nyid ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The appearance of the inconceivable is the nature of the

original: chos thams cad rgyu las ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad rgyu las ma skyes pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma skyes pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: The statement because all phenomena are not produced from a cause is called the sameness of non-production.

original: bdag nyid kyi rgyu las ma skyes pa'i phyir 'gag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rgyu las ma skyes pa'i phyir 'gag pa med pa'o //
translated: Because they are not produced from their own cause, they are unceasing.

original: ma skyes pa dang mi 'gag pa ni gzod ma nas shin tu zhi ba'i mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang mi 'gag pa ni gzod ma nas shin tu zhi ba'i mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Non-production and non-cessation are the primordial and utter peace of sameness.

original: don dam pa'i dngos po de nyid kyi gzung bar bya ba yang dag pa'i ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i gzung bar gyur pas chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa'i dngos po de nyid kyi gzung bar bya ba yang dag pa'i ye shes spros pa dang bral ba'i gzung bar gyur pas chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that ultimate reality itself is the object to be apprehended, and because it becomes the object of correct wisdom free from conceptual elaborations, all phenomena become the aspect free from conceptual elaborations.

original: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad spros pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the sameness of all phenomena being free from conceptual elaborations.

original: chos thams cad blang ba dang dor la ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad blang ba dang dor la ste /
translated: All phenomena are free from acceptance and rejection.

original: 'dzin ba dang gtong ba dang bral ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dzin ba dang gtong ba dang bral ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba'i mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: Because they are free from grasping and abandoning, they are the sameness of being free from formation.

original: 'gro ba gzhan du phung po'i khyad par gzhan dor ba dang / len pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad bya ba dang bral ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba gzhan du phung po'i khyad par gzhan dor ba dang / len pa med pa'i phyir chos thams cad bya ba dang bral ba nyid do //
translated: Because there is no other aggregate to be discarded or taken up in another life, all phenomena are devoid of action.

original: don dam par zhi ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir blang ba dang dor ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: don dam par zhi ba'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir blang ba dang dor ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa dang bral ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because they are ultimately characterized by peace, they are devoid of the manifest activity of adopting and rejecting.

original: de nyid ni don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni de dang bral ba'o zhes pas dben pa'i khyad par mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni don dam par ngo bo nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang / sdug bsngal gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir chos thams cad ni de dang bral ba'o zhes pas dben pa'i khyad par mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because they are ultimately free from the defilements of the afflictions and the suffering that arise from them, all phenomena are free from them. This is called the sameness of the distinctive isolation.

original: rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las grol ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir /üîΩsgyu ma lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa las grol ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyi phyir / sgyu ma lta bu'i mnyam pa nyid ni /
translated: The imagined nature is called the sameness of illusion because it is characterized by being free from both existence and nonexistence.

original: sprul pa lta bu'o bar gyi mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: sprul pa lta bu'o bar gyi mnyam pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The dependent nature is called the sameness of the magical creation because it is like a magical creation.üîΩThe perfected nature is called the sameness of the interval because it is like an interval.

original: de nyid ni rnams par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rnams par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid ni gnyis su med pa'i mnyam pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: That is the domain of nonconceptual wisdom, the nondual sameness of the characteristics of existence and nonexistence.

original: de ltar de dag gi don rnam par phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de dag gi don rnam par phye ba yin no //
translated: Thus, their meaning is distinguished.

original: gnas pa de la gnas pa de sems can rnam la snying rjes rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa de la gnas pa de sems can rnam la snying rjes rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abiding in that, one's compassion for sentient beings expands.

original: 'dir mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: Here, the s≈´tra says:

original: de de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la de ltar rtog pa na /
analyzed: de de ltar chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la de ltar rtog pa na /
translated: When one thus contemplates the nature of all phenomena,

original: de de bas kyang shas cher snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de de bas kyang shas cher snying rje chen po sngon du 'gro ba dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: one's great compassion becomes even greater.

original: byang chub la 'dun pa drag po skyes shing zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: byang chub la 'dun pa drag po skyes shing zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The s≈´tra says: One gives rise to a strong aspiration for enlightenment.

original: gang yang snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang yang snying rje chen po yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The s≈´tra says: In order to perfect great compassion.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba la de'i mdo'i tshig ni 'jig rten 'byung @289a * //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa zhes bya ba la de'i mdo'i tshig ni 'jig rten 'byung @289a * //
translated: Arising and destruction - the s≈´tra says: The arising and destruction of the world,

original: ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta'o zhes bya ba yin te /üîΩde la 'byung ba ni nag po'i phyogs te /
analyzed: ba dang 'jig pa la rnam par lta'o zhes bya ba yin te / de la 'byung ba ni nag po'i phyogs te /
translated: He observes the arising and passing away of the world.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma rig pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'o //üîΩ'jig pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma rig pa la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung ba'o // 'jig pa ni dkar po'i phyogs te /
translated: Therein, the dark side is the arising of the world, i.e. the successive arising of dependent origination beginning with ignorance.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la brten pa'i ma rig pa 'gag pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la brten pa'i ma rig pa 'gag pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: The bright side is the passing away of the world, i.e. the successive cessation of dependent origination beginning with the cessation of ignorance that is based on dependent origination.

original: rnam pa thams cad dpyod par byed cing zhes bya bas ni rnam pa bcu pos so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad dpyod par byed cing zhes bya bas ni rnam pa bcu pos so //
translated: He examines all the aspects of dependent origination with ten aspects.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba legs par dpyod pa'i zhes bya ba la des dpyod par byed cing zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba legs par dpyod pa'i zhes bya ba la des dpyod par byed cing zhes bya ba ni rtog pa'o //
translated: He examines dependent origination well means that he examines it with that.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he fully understands.

original: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtog pa rnam pa bcus rtog pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rgya cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la rtog pa rnam pa bcus rtog pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du rgya cher rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the examination of dependent origination with ten kinds of examination should be understood in detail according to the sutra.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa la brten nas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa la brten nas /
translated: Based on the knowledge of dependent origination,üîΩthe three doors of liberation arise.

original: de'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum skye'o zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la brten nas rnam pa bcus rtog par dpyod pa ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum skye'o zhes bya ba ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la brten nas rnam pa bcus rtog par dpyod pa ni skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This means that based on dependent origination, the ten aspects of investigation arise.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum po bshad pa ni ming tsam ste stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum po bshad pa ni ming tsam ste stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three liberations that have been explained are mere names, namely emptiness and so on.

original: gzhi des kyang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Also, by that basis,

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa thob pas bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang / tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni rnam par thar pa thob pas bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang / byed pa po'i 'du shes dang / tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i 'du shes mi 'byung ngo //
translated: means that due to attaining liberation through emptiness and so on, the discrimination of self and other, the discrimination of an agent, the discrimination of a feeler, and the discrimination of existence and nonexistence do not arise.

original: 'dir mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: 'dir mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: Here is the sutra passage:

original: de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag bsgoms pas bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum po 'di dag bsgoms pas bdag dang gzhan gyi 'du shes dang bral ba dang / byed pa po dang / tshor ba po'i 'du shes dang bral ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is free from the notion of self and other, free from the notion of an agent and a feeler, and free from the notion of existence and non-existence.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi 'dus shes bsdus pa ni /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi 'dus shes bsdus pa ni /
translated: The notion of self and other is included in the notion of an agent and a feeler.

original: byed pa po dang tshor ba po zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po dang tshor ba po zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: The notion of existence and non-existence is included in the notion of an agent and a feeler.

original: de ltar don dam pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can la lta ba de ni zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa la mkhas pa dang / sems can la lta ba de ni zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: Thus, the one who is skilled in the ultimate and who sees sentient beings, as stated in the s≈´tra,

original: de byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma grub pa rnams yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: de byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma grub pa rnams yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po sngon du btang ste /
translated: he, in order to establish the factors of enlightenment that are not yet established, with great compassion at the forefront,

original: de bas kyang shas cher shin tu brtson par byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher shin tu brtson par byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: he makes even greater effort.

original: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / rkyen @289b tshogs pa las ni 'byung la zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang ldan pa dang / rkyen @289b tshogs pa las ni 'byung la zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the combination of afflictions and conditions, it arises.‚Äù

original: de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: He thinks this:

original: 'du ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du ba las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the combination of causes, the conditioned arises.

original: 'bral ba las ni 'dus byas mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'bral ba las ni 'dus byas mi 'byung ngo //
translated: From the separation of causes, the conditioned does not arise.

original: tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo //üîΩma tshogs pa las ni mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i rkyen tshogs pa yod na ni /
analyzed: tshogs pa las ni 'dus byas 'byung ngo // ma tshogs pa las ni mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i kun du sbyor ba'i rkyen tshogs pa yod na ni /
translated: From the collection of causes, the conditioned arises.üîΩFrom the non-collection of causes, it does not arise.‚Äù

original: 'byung bar 'gyur la med na ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur la med na ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If the condition of the combination of afflictions exists, it arises. If it does not exist, it does not arise.

original: 'de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: 'de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: rkyen ma tshogs pa las ni mi 'byung bas de bas na bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rkyen ma tshogs pa las ni mi 'byung bas de bas na bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the non-combination of conditions, it does not arise.‚Äù Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúTherefore, I will not combine with conditions.‚Äù

original: de dag gi mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: de dag gi mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The s≈´tra passage is:üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, the arising of the conditioned is also known. The passing away of the conditioned is also known. The cessation of the conditioned is also known. The relinquishment of the conditioned is also known.‚Äù

original: de ltar bdag gis 'dus byas nyes pa'i skyon chags pa de lta bu 'di shes par byas la 'du ba 'di dang / tshogs pa 'di'i rgyun bcad par yang bya zhing /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis 'dus byas nyes pa'i skyon chags pa de lta bu 'di shes par byas la 'du ba 'di dang / tshogs pa 'di'i rgyun bcad par yang bya zhing /
translated: Thus, having understood that conditioned things are flawed with faults in this way, I will cut off this association and this gathering.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi bar bya ba thob par yang mi bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'du byed rnams shin tu zhi bar bya ba thob par yang mi bya'o snyam mo zhes bya ba'o /
translated: But, in order to ripen sentient beings, I will not attain the pacification of conditioned things.

original: bdag nyid bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nyon mongs pa med par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to protect oneself‚Äù means in order to be without afflictions.

original: 'dus byas rnam par zhi bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnam par zhi bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems can yongs su gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should not pacify conditioned things‚Äù means in order to take care of sentient beings.

original: de ltar ye shes dang snying rje dang ldan pa de ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar ye shes dang snying rje dang ldan pa de ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, one who has both wisdom and compassion‚Äù means

original: de'i mdo ni /
analyzed: de'i mdo ni /
translated: the following.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags shing ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gag par so sor rtog pa ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de de ltar 'du byed du gyur pa nyes pa mang po'i skyon chags shing ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mi 'gag par so sor rtog pa ni /
translated: O sons of the Victor, in that way, the bodhisattva who has the discernment that conditioned things are flawed by many faults, are devoid of intrinsic reality, are unborn, and are unceasing,

original: snying rje chen po mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs yongs su mi gtong bas chags pa med ba'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: snying rje chen po mngon par bsgrub pa dang / sems can gyi tshogs yongs su mi gtong bas chags pa med ba'i ye shes la mngon par phyogs pa zhes bya ba shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang ba'i tshul gyis mngon sum du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: attains the stage of the perfection of wisdom called facing the wisdom free of attachment through the method of illumination, by accomplishing great compassion and not abandoning the mass of sentient beings.

original: chags pa med pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the meaning of being free of attachment,

original: des na de 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa thams cad la chags pa med par spyod de zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na de 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa thams cad la chags pa med par spyod de zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is said, Therefore, he practices all mundane activities without attachment.

original: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med pa'i sbyor ba ni /
translated: The application of non-attachment is

original: chags pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa med pa'o //
translated: being free of attachment.

original: 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa la spyod de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa la spyod de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Practicing all mundane activities without attachment means

original: rang gi don gyi spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don gyi spyod pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the practice for one's own benefit.

original: gnas pa de la yang sa bdun pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas pa de la yang sa bdun pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And in that state, on the seventh spiritual level, etc.

original: rnon po zhes bya ba ni @290a * //
analyzed: rnon po zhes bya ba ni @290a * //
translated: The word sharp

original: chen po yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chen po yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: means great.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa mthar thub par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa mthar thub par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The practice that is the result of preparation is perfected, is what is meant.

original: de'i ngo ba'o bzod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo ba'o bzod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood as included in the acceptance of the non-production of things.

original: de yang mdo las /
analyzed: de yang mdo las /
translated: And that is taught in the sutra:

original: de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang bar gyur nas /
analyzed: de ye shes de lta bu dang ldan zhing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa snang bar gyur nas /
translated: Endowed with that knowledge, abiding in the perfection of wisdom, having become radiant,

original: byang chub kyi yan lag sdud pa'i rkyen rnams kyang nye bar sgrub la 'dus byas dang 'grogs par yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag sdud pa'i rkyen rnams kyang nye bar sgrub la 'dus byas dang 'grogs par yang mi gnas so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: he establishes the conditions for the accumulation of the factors of enlightenment, and does not abide in association with the compounded.

original: mdo 'di'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mdo 'di'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of this sutra is taught:

original: de chags pa med pa'i ye shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de chags pa med pa'i ye shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the knowledge that is free from attachment, etc.

original: 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la rab tu sbyor bar yang byed la /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams la rab tu sbyor bar yang byed la /
translated: He also applies himself to the conditioned own-being of the factors of enlightenment.

original: 'dus byas kyi skyon gyis kyang mi gos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi skyon gyis kyang mi gos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that he is not defiled by the faults of the conditioned.

original: rab tu zhi ba la yang zhi bar lta la /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba la yang zhi bar lta la /
translated: He also views peace as peace,

original: de la yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: but he does not abide in it.

original: 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the sutra are:

original: 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yang so sor rtog la /üîΩbyang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yang so sor rtog la / byang chub kyi yan lag yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir /

original: de la yang mi gnas te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la yang mi gnas te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: but he does not abide in that because the factors of enlightenment are incomplete.

original: de nyid kyi rjes thogs su de'i tshig bstan pa'i mdo ni /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes thogs su de'i tshig bstan pa'i mdo ni /
translated: The sutra passage which immediately follows that teaches the words:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa mngon du gyur pa 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas thabs dang shes rab dang ldan pa'i bsam pa nyid yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: He who is established on this, the Radiant Bodhisattva stage, up to: the intention endowed with means and insight is perfected.

original: de dag bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir/ de ltar thabs dang / shes rab kyi ye shes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de dag bsdus pa'i don bstan pa'i phyir/ de ltar thabs dang / shes rab kyi ye shes dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of their summary, it says, ‚ÄúThus, the pristine consciousness of method and wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la yang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: In order to teach the meaning of their summary, it says, ‚ÄúThus, with the wisdom of method and wisdom‚Ä¶‚Äù up to ‚Äú‚Ä¶one should know that it is the same for the meditative stabilizations of wishlessness and signlessness.‚Äù

original: de thob pas sngar bstan pa'i bsam pa'i gtso bo yang thob par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de thob pas sngar bstan pa'i bsam pa'i gtso bo yang thob par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that by attaining those, one also attains the principal intention that was previously taught, it says,

original: de dag mngon du gyur pas na mi phyed pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag mngon du gyur pas na mi phyed pa'i bsam pa can du 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy their manifestation, one has an indivisible intention.‚Äù

original: mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba nyid ni mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung nyid kyis bshad pa yin no /
analyzed: mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba nyid ni mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung nyid kyis bshad pa yin no /
translated: The quality of being unassailable is explained in the text itself, beginning with ‚Äúby all the tƒ´rthikas and mƒÅras‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: rnam ba thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dbye ba thams cad kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam ba thams cad du zhes bya ba ni dbye ba thams cad kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas mthong ba la sogs pa ni sngar bstan pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: As before means that seeing the Buddha and so on is as previously explained.

original: dpe'i khyad par bstan pa ni /

analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //

original: @290b dper na zla ba'i 'od ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: mdor bsdus pa'i don bstan pa ni /

analyzed: sa'i des pa'i tshig ni mngon du gyur pa'i don gyis bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa 'di la /
translated: For one abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: mdo 'di nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mdo 'di nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: The path of application is the

original: mdo'i chig ni kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' sa drug pa la lam shin tu yongs su rdzogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i de byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun ba gnon te /

translated: O sons of the victors, the bodhisattva who has completely perfected the path on the sixth bodhisattva ground enters the seventh bodhisattva ground.

original: de thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par bcus gnon te /
analyzed: de thabs dang shes rab kyis mngon par bsgrubs pa'i lam gzhan brtsams pa'i khyad par bcus gnon te /
translated: He enters it through the ten distinctive features of the path that are accomplished by means of method and wisdom.

original: bcu gang zhen /
analyzed: bcu gang zhen /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i yid dang ldan la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa shin tu bsgoms pa'i yid dang ldan la /
translated: He possesses a mind that is thoroughly cultivated in terms of emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa yang /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa yang /
translated: He has also accumulated the great collections of merit and wisdom.

original: sogs pa yin zhes bya ba de'i dbang du byas nas bstan pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa 'grub par byed pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams ba dang zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi tshogs gzhan dag ni stong pa nyid dang /

translated: The teaching that is given in terms of the phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is the one that begins with the phrase ‚Äúthe bodhisattva who is skilled in the means of accomplishing the perfections.‚Äù

original: 'gal ba med pas thabs zhes bya ba 'di ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pas thabs zhes bya ba 'di ma yin no //
translated: It is not a method because there is no contradiction.

original: sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams la phan pa dang / bde ba'i bsam pa las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the sutra beginning with from the thought of benefit and happiness for sentient beings

original: bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / srog med pa dang / sems can med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i chos la yang 'jug la /
translated: mean that one engages in the teachings of selflessness, life-lessness, sentient-being-lessness, and person-lessness,

original: tshad med pa bzhi mngon par sgrub pa yang mi gtong ba yin @291a * //üîΩzhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi mngon par sgrub pa yang mi gtong ba yin @291a * // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: but does not abandon the accomplishment of the four immeasurables.

original: shes rab kyis 'dus byas rnams stong par mthong ba la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyis 'dus byas rnams stong par mthong ba la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning is that one abides in the insight that sees conditioned things as empty,

original: snying rjes ni sems can rnams la tshad med pas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snying rjes ni sems can rnams la tshad med pas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and abides in the compassion that is immeasurable toward sentient beings.

original: bsod nams kyi chos kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed la /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi chos kyi tshogs pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par 'du bya ba yang mngon par 'du byed la /
translated: The words of the sutra beginning with one also accumulates the collection of meritorious dharmas, the perfections, and formations

original: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos gang la yang mngon par zhen pa med pa yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: mean that one demonstrates the meaning of the teaching that one does not cling to any dharma.

original: byang chub kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gong nas gong du yang skye ba las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba la byang chub kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams gong nasüîΩgong du gong ma'i mthar thug pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos gong nas gong du yang skye ba las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba la byang chub kyi phyir bsod nams kyi tshogs kyis byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos rnams gong nas gong du gong ma'i mthar thug pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the supreme perfection, the perfection of all perfections.

original: rtag tu dge ba bsgom pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta na yang chos gang la yang mngon par zhen par mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmdo'i tshig ni /üîΩkhams gsum pa thams cad las dben par gyur pa yang thob la /üîΩkhams gsum pa'i rgyan rnam par bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba bsgom pa'i sbyor bas zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde lta na yang chos gang la yang mngon par zhen par mi byed do zhes bya ba'o //üîΩmdo'i tshig ni /üîΩkhams gsum pa thams cad las dben par gyur pa yang thob la /üîΩkhams gsum pa'i rgyan rnam par bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the best of all perfections, the highest, the most excellent, the most sublime, the unsurpassed, the unequalled, the unequaled, the peerless, the foremost, the original: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba la nyan thos rnams ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gnyis kas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir khams gsum las dben pa nyid thob par 'gyur gyi khams gsum pa'i rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par sgrub pa yong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin pa las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba la nyan thos rnams ni bsam pa dang / sbyor ba gnyis kas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir khams gsum las dben pa nyid thob par 'gyur gyi khams gsum pa'i rgyan rnam par sgrub pa mngon par sgrub pa yong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The uncommon refers to the fact that the Sravakas, because they desire Nirvana through both their intention and their application, attain only the state of being apart from the three realms, but do not manifest the adornment of the three realms.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sbyor bas dben par gyur pa thob kyang rgyan rnam par sgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i bsam pa nyid dang / 'khor bar gtogs pa'i sbyor bas dben par gyur pa thob kyang rgyan rnam par sgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub bar byed pa yin no //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, although they attain the state of being apart from both the intention of belonging to Nirvana and the application of belonging to Samsara, they do manifest the adornment of the three realms.

original: mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the Sutra are:

original: nyon mongs pa 'bar ba thams cad dang bral bas shin tu zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba yang yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'bar ba thams cad dang bral bas shin tu zhi zhing nye bar zhi ba yang yin la /
translated: It is the state of complete peace and utter peace, free from all the burning fevers of the afflictions.

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi nyon mongs pa 'bar ba rab tu zhi bar bya ba yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is also the accomplishment of the pacification of the burning of the afflictions of desire, hatred, and ignorance of all sentient beings.

original: de'i don ni /üîΩrang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba la rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang nyon mongs pa rnams zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba'i phyir gcig pur @291b gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu 'bar
analyzed: de'i don ni / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba la rang sangs rgyas rnams kyang nyon mongs pa rnams zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba'i phyir gcig pur @291b gnas pa yin pa'i phyir sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu 'bar
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: ba nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ba nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir mngon par sgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Beginning with the uncommonness of the pratyekabuddhas, the pratyekabuddhas are also pacified and completely pacified in regard to the afflictions, and because they abide alone, they are not the accomplishment of the pacification of the burning of the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: tshogs kyi nang du gnas pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang du gnas pas 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abide in the midst of the assembly, they are afraid.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam pa gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rnam pa gnyi ga phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattvas are endowed with both aspects.

original: mdo las / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang zhes bya ba nas gnyis su med par yang khong du chud la /
analyzed: mdo las / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang zhes bya ba nas gnyis su med par yang khong du chud la /
translated: One should understand that they are like illusions, mirages, and so on, andüîΩone should also accomplish the thought that distinguishes the immeasurably various actions and activities.

original: las dang bya ba rnam par phye ba tshad med pa'i bsam ba yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni sems can gyi khams las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las dang bya ba rnam par phye ba tshad med pa'i bsam ba yang mngon par sgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni sems can gyi khams las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that one should begin with the realm of sentient beings.

original: sems can thams cad sgyu ma'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang de ltar rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad sgyu ma'i rjes su 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyang de ltar rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: One should understand that all sentient beings are like illusions, and all world systems are like that.

original: de lta na yang bya ba'i dbye ba tshad med pa dag kyang mngon par sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang bya ba'i dbye ba tshad med pa dag kyang mngon par sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Even though that is so, one should also accomplish the immeasurably various distinctions of activities.

original: las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las sna tshogs mngon par 'du byed pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is endowed with the various activities of the perfections.

original: zhing gi tha gru nam mkha' dang mnyam par shin tu bsgoms pa'i yid dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: zhing gi tha gru nam mkha' dang mnyam par shin tu bsgoms pa'i yid dang yang ldan la /
translated: One should also be endowed with the mind that is well cultivated in the vastness of the realm of space.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rgyan rnam par bsgrub pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is this:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams las brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It begins with the world-realms.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams nam mkha' dang 'dra bar yang shes la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams nam mkha' dang 'dra bar yang shes la /
translated: One should know that the Buddha-lands are like space,

original: de lta na yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams yongs su spyang ba'i phyir las rnam pa sna tshogs kyang mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de lta na yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams yongs su spyang ba'i phyir las rnam pa sna tshogs kyang mngon par 'du byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: and yet one should still create various actions in order to purify the Buddha-lands. This is the meaning.

original: 'di dag gi mdo'i don ni /
analyzed: 'di dag gi mdo'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of these sutras is this:

original: sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du yang 'jug la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi sku'i rang bzhin du yang 'jug la /
translated: All Buddhas enter into the nature of the Dharma-body,

original: gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan rnam par sgrub pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa yin ;
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po'i rgyan rnam par sgrub pa yang mngon par bsgrub pa yin ;
translated: and yet they also accomplish the adornment of the form-body with the major and minor marks.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung brjod du med cing sgra dbyangs dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung brjod du med cing sgra dbyangs dang bral ba ste /
translated: The speech of the Tathagata is inexpressible and free from sound and voice,üîΩand yet it is also the accomplishment of the adornment of the form-body with the major and minor marks.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yang mos la /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhi bar yang mos la /
translated: And he is absorbed in the natural peace of all things.

original: gsung dbyangs yan lag thams cad rnam par phye bas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mngon par sgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin /
analyzed: gsung dbyangs yan lag thams cad rnam par phye bas rnam par dag pa'i rgyan mngon par sgrub pa yang mngon par sgrub pa yin /
translated: He is absorbed in the attainment of the adornment of the purification of all the aspects of the melody of the Buddha's speech.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dus gsum mtshan nyid gcig tu thugs su chud pa la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dus gsum mtshan nyid gcig tu thugs su chud pa la yang 'jug la /
translated: He penetrates the comprehension of the Buddhas, the Lords, of the single characteristic of the three times.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: And he penetrates the expression of the thoughts of beings.

original: mtshan nyid la rtog pa bgrang ba tha dad pa brjod pa la yang 'jug pa yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid la rtog pa bgrang ba tha dad pa brjod pa la yang 'jug pa yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: He penetrates the expression of the different enumerations of the conceptual thoughts of characteristics.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs @292a * //üîΩshes pa las brtsams pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs @292a * // shes pa las brtsams pa ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The body, speech, and mind of the TathagataüîΩare to be understood as space, as the nature of reality, and as the Dharma Body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis chos kyi skur ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams ni nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis chos nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyis chos kyi skur ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Tathagatas are to be understood as the Dharma Body, which is the nature of space, the nature of reality, and the nature of suchness.

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is formless.

original: de lta na yang gzugs kyi sku 'thob par byed pa'i phrin las rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par 'du byed pa yang mdzad do //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzugs kyi sku 'thob par byed pa'i phrin las rnam pa sna tshogs la mngon par 'du byed pa yang mdzad do //
translated: Nevertheless, he does perform the various kinds of deeds that cause the attainment of the form body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung brjod du med cing sgra dbyangs dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi gsung brjod du med cing sgra dbyangs dang bral ba rang bzhin gyis zhi ba'o zhes ji lta ba bzhin du brjod do //
translated: The speech of the Tathagatas is inexpressible, free from sound and voice, and naturally tranquil.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba'i mdo las ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi gsang ba'i mdo las ;
translated: This is stated in accordance with the Tathagata-acintya-guhya-sutra,üîΩwhich says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni yi ge gcig kyang brjod pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni yi ge gcig kyang brjod pa mi mnga'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //
translated: The Tathagata does not even utter a single syllable.

original: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phrin las rnam pa sna tshogs kyang mngon par 'du mdzad do zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: de lta na yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung dbyangs yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa thob par 'gyur ba'i phrin las rnam pa sna tshogs kyang mngon par 'du mdzad do zhes bya ba yin no ;
