translated: Nevertheless, he does perform the various kinds of deeds that cause the attainment of the Tathagata's speech endowed with sixty melodious qualities.

original: / mtshan nyid gcig par zhes bya ba'i tshig ni don dam par mtshan nyid gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig par dus gsum thugs su chud pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: / mtshan nyid gcig par zhes bya ba'i tshig ni don dam par mtshan nyid gcig pas mtshan nyid gcig par dus gsum thugs su chud pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase with a single characteristic means that, ultimately, there is a single characteristic, and thus, the engagement in the realization of the three times is with a single characteristic.

original: de lta na yang bskal pa du ma mang por mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang grangs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas sgom pa la yang 'jug par mdzad de sems can gyi bsam pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang bskal pa du ma mang por mtshan nyid sna tshogs dang grangs sna tshogs kyi sgo nas sgom pa la yang 'jug par mdzad de sems can gyi bsam pa la ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, he also engages in the cultivation of the various characteristics and the various enumerations for many eons, because he takes into account the inclinations of sentient beings.

original: de de dag dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i lam gzhan gyi khyad par las brtsams pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de de dag dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni ji skad bstan pa'i lam gzhan gyi khyad par las brtsams pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with those means that he is endowed with the distinctive qualities of the path that have been taught.

original: de las gong du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sems can gyi khams tshad med pa la yang 'jug pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: de las gong du byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de sems can gyi khams tshad med pa la yang 'jug pa zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: From that, on the seventh bodhisattva ground, the bodhisattva who is abiding there engages with the immeasurable realm of sentient beings, and so on.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi theg pa chen po yang dag par sgrub pa la 'jug pa tshad med pa yang 'jug go zhes bya ba'i gzhung mdor bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul tshad med grangs med par khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi theg pa chen po yang dag par sgrub pa la 'jug pa tshad med pa yang 'jug go zhes bya ba'i gzhung mdor bstan pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yul tshad med grangs med par khong du chud par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa
translated: The brief indication of the sutra passage that states ‚Äúone enters into the immeasurable engagement in the correct practice of the Mahayana of the Bhagavat Buddhas‚Äù is the statement ‚Äúone will comprehend the immeasurable and innumerable objects of the Tathagata.‚Äù

original: yin no // de las gong du mdor bstan pa ni de 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yin no // de las gong du mdor bstan pa ni de 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The brief indication above that is higher than that is as follows.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul ni tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul ni tshad med pa ste /
translated: One thinks, ‚ÄúThe object of the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones is immeasurable.

original: de ni bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig phrag bcu pa ji snyed pa de snyed kyis bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bskal ba bye ba khrag khrig phrag bcu pa ji snyed pa de snyed kyis bgrang bar sla ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not easy to count it in ten quintillions of eons.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul de @292b bdag gis yang dag par bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yul de @292b bdag gis yang dag par bskyed par bya'o //
translated: I will generate that object of the Bhagavat Buddhas.‚Äù

original: rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub par yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / lhun gyis grub par yongs su rdzogs par bya'o zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and to be spontaneously accomplished, without conceptuality and without discursive thought.

original: de yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir yang lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi yul tshad med pa yang dag par bskyed par mthong nas zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dag par bskyed pa'i phyir yang lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pas sangs rgyas kyi yul tshad med pa yang dag par bskyed par mthong nas zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: And in order to generate that, he sees that the immeasurable domain of the buddhas is generated by the spontaneous, signless, nonconceptual, and non discursive.

original: de'i rjes la de ltar legs par so sor brtags pa'i ye shes dang mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la de ltar legs par so sor brtags pa'i ye shes dang mngon par shes pa dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: After that, he who is endowed with the wisdom and the superknowledges that have been well investigated in that way, up to

original: spyod lam thams cad la gnas shing 'du shes yid la bya ba de lta bu dag dang mi 'bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: spyod lam thams cad la gnas shing 'du shes yid la bya ba de lta bu dag dang mi 'bral ba yin no zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: he is never separated from those perceptions and mental activities while he is engaged in all his daily activities.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / bar chad med par sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / bar chad med par sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: He is applied without interruption and without a break, up to

original: gnas skabs thams cad na gnas pa de lam dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: gnas skabs thams cad na gnas pa de lam dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: In all circumstances, he is not separated from the path.

original: yang de'i rjes la mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: yang de'i rjes la mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni /
translated: Next, the words of the sutra are taught:

original: de sems bskyed pa re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yang dag par bsgrub pa yang dag par 'grub po zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de sems bskyed pa re re la yang byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bcu yang dag par bsgrub pa yang dag par 'grub po zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In each generation of the mind, the bodhisattva accomplishes the ten perfections.

original: mdor na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig re re la yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: mdor na byang chub kyi yan lag gi chos thams cad skad cig re re la yang yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: In brief, all the dharmas of the branches of enlightenment are perfected in each moment.

original: de'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of that is taught:

original: de ni sems kyi skad cig re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems kyi skad cig re re la pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In each moment of mind, all the dharmas concordant with enlightenment, such as the ten perfections, are perfected in a special way.

original: de'i rjes la yang mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la yang mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni /
translated: Next, the words of the sutra are taught:

original: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de skad ces smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Having been thus addressed, the bodhisattva Vimukti candra said to the bodhisattva Vajra garbha...

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di dag la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par skyes pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnams skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di dag la ni sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par skyes pas byang chub kyi yan lag rnams skad cig re re la yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: On these seven bodhisattva stages, because all the qualities of the Buddha are truly generated, the limbs of enlightenment are perfected in every moment.

original: 'di'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of this,

original: gnas pa gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan dag la ni de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: it is not so in the other abodes...

original: mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya ste /
analyzed: mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya ste /
translated: and should be understood according to the sutra.

original: gnas pa dang po la ni smon lam gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi chos rnams la kun du spyod do //
analyzed: gnas pa dang po la ni smon lam gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i byang chub kyi chos rnams la kun du spyod do //
translated: In the first abode, one practices the qualities of enlightenment which are included in vows.

original: gnas pa gnyis pa la ni tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma dang @293a * //
analyzed: gnas pa gnyis pa la ni tshul khrims 'chal pa'i dri ma dang @293a * //
translated: In the second abode, one is free from the stain of immorality.

original: bral ba'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa nyid do //
analyzed: bral ba'i phyir dang / de'i gnyen po'i phyogs kyi dge ba'i rtsa ba las kyi lam gyis bsdus pa nyid do //
translated: because of being free from them, and because of the roots of virtue that are included in the path of action which are the counteragents to them.

original: gnas pa gsum pa la ni smon lam rnams rnam par 'phel zhing mang du thos pa tshol zhing /
analyzed: gnas pa gsum pa la ni smon lam rnams rnam par 'phel zhing mang du thos pa tshol zhing /
translated: In the third abode, the prayers increase and one seeks much learning.

original: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas chos kyi snang bas rab tu phye ba la kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / ting nge 'dzin la brten nas chos kyi snang bas rab tu phye ba la kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: And, based on the meditative stabilization, one practices with the light of Dharma.

original: gnas pa bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa bzhi pa la ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams bsgom pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: In the fourth abode, one cultivates the factors of enlightenment.

original: gnas pa lnga pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i las kyi gnas kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams kyis yongs su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa lnga pa la ni 'jig rten pa'i bzo'i las kyi gnas kha na ma tho ba med pa rnams kyis yongs su bsdus pa'o //
translated: In the fifth abode, one practices the worldly arts and crafts that are without fault.

original: gnas pa drug pa la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo la so sor rtog pa la 'jug par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa drug pa la ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zab mo la so sor rtog pa la 'jug par gtogs pa'o //
translated: In the sixth abode, one engages in the discernment of profound dependent origination.

original: de lta bu'i tshul gyis rnam pa re re nas yongs su bcad pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul gyis rnam pa re re nas yongs su bcad pas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by fully discerning each aspect, the qualities of a buddha are perfected.

original: yang gnas pa bdun pa 'di la ni khyad par du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi phyogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma dang bral ba rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang gnas pa bdun pa 'di la ni khyad par du sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par bskyed pas byang chub kyi phyogs rnams yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas lhun gyis grub cing mtshan ma dang bral ba rtog pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, on this seventh stage, the factors of enlightenment are perfected because all the qualities of a buddha are perfectly generated, spontaneously and without signs, free from conceptual thought and discursive thought.

original: de'i phyir de nyid la de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid la de dag thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsal bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is clearly taught that all of them are perfected right there.

original: de dag gi rgyu bstan pa ni mdo las /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu bstan pa ni mdo las /
translated: The teaching on their cause is in a sutra:

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is it so?

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pas ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis 'di ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pas ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa'i spyod pa gnon pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: O sons of the victors, this is the bodhisattvas' conduct that arises from application, because it brings about the perfection of wisdom and the conduct of superknowledge.

original: 'dir yang de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, in order to teach its cause,

original: gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas bsdus pa dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i gnas pa brgyad pa la 'jug pa yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas bsdus pa dang / ye shes dang / mngon par shes pa dang / spyod pa rnam par dag pas bsdus pa'i gnas pa brgyad pa la 'jug pa yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: this is the bodhisattvas' entry into the eighth stage, which is included in the perfection of the conduct that arises from application, and is included in the purification of wisdom, superknowledge, and conduct.

original: de lta bas na de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i phyir 'di ni yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, it is taught that this is perfected.üîΩIn order to teach the entry into the eighth stage, it is said:

original: gnas ba brgyad pa la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas ba brgyad pa la 'jug pa bstan pa'i phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva... and so on.

original: gcig tu nges par zhes bya ba ni dri ma rnam pa bzhi rab tu spangs pas lhun gyis grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par zhes bya ba ni dri ma rnam pa bzhi rab tu spangs pas lhun gyis grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro /
translated: ‚ÄúAscertained as one‚Äù means that one becomes spontaneously accomplished by completely abandoning the four types of defilements.

original: de dag spong ba ni nge nyid nas ston par 'gyur te /üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnam par @293b grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas dpe dang bcas par bstan pas 'di dag kho nas 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu zhing kun nas nyon
analyzed: de dag spong ba ni nge nyid nas ston par 'gyur te / byang chub sems dpa' rnam par @293b grol ba'i zla bas byang chub sems dpa' rdo rje snying po la 'di skad ces smras so zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas dpe dang bcas par bstan pas 'di dag kho nas 'gro ba thams cad du rgyu zhing kun nas nyon
translated: The abandonment of those will be taught just as it is.üîΩThe Bodhisattva Vimuktisena said to the Bodhisattva Vajra garbha:

original: mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
analyzed: mongs pa'i nyes pa rnams kyang rab tu shes te /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving begun with this, it is taught with examples that they are the only ones who travel in all the worlds and completely know the faults of the afflictions.

original: shin tu 'das pas de dag gis gos par gyur ces mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shin tu 'das pas de dag gis gos par gyur ces mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Since they are completely beyond them, it is not said that they are defiled by them.‚Äù

original: 'di dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows.

original: gnas pa bdun po 'di dag ni 'dren pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa bdun po 'di dag ni 'dren pa ma yin te /
translated: These seven stations are not leaders,

original: rnam grangs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par dag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: because they are described as afflicted and purified by way of synonyms.

original: rnam par dag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach their purity, he says:

original: gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ni kun nas nyon mongs can yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ni kun nas nyon mongs can yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni gnas pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par dag pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Because it precedes the purity of abiding, it is not defiled.

original: de ma thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ma thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i ngo bo ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it has not attained that, it is said to be of the nature of that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod par gtogs par brjod do zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag par gnas pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi spyod par gtogs par brjod do zhes bya ba ni rnam par dag par gnas pa'i ngo bo ma yin pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is said to belong to defiled conduct.

original: 'di'i mdo ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni /
translated: The sutra says:

original: sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The bodhisattva who is in this seventh stage has transcended all the defilements such as passion, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod pa dang / bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mngon par 'dod pa dang / bsam pa yongs su ma rdzogs pas nyon mongs pa med pa zhes kyang mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: and because he has not yet attained the wisdom of the Tathagata, and because his intentions are not yet fulfilled, he is not called one without affliction.

original: de'i don ni /
analyzed: de'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of that is as follows:

original: gnas pa de la de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: gnas pa de la de'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: In that state, all his afflictions such as attachment are abandoned, and so on, up to

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: because he desires the wisdom of the Buddha.

original: de la mdo ni /
analyzed: de la mdo ni /
translated: The sutra says:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni zhes bya ba nas lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin ni zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de ni zhes bya ba nas lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag pa'i yid kyi las dang ldan pa yin ni zhes bya ba'i bar yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is on this seventh bodhisattva stage is one who has attained the superior intention, and is endowed with the mental activity of pure superior intention.

original: de'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rnam par dbye ba bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the explanation of its divisions.

original: de ltar gyur pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las tshad med par 'jug go zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa de ni lhag pa'i bsam pa yongs su dag cing lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las tshad med par 'jug go zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One who has become that way has a completely pure superior intention and engages in immeasurable physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: de'i rjes la /
analyzed: de'i rjes la /
translated: After that,

original: de mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa de las thams cad kyi thams cad du yang @294a * //
analyzed: de mi dge ba'i las kyi lam gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas smad pa de las thams cad kyi thams cad du yang @294a * //
translated: he completely and totally transcends all the nonvirtuous paths of action that the Tathagata has condemned.

original: lhag par 'das pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lhag par 'das pa yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: slob dpon du lhag pa'i grags pa yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon du lhag pa'i grags pa yin te /
translated: he has the highest fame as a teacher.üîΩThere is no one equal to him in terms of thought or practice.

original: de dag dang bsam pa'am sbyor bas mnyam pa su yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gi don bstan pa ni mdo las bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de dag dang bsam pa'am sbyor bas mnyam pa su yang med do zhes bya ba'i bar 'di dag gi don bstan pa ni mdo las bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The meaning of these is taught by following the sutra itself,üîΩfrom:üîΩThose that the Tathagata has not praised are as before.

original: di las gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas ma bsngags pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: di las gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas ma bsngags pa rnams ni snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Up to:

original: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba mtshungs pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba mtshungs pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: There is no one equal to him in terms of superior intention and practice.

original: de'i rjes la mdo bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la mdo bstan pa ni /
translated: After that, the teaching of the sutra is:

original: bsam gtan rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang mngon par shes pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams gang dag yin pa de dag kyang bsgom pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du de la mngon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang / snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang mngon par shes pa rnams dang / rnam par thar pa rnams gang dag yin pa de dag kyang bsgom pa'i tshul gyis thams cad kyi thams cad du de la mngon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The meditative concentrations, the meditative absorptions, the meditative attainments, the superknowledges, and the forms of freedom that are cultivated by him or her will all become manifest to him or her in every way.

original: 'on kyang de tsam gyis rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de tsam gyis rnam par smin pa yongs su grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: However, this much alone does not constitute the perfection of the karmic maturation.

original: de'i don bstan pa ni /üîΩbsam gtan la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i don bstan pa ni / bsam gtan la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The meaning of this should be understood as follows:

original: gnas pa brgyad pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa brgyad pa la ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meditative concentrations and so on that are called the bodhisattva‚Äôs spiritual qualities that are conducive to enlightenment are the ones that are cultivated by a bodhisattva who is established in the pleasurable state of superior wisdom.üîΩHowever, this much alone does not constitute the perfection of the karmic maturation.

original: de'i rjes la 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de'i rjes la 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
translated: After that, the root text states, ‚ÄúIn this way, while he or she is established in this seventh pleasurable state, which is called that of superior wisdom, a bodhisattva‚Äù and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang / sa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa 'bum phrag bcu tshang ba la snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / sa yongs su sbyong bar byed pa 'bum phrag bcu tshang ba la snyoms par 'jug go zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the s≈´tra is taught:

original: de ltar zhugs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúThe one who has entered like this is said to be in the bodhisattva samƒÅdhi, up to

original: 'bum phrag bcu mngon par bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'bum phrag bcu mngon par bsgrub po zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: he accomplishes ten hundred thousand.‚Äù

original: de'i rjes la mdos bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i rjes la mdos bstan pa ni /
translated: After that, the teaching of the s≈´tra is:

original: de thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su sbyangs pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de thabs dang shes rab kyis yongs su sbyangs pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúHe, through skill in means and wisdom, having purified the bh≈´mis, up to

original: rnam bar dpyad pa'i sa yang mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam bar dpyad pa'i sa yang mngon du gyur pa yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: the bh≈´mi of Contemplation has been attained.‚Äù

original: de'i don nye bar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don nye bar bstan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of that should be taught.

original: de dag thob pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag thob pas nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi yul las yang dag par 'das par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: By attaining those, one goes beyond the domain of the ≈õrƒÅvaka and pratyekabuddha samƒÅdhis.

original: de dag gis ni bsam gtan gyi stobs dang ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni bsam gtan gyi stobs dang ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming yang mi shes na snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Since they do not even know the names of the powers of meditative stabilization and the concentrations, what need is there to speak of their being endowed with meditative attainment?

original: yang mdo las /
analyzed: yang mdo las /
translated: Again, a sutra states:

original: sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus @294b kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba 'byung zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sa bdun pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'i lus @294b kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba 'byung zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The immeasurable physical karma of the bodhisattva abiding on this seventh bodhisattva stage occurs free of signs, and so on up to:üîΩThe immeasurable mental karma of the bodhisattva occurs free of signs, and the forbearance of the nonarising of phenomena is purified and manifests.

original: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pas snang bar gyur pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i don bstan pa ni legs par yongs su sbyangs pas na shin tu yongs su
analyzed: yid kyi las tshad med pa mtshan ma dang bral ba shin tu yongs su sbyangs pa'i mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pas snang bar gyur pa 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i bar gyi mdo'i don bstan pa ni legs par yongs su sbyangs pas na shin tu yongs su
translated: The meaning of this sutra passage is explained in the commentary:

original: sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is well purified, it is called extremely purified.

original: tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir shes par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir shes par dka' ba yin no //
translated: Since it is immeasurable, it is difficult to know.

original: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i kun du rgyu ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i kun du rgyu ba thams cad dang bral ba'o zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because it is free from signs, it is free from all discursive thought.

original: rgyal po'i bu'i dpes rang gi blos rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir byas nas /
analyzed: rgyal po'i bu'i dpes rang gi blos rnam par dpyod pa'i phyir byas nas /
translated: The example of the prince shows that he analyzes with his own mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben la rgyu ba med pa yang thob pa yin te zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zab cing dben la rgyu ba med pa yang thob pa yin te zhes bstan nas /
translated: He has attained profound and secluded physical, verbal, and mental actions that are free from movement.

original: gong du khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su tshol ba'i brtson pa yang yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gong du khyad par du 'phags pa yongs su tshol ba'i brtson pa yang yongs su mi gtong ngo zhes gsungs pa'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: But he does not give up striving to seek out what is superior.

original: gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson pa yang mi gtong ste /
analyzed: gong du khyad par yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson pa yang mi gtong ste /
translated: He does not give up striving to seek out what is superior.

original: byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byang chub yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to perfect enlightenment.

original: sngar nas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yang dag par 'das pa yod na yang /
analyzed: sngar nas kyang nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las yang dag par 'das pa yod na yang /
translated: Even though he has already transcended the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas,

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas pa drug po sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la dmigs pa'i phyir gnas pa 'di la ni rang gi blos yul du shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas pa drug po sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams la dmigs pa'i phyir gnas pa 'di la ni rang gi blos yul du shes pa la gnas pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The other six abodes are abodes of the mind in the object, because they focus on the qualities of buddhahood.

original: sngar nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las shin tu 'das pa phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar nyid du de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skyes pa nyid kyis nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyis las shin tu 'das pa phyir ro //
translated: Because they are born in the family of the Tathagata, they have already gone far beyond the stage of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas.

original: da ni blo yongs su smin par rtogs par byas nas de dag gi yul las 'das pa yin no zhes bya bar dper mtshon pa'i phyir /üîΩkye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yan chad byang chub sems dpa' 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: da ni blo yongs su smin par rtogs par byas nas de dag gi yul las 'das pa yin no zhes bya bar dper mtshon pa'i phyir / kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa gang yan chad byang chub sems dpa' 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug ces bya ba nas /
translated: Now, in order to show that they have attained the full maturity of mind, and that they have gone beyond the domain of the latter, he gives an example:üîΩO sons of the Victor, on which stage do the Bodhisattvas enter into the absorption of cessation?üîΩO sons of the Victor, the Bodhisattvas, abiding in the limit of reality, do not manifest cessation.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnas pas kyang gnas la 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of this passage from the sutra is as follows:

original: gnas pa drug pa la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas pa drug pa la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The sixth abode:

original: gnas pa drug pa la ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim gyis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas pa drug pa la ni mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rim gyis 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One enters meditative attainment in cessation through the process of the serial meditative attainment of cessation.

original: 'di la ni skad cig re re la yang snyoms par 'jug par @295a * //
analyzed: 'di la ni skad cig re re la yang snyoms par 'jug par @295a * //
translated: One enters meditative attainment in each instant.

original: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what it means.

original: sems kyi skad cig gcig la snyoms par 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems kyi skad cig gcig la snyoms par 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One enters meditative attainment in one instant of mind.

original: de 'dod par gyur na 'dod pan kun du spyod pa'i sems kyi rjes thogs la 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de 'dod par gyur na 'dod pan kun du spyod pa'i sems kyi rjes thogs la 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba nas /
translated: If one wishes, one enters meditative attainment in cessation immediately after a mind that engages in desire realm objects.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa las langs nas de yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa la sogs pa yang go bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs pa las langs nas de yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa la sogs pa yang go bar bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one rises from meditative attainment in cessation and is skilled in thorough knowledge and so on.

original: 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi byed ces bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa bzhin du mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gog pa yang mngon sum du mi byed ces bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa bzhin du mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And he does not actualize cessation means that he does not actualize cessation as do the nonreturners and arhats.

original: rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pas dpyad du med pa'i tshig dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i tshul gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i chos bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni rigs pas dpyad du med pa'i tshig dang / thabs la mkhas pa'i tshul gyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inconceivable Dharma of marvels refers to the inexpressible words and the method of skill in means.

original: de'i phyir mdo las gru bo che'i dpes bstan pas ji skad bstan pa'i thabs kyi ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrubs ba la brten nas /üîΩmdo las gsungs pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu po 'jig rten ba'i spyod pa ltar snang yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du mdor bsdus pa'i don rnam pa
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las gru bo che'i dpes bstan pas ji skad bstan pa'i thabs kyi ye shes kyis mngon par bsgrubs ba la brten nas / mdo las gsungs pa'i sems can thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa rnam pa bcu po 'jig rten ba'i spyod pa ltar snang yang de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni mdo ji lta ba bzhin du mdor bsdus pa'i don rnam pa
translated: Therefore, the sutra teaches by means of the analogy of the great ship, and on the basis of the realization of the knowledge of method as taught,üîΩthe ten kinds of bodhisattva conduct that are not shared in common with all sentient beings are taught in the sutra.

original: bcu bstan te /
analyzed: bcu bstan te /
translated: The ten kinds of conduct are taught in brief in the sutra, and their meaning is explained in the commentary.

original: tshig dang yi ge ni mdo nas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge ni mdo nas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The words and letters are to be taken from the sutra.

original: don 'di bstan to zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don 'di bstan to zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach this meaning,

original: 'khor ba'i sgo yang ston la //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sgo yang ston la //
translated: he shows the door of cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la yang gnas pa yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: and he also abides in nirvana.

original: bsod nams bya ba las brtsams pa dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba las brtsams pa dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is taught by the words ‚Äúbeginning with meritorious action.‚Äù

original: 'khor ban rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi las kyang byed la /
analyzed: 'khor ban rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'i bsod nams kyi las kyang byed la /
translated: He performs meritorious action that accomplishes the fully ripened effect of cyclic existence,

original: de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i bsam pa yang mi gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang mya ngan las 'das par gtogs pa'i bsam pa yang mi gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and yet he does not abandon the intention that is included in nirvana.

original: 'khor mang pos kun nas bskor bar yang snang la /
analyzed: 'khor mang pos kun nas bskor bar yang snang la /
translated: He appears to be surrounded by a great retinue,

original: rtag pa rgyun du shin tu dben pa'i sems thob pa yang yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don ni /
analyzed: rtag pa rgyun du shin tu dben pa'i sems thob pa yang yin zhes bya ba'i mdo'i don ni /
translated: and he also obtains a mind that is always and continuously isolated.

original: chung ma dang 'khor yongs su 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: chung ma dang 'khor yongs su 'dzin pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of this sutra passage is taught by the words ‚Äúhe takes a wife and retinue.‚Äù

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba yang mngon par sgrub la /
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis khams gsum du skye ba yang mngon par sgrub la /
translated: By the power of his vow, he manifests birth in the three realms.

original: 'jig rten gyi nyes pas kyang mi gos pa yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi nyes pas kyang mi gos pa yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: And he is not defiled by the faults of the world.üîΩThe meaning of this is taught by the line: ‚ÄúHe has begun the perfect practice of the special attainment.‚Äù

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i khyad par 'dod pa yang dag par brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba yin no zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba yang yin la /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i khyad par 'dod pa yang dag par brtsams pa dang zhes bya ba yin no zhi zhing rab tu zhi ba yang yin la /
translated: He is peaceful and completely peaceful,üîΩand yet he is also burning with the fire of passion.

original: thabs kyis @295b kyang rab tu 'bar te 'bar yang 'tshig par mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: thabs kyis @295b kyang rab tu 'bar te 'bar yang 'tshig par mi 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: He is burning, and yet he is not burned.

original: rnam par thar pa gsum la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gsum la gnas pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is taught by the line: ‚ÄúHe is established in the three liberations.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la yang 'jug la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ye shes la yang 'jug la /
translated: He enters into the wisdom of the buddhas,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las kyang ldog pa yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sa las kyang ldog pa yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: and yet he turns away from the levels of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: theg pa dman pa la mos pa thabs kyis 'dul ba dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: theg pa dman pa la mos pa thabs kyis 'dul ba dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is taught by the line: ‚ÄúHe tames through skillful means those who are devoted to the lesser vehicles.‚Äù

original: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mdzod du yang son la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yul gyi mdzod du yang son la /
translated: He has reached the treasury of the domain of the buddhas,üîΩand yet he is not separated from the realm of the mƒÅras.

original: bdud kyi yul na 'dug par snang ba yang yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi yul na 'dug par snang ba yang yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúappears to be in the domain of Mara‚Äù is

original: 'dod pa yongs su spyad pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩbdud bzhi'i yul las kyang yang dag par 'das la /
analyzed: 'dod pa yongs su spyad pa dang zhes bya ba yin no // bdud bzhi'i yul las kyang yang dag par 'das la /
translated: ‚Äúenjoying desires.‚ÄùüîΩThe meaning of ‚Äúhas transcended the domain of the four Maras

original: bdud kyi spyod yul yang ston pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: bdud kyi spyod yul yang ston pa yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: and yet manifests the domain of Mara‚Äù is

original: 'dod pa'i khyad par don du gnyer ba dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khyad par don du gnyer ba dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äúseeking the special objects of desire.‚Äù

original: mu stegs kyi gnas thams cad na yang 'dug par snang la /
analyzed: mu stegs kyi gnas thams cad na yang 'dug par snang la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúappears to be in all the abodes of the heterodox

original: sangs rgyas kyi mu stegs kyi gnas mi 'dor ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yang yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mu stegs kyi gnas mi 'dor ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa yang yin zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: and yet has the intention of not abandoning the abode of the Buddha‚Äù is

original: mu stegs can bzlog pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can bzlog pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúrebuking the heterodox.‚Äù

original: 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad dang ldan par yang snang la /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bya ba thams cad dang ldan par yang snang la /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúappears to be engaged in all worldly activitiesüîΩand yet is dedicated to the transcendent Dharma‚Äù is

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul la yang dag par gzhol ba yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos kyi tshul la yang dag par gzhol ba yin zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa ni /
translated: ‚Äúnot abandoning worldly activities.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: and to engage in accordance with the minds of others.

original: lha dang / klu dang / gnod spyin dang zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: lha dang / klu dang / gnod spyin dang zhes bya ba nas /
translated: gods, nƒÅgas, yak·π£as, and so on,

original: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad las lhag pa'i bkod pa rnam par sgrub pa yang thob la /
analyzed: tshangs pa dang / 'jig rten skyong ba thams cad las lhag pa'i bkod pa rnam par sgrub pa yang thob la /
translated: up to and including all BrahmƒÅs and world guardians, and also to attain the accomplishment of a display that surpasses all of them,

original: chos la dga' ba'i yid la byed pa yang mi spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don ni /
analyzed: chos la dga' ba'i yid la byed pa yang mi spong ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don ni /
translated: but also to not abandon the mental activity of delighting in the Dharma.

original: skye bo'i tshogs chen po dang mthun par 'jug pa las brtsams pa'o zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo'i tshogs chen po dang mthun par 'jug pa las brtsams pa'o zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is taught by the phrase ‚Äústarting from engaging in accordance with a great multitude of beings.‚Äù

original: dpe'i khyad par ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe'i khyad par ni mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //
translated: The specific examples should be understood in accordance with the s≈´tras.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag bas rnam pa thams cad kyis mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dag bas rnam pa thams cad kyis mkhas pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are more learned than the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas in every way,

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa sgrub pa la mkhas pa dang zhes brjod do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi mngon par rtogs pa sgrub pa la mkhas pa dang zhes brjod do //
translated: they are called ‚Äúthose who are skilled in accomplishing the clear knowledge of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa mthar thug par gyur pas ring du song ba'i phyir ring du song ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pas bstan pa dang zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa mthar thug par gyur pas ring du song ba'i phyir ring du song ba zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The stage of Gone Afar is taught as the stage of Gone Afar because the practice that has arisen from preparation has gone far by becoming ultimate.üîΩThe stage of Immovability is taught as the stage of Immovability because it is immovable by the practice of the signs of the two.

original: 'bad pa dang bcas pa mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa'o /üîΩ// / chos thams cad kyi don dam pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa ni @296a * //
analyzed: 'bad pa dang bcas pa mtshan ma med pa'i gnas pa'o / // / chos thams cad kyi don dam pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa ni @296a * //
translated: The stage of Excellent Intelligence is taught as the stage of Excellent Intelligence because it is the stage of excellent intelligence that is, the stage of the excellent intelligence of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe stage of Cloud of Dharma is taught as the stage of Cloud of Dharma because it is the stage of the cloud of Dharma that is, the stage of the cloud of the Dharma of the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe stage of the tathagatas is taught as the stage of the tathagatas because it is the stage of the tathagatas.

original: bcu yin pas don dam pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bcu yin pas don dam pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes kyi rnam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the knowledge that penetrates the ultimate of all phenomena are called the aspects of the knowledge that penetrates the ultimate.

original: de'i don rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de'i don rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa ni /
translated: The teaching of the presentation of its meaning is

original: dus gsum du ci rigs par zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dus gsum du ci rigs par zhes bya ba'o //
translated: in the three times, as is appropriate.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la rnam par 'byed pa shin tu byas pas zhes bya ba nas ;
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag byang chub sems dpa'i sa bdun po dag la rnam par 'byed pa shin tu byas pas zhes bya ba nas ;
translated: O sons of the Victor, on the seven bodhisattva stages, through thorough analysis,

original: ye shes kyi lam tshad med pa dang ldan pa de chos thams cad gzod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug go //üîΩma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa nyid dang / mtshan nyid med pa nyid dang / 'byung ba med pa nyid dang / 'jig pa med pa nyid dang / thug pa med pa nyid dang / 'jug pa med pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang /üîΩthog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha mar mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs par bya ba nyid las brtsams nas 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa la /
analyzed: ye shes kyi lam tshad med pa dang ldan pa de chos thams cad gzod ma nas skye ba med pa nyid la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug go // ma byung ba dang / ma skyes pa nyid dang / mtshan nyid med pa nyid dang / 'byung ba med pa nyid dang / 'jig pa med pa nyid dang / thug pa med pa nyid dang / 'jug pa med pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / thog ma dang / bar ma dang / tha mar mnyam pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs par bya ba nyid las brtsams nas 'jug go zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa la /
translated: Endowed with the immeasurable path of wisdom, he penetrates the non-arising of all dharmas just as it is.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nye bar bzung nas ni gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nye bar bzung nas ni gzod ma nas ma byung ba nyid ni rnam par byang ba'i phyogs so //
translated: He penetrates the non-arising, non-production, signlessness, non-occurrence, non-destruction, non-stopping, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non-purification, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non-purification, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non-purification, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non-purification, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non-purification, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non-purification, non-defilement, non-purification, non-existence, non-apprehension, non-accomplishment, non-coming, non-going, non-appearance, non-disappearance, non-grasping, non-relinquishment, non-affliction, non

original: ma skyes pa nyid ni 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa nyid ni 'das pa'i dus la ltos pa'o //
translated: Non-arising is dependent on the past time.

original: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni da ltar gyi dus la ltos nas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa ni da ltar gyi dus la ltos nas so //
translated: Abiding in the signless is dependent on the present time.

original: 'byung ba med pa nyid kyis 'jig pa med pa nyid ni ldog pa med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa nyid kyis 'jig pa med pa nyid ni ldog pa med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Non-occurrence through non-arising is non-cessation.

original: dus gsum du yang don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzod ma nas rang bzhin nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dus gsum du yang don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gzod ma nas rang bzhin nyid kyis ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the ultimate nature is primordially unarisen by its very nature in the three times,

original: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa nyid de /
translated: it is primordially unarisen.

original: de nyid ni ma skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni ma skyes pa nyid do //
translated: That itself is non-arising.

original: de nyid ni byis pa'i skye bos btags pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni byis pa'i skye bos btags pa'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: That itself is free from the characteristics of the aspects imputed by childish beings.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu'i dngos po las ma byung bas na 'byung ba med pa nyid dang / brjod ba med par snang ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang rgyu'i dngos por med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa med pas 'jug pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rgyu'i dngos po las ma byung bas na 'byung ba med pa nyid dang / brjod ba med par snang ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang rgyu'i dngos por med pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid du 'jug pa med pas 'jug pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Since it does not arise from a cause other than that, it is non-occurrence, and since it is the nature of inexpressible appearance, it is without characteristics and causal entities, and since it does not engage in the nature of affliction, it is non-engagement.

original: de nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa med pas ldog pa yang med pa las brtsams pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa las ldog pa med pas ldog pa yang med pa las brtsams pa nyid do //
translated: Since there is no turning away from the afflictions in that very [mind], it is also beginningless.

original: yod pa'i dngos po brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma shes pas de nyid la mi bden pa'i mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i dngos po brjod du med pa'i ngo bo nyid ma shes pas de nyid la mi bden pa'i mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is the non-understanding of the inexpressible nature of existent things, and the clinging to them as unreal.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya bas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya bas dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it arises from that cause, it is taught to have the nature of non-existence.

original: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang bar dang tha ma zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Beginning, middle, and end means at all times.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa dang ldan pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa dang ldan pa med pa nyid do //
translated: There is no engagement with the afflictions in that [mind].

original: de bzhin nyid kyi @296b phyir rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa dang / spyi'i dus na yang de bzhin nyid la yang dag par 'jug pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi @296b phyir rnam par mi rtog pa la 'jug pa dang / spyi'i dus na yang de bzhin nyid la yang dag par 'jug pa ni mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: Because of suchness, there is the engagement in non-conceptuality, and the correct engagement in suchness at all times is equality.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa mnyam pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa mnyam pa nyid ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'jug pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The equality of the afflictions is when the afflictions are engaged.

original: 'di la gnas pa ni zhes bya ba ni gnas pa brgyad pa la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la gnas pa ni zhes bya ba ni gnas pa brgyad pa la gnas pa'o //
translated: Here, abiding refers to abiding in the eighth stage.

original: mchog nyid ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchog nyid ni shin tu rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The supreme is called extremely pure.

original: bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the essence of patience,

original: de yang gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, What is the patience of a bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva?

original: yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhis ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi mngon par zhen ba thams cad bsal nas bdag gi dngos pos bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba rnam pa bzhis ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa na yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad kyi mngon par zhen ba thams cad bsal nas bdag gi dngos pos bsdus pa'i chos thams cad kun nas nyon mongs
translated: When one knows reality through the four kinds of thorough searching, and having eliminated all clinging to all unreal conceptual thoughts, one has patience with the non-arising of all phenomena included in one's own and others' entities, and is in accord with the non-arising of afflictions,

original: pa mi skye ba dang rjes su mthun par bzod pa gang gis mthong ba de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa mi skye ba dang rjes su mthun par bzod pa gang gis mthong ba de ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: that is called the patience of the non-arising of phenomena.

original: 'das pa'i skye bar rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung pa rnams dang / de'i rgyu can gyi 'du byed rnams phyi ma la yang mi skye bar yang dag par mthong ngo /
analyzed: 'das pa'i skye bar rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i rgyu las byung pa rnams dang / de'i rgyu can gyi 'du byed rnams phyi ma la yang mi skye bar yang dag par mthong ngo /
translated: They see that the causes of the past, which are the concepts that arise from the causes of the past, do not give rise to the formations that are their effects in the future.

original: de'i phyir bzod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bzod pa ni mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, patience is the patience with respect to phenomena that are not produced.

original: de rnam par dag pas bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de dag mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yan chad ces bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩskye ba med pa'i chos kyi rnam par dag par gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de bzod pa thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnam par dag pas bsgom pa'i rab kyi mthar thug par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir de dag mos pas spyod pa la gnas pa yan chad ces bya ba la sogs pa la / skye ba med pa'i chos kyi rnam par dag par gyur ba'i shes rab gang yin pa de bzod pa thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that through its purification, the culmination of meditation is reached, it is said, ‚ÄúFrom the stage of devoted engagement onward‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gnas pa zab mo thob pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gnas pa zab mo thob pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to teach that the wisdom that is the purification of the phenomena that are not produced is the attainment of patience, it is said, ‚ÄúThey attain the profound stage of abiding.‚Äù

original: 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: 'di'i mdo'i tshig ni /
translated: The words of the sutra are as follows:

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa zab mo shes par dka' ba thob pa yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag de la bzod pa de lta bu dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba thob ma thag tu byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa zab mo shes par dka' ba thob pa yin no zhes bya ba
translated: O children of the Victor, the bodhisattva who has such patience, as soon as he attains the bodhisattva stage Immovable, attains the profound bodhisattva way of life that is difficult to know.

original: la / shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: la / shes par dka' ba zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig bstan pa ni /
translated: The words of the Sutra on What is Difficult to Know are taught:

original: gnas pa zab mo thob pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe dang bcas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa zab mo thob pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe dang bcas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: He attains the profound way of life.

original: bzod pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzod pa rnam par dag pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the cause of pure patience,

original: skyon rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag kyang spangs pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyon rnam pa bzhi po gang yin pa de dag kyang spangs pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he also abandons the four faults.üîΩHe also abandons the manifest effort that is a formative force.

original: rtsol ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de yang spangs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /
analyzed: rtsol ba'i mngon par 'du byed pa gang yin pa de yang spangs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /
translated: In a sutra it is said:

original: 'bad pa thams cad dang bral te lhun gyis grub pa'i chos nyid thob cing zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no //üîΩsnying las su gyur pa yang @297a * //
analyzed: 'bad pa thams cad dang bral te lhun gyis grub pa'i chos nyid thob cing zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bstan pa yin no // snying las su gyur pa yang @297a * //
translated: The passage from ‚Äúhe attains the dharmatƒÅ free from all effort‚Äù up to ‚Äúhe attains the dharmatƒÅ free from all effort‚Äù teaches this.

original: spangs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /
analyzed: spangs pa yin zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has also abandoned the pliable mind‚Äù is from a s≈´tra.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsol ba dang bral nas zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩ'du shes phra mo kun du 'byung ba yang spangs pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyi rtsol ba dang bral nas zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'du shes phra mo kun du 'byung ba yang spangs pa yin te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The s≈´tra says, ‚Äúfree from the exertion of body, speech, and mind.‚Äù

original: mdo las gang yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: mdo las gang yang gsungs pa /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe has also abandoned the arising of subtle discriminations‚Äù is from a s≈´tra.

original: rtsol ba thams cad dang bral ba'i rnam par smin pa'i chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba nas 'jig rten pa'i kun du 'byung ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
analyzed: rtsol ba thams cad dang bral ba'i rnam par smin pa'i chos la gnas pa zhes bya ba nas 'jig rten pa'i kun du 'byung ba rnams lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba'i bar gyis so //
translated: The s≈´tra says, ‚Äúhe abides in the dharmas of complete maturation free from all exertion‚Äù up to ‚Äúwhat need is there to mention the mundane arising?‚Äù

original: zab mo'i gnas pa de la mngon par dga' ba de'i chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la de bzhin gshegs pas bskul ba dang zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
analyzed: zab mo'i gnas pa de la mngon par dga' ba de'i chos kyi sgo'i rgyun de la de bzhin gshegs pas bskul ba dang zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe TathƒÅgata encourages him in that stream of the Dharma door‚Äù is from a s≈´tra.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba 'di la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa'i sa mi g-yo ba 'di la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Thus, on this Bodhisattva stage called ‚ÄúImmovable‚Äù he is born in the Buddha family, and is born in the family of the Tathagatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub par mdzad de zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes nye bar sgrub par mdzad de zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: He is born in the family of the Tathagatas, and is born in the family of the Tathagatas.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
translated: The Sutra on ‚ÄúApproaching and Entering‚Äù says:

original: rigs kyi bu legs so legs so zhes bya ba nas /üîΩsangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo tshad med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu legs so legs so zhes bya ba nas / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ye shes mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo tshad med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúGood son! Good son!‚ÄùüîΩThese Bhagavat Buddhas cause him to attain the immeasurable doors of the knowledge of the Buddhas.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo dang zhes bya ba ni ye shes rnam par phye ba tshad med pas mngon par bsgrub pa'i las rnams mngon par bsgrub par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo dang zhes bya ba ni ye shes rnam par phye ba tshad med pas mngon par bsgrub pa'i las rnams mngon par bsgrub par mdzad do zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa yin no //
translated: The ‚Äúdoors of the knowledge of the Buddhas‚Äù are the immeasurable divisions of knowledge. They are the doors of the knowledge of the Buddhas because they are the means of attaining the knowledge of the Buddhas.

original: ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i las dpag tu med pa nye bar bsgrub pa ste zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
analyzed: ye shes dang mngon par shes pa'i las dpag tu med pa nye bar bsgrub pa ste zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
translated: The Sutra on ‚ÄúApproaching and Entering‚Äù says:

original: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúIf these Bhagavat Buddhas do not cause him to attain the immeasurable knowledge of the Buddhas, then he will not be able to attain the immeasurable knowledge of the Buddhas.‚Äù

original: sngon chad ni lus gcig gis mngon par bsgrub pas spyod pa mngon par bsgrub par gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //üîΩde ltar bskul bas lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: sngon chad ni lus gcig gis mngon par bsgrub pas spyod pa mngon par bsgrub par gyur gyi zhes bya ba'i bar yin no // de ltar bskul bas lus rnam par dbye ba shes pa tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub pa dang zhes bya ba ni sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Previously, he accomplished conduct by manifesting in one body.üîΩThus, by being urged, he accomplishes immeasurable knowledge of the differentiation of bodies.

original: gzugs kyis lus gsal bar byed pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyis lus gsal bar byed pa nyid kyang rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar gyi don yin no //
translated: The meaning is that the bodhisattva who abides on this ground, up to he knows the manifestation of bodies by form.üîΩHe also attains the ten masteries.

original: dbang bcu yang thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
analyzed: dbang bcu yang thob par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i mdo ni /
translated: The s≈´tra says,

original: des lus dang shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa de lta bu 'dod pas zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: des lus dang shes pa mngon par bsgrub pa de lta bu 'dod pas zhes bya ba nas /
translated: ‚ÄúHe desires that accomplishment of body and knowledge, up to

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa kun tu ston pas ye shes la dbang thob po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bcu las bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dang / mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang / mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa kun tu ston pas ye shes la dbang thob po zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bcu las bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: and the ten powers, four fearlessnesses, four kinds of exact knowledge, eighteen exclusive qualities, major and minor marks, and complete enlightenment.

original: dbang bcu'i bsdus pa'i don bstan @297b pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang bcu'i bsdus pa'i don bstan @297b pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the ten masteries is shown.

original: dbang thob pa de ni ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩtshe la dbang ba ni bskal pa du mar yang gnas par nus pa dang ldan dbang ba ni bskal pa du mar yang gnas par nus pa dang ldan sems la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: dbang thob pa de ni ji srid du 'dod pa de srid du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / tshe la dbang ba ni bskal pa du mar yang gnas par nus pa dang ldan dbang ba ni bskal pa du mar yang gnas par nus pa dang ldan sems la dbang ba ste /
translated: The one who has attained mastery can remain for as long as he wishes.üîΩThe mastery of life is the ability to remain for many eons.

original: dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mastery of mind is the ability to enter countless concentrations.

original: bsam pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yo byad la dbang ba bstan te /
analyzed: bsam pa tsam gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni yo byad la dbang ba bstan te /
translated: The mastery of necessities is shown by the mere wish, etc.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bkod pa du ma'i rgyan rnam par bkod pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbzo dang las kyi gnas thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du bkod pa du ma'i rgyan rnam par bkod pa yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro // bzo dang las kyi gnas thams cad la zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: Because he manifests the array of many adornments in all world systems.

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la yang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni las la dbang ba bstan te /
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad la yang zhes bya ba'i bar gyis ni las la dbang ba bstan te /
translated: With the words ‚Äúin all crafts and occupations‚Äù up to ‚Äúin all places of birth,‚Äù he teaches mastery of action.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin las kyi bya ba dang / rnam par smin pa gnas par yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin las kyi bya ba dang / rnam par smin pa gnas par yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he manifests the performance of actions and the ripening of their results just as he wishes.

original: skye ba'i gnas thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad byed pa ni skye ba la dbang thob pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas thams cad du ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye bar 'gyur ba'i las thams cad byed pa ni skye ba la dbang thob pa'o //
translated: The performance of all actions that lead to birth wherever one wishes is the attainment of mastery over birth.

original: dngos po gang dang gang la ji ltar mos pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mos pa la dbang ba bstan te /
analyzed: dngos po gang dang gang la ji ltar mos pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mos pa la dbang ba bstan te /
translated: With the words ‚Äúin whatever things and in whatever way he conceives them,‚Äù he teaches mastery of resolve.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rab tu gang bar yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis rab tu gang bar yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he manifests all world-realms as completely filled with Bhagavat Buddhas.

original: smon lam gyi mngon par shes pas sprul pa nyid ni smon lam la dbang ba yin te /
analyzed: smon lam gyi mngon par shes pas sprul pa nyid ni smon lam la dbang ba yin te /
translated: The superknowledge of vow is emanation, because it is mastery of vow.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su mngon par byang chub pa'i dus yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnams su mngon par byang chub pa'i dus yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he manifests the time of perfect enlightenment in the Buddha-fields as he wishes.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba thams cad kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byed do zhes bya bas ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba thams cad kyang ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du byed do zhes bya bas ni rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: And he performs all miracles as he wishes. This shows the mastery of miracle.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi yon tan yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi yon tan yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he manifests the virtues of all Buddha-fields.

original: shes bya gang shes par 'dod pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ye shes la dbang ba bstan te /
analyzed: shes bya gang shes par 'dod pa de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ye shes la dbang ba bstan te /
translated: Whatever he wishes to know, that he knows. This shows the mastery of knowledge.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mngon par byang chub pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mngon par byang chub pa ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he manifests the perfect enlightenment and fearlessness of the Tathagata.

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la dbang ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos la dbang ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthe collection of names, the collection of words‚Äù teaches mastery of phenomena.

original: chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa la yang mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad yang dag par rnam par gzhag pa la yang mkhas pa ste /
translated: He is also skilled in the correct arrangement of all phenomena,

original: mtha' dang dbus med par chos kyi sgo'i snang ba yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang thob pas byas pa'i phan yon bstan pa ni /

translated: ‚ÄúWhat is defilement and purification?‚ÄùüîΩThe thicket of the cause of devotion is stated in a sutra.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa las phyin ci log gi mos pa dang / yang dag pa'i mos pa rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa las phyin ci log gi mos pa dang / yang dag pa'i mos pa rnam par gzhag go /
translated: The classification of the afflicted and the unafflicted is established as the misapprehension of the object and the correct apprehension of the object.

original: gcig tu ma nges pa gang pa ni de'i phyir mdo las khams kyi /
analyzed: gcig tu ma nges pa gang pa ni de'i phyir mdo las khams kyi /
translated: The indeterminate is so called because the S≈´tra says:

analyzed: rgyu'i thibs po dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal gyi rgyu ba'i thibs po dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe thicket of the cause of the realm, the thicket of the cause of the intention, and the thicket of the cause of the latent propensities.‚Äù

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams can dang / mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i khams can gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa and the realm of non-nirvƒÅ·πáa.

analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba gcig pu nyid de zhes bya ba ni gang yang mdo las /

analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu ba'i thibs po dang bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba'i rgyu ba'i thibs po dang zhes bya ba yin te /

original: rnam par byang ba la gcig tu nges pa nyid do ;
analyzed: rnam par byang ba la gcig tu nges pa nyid do ;
translated: The pure is so called because it is definitely single.

original: / phung po gsum du rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu'i thibs po ni gcig tu nges pa dang gcig tu ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: / phung po gsum du rnam par gnas pa'i rgyu'i thibs po ni gcig tu nges pa dang gcig tu ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The thicket of causes that is threefold is both definite and indefinite.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni re re la yang bcu bcur mdo nas sa bstan to //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni re re la yang bcu bcur mdo nas sa bstan to //
translated: Each of these ten is taught in the sutra as ten stages.

original: de ltar chos bstan pa la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /
analyzed: de ltar chos bstan pa la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ni /

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa legs pa'i blo gros can 'di la gnas pa'i zhes bya ba nas /

analyzed: bstan pa'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang zhes bya ba 'di'i mdo ni /
translated: The sutra passage on skill in the activity of teaching is:üîΩHaving known thus...

analyzed: des de ltar shes nas zhes bya ba nas brtsams te tshig so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi mngon par bsgrubs pas chos ston te zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: 'di dag ni yang sngar bstan pa mdor bsdus pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rig par bya'o //

original: de'i phyir mdo las /
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo las /

analyzed: de ni chos smra ba chen po nyid byed cing zhes bya ba nas ;
