analyzed: bstan la so so yang dag par rig pa ni phyis bstan to //

analyzed: bskal pa 'bum du gzung ba'i byin gyi rlabs kyis de ltar mi zin to zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //

analyzed: 'di'i mdo ni /

analyzed: de'i rjes la yang dag par len /

analyzed: bdag gir byed /

analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin to //

analyzed: de'i phyir sa 'di chos kyi sprin zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du yin no //

original: mngon par shes pa chen po mngon par sgrub pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam par dag pa dang / skye ba dang mthu'i khyad par las gnas pa mchog mdor bstan par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba la /

translated: The summary of the supreme abode through the distinctions of rebirth and power should be understood as the accomplishment of the great superknowledges, the purification of the roots of virtue, and the summary of the supreme abode through the distinctions of rebirth and power.

original: 'di dag gnyi ga'i mdo ni de'i rjes thogs la mdo rdzogs pa'i bar gyis bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gnyi ga'i mdo ni de'i rjes thogs la mdo rdzogs pa'i bar gyis bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: The summary of both of these should be understood as taught by the sutra up to the completion of the sutra immediately following.

original: sa dgur byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa 'di sa bcu pa yongs su sbyor bar byed pa'i chos rnams ni byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: sa dgur byang chub sems dpa'i lam yongs su rdzogs par byas pa 'di sa bcu pa yongs su sbyor bar byed pa'i chos rnams ni byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Having perfected the bodhisattva path on the nine stages, these dharmas that prepare for the tenth stage are what perfect the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: sa'i nges tshig bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sa'i nges tshig bstan pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the etymology of the stages is as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa nas /
translated: From the Tathagatas... and so on up to...

original: de lta bas na sa de chos kyi sprin zhes bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar du'o /üîΩgnas pa dang gnas pa la 'jug pa'i chos bstan pa rnams ni gnas pa snga ma rnams la yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na sa de chos kyi sprin zhes bya ste zhes bya ba'i bar du'o / gnas pa dang gnas pa la 'jug pa'i chos bstan pa rnams ni gnas pa snga ma rnams la yang yod mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, this stage is called Cloud of Dharma.

original: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyi khyad par yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid kyi khyad par yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The teachings on abiding and entering abiding exist in the earlier stages, but they are taught to have small, medium, and great differences.

original: gnas pa gong ma gong ma rnams su yan lag gang dag bstan pa de dag gi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnas pa gong ma gong ma rnams su yan lag gang dag bstan pa de dag gi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To demonstrate this, the text says, ‚ÄúThe branches taught in the higher stages of abiding‚Äù and so on.

original: chos bcu po 'di dag sa 'di la rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan pa'i chos rnams ni rten gyis snga ma rnams la yang yod kyang chung ba'i phyir chos 'di'i grangs su mi chud pas gong mar rnam par mi gzhag go //
analyzed: chos bcu po 'di dag sa 'di la rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bas bstan pa'i chos rnams ni rten gyis snga ma rnams la yang yod kyang chung ba'i phyir chos 'di'i grangs su mi chud pas gong mar rnam par mi gzhag go //
translated: The ten dharmas should be established in this stage. The teachings that are taught do exist in the earlier supports, but because they are small, they are not included in the enumeration of these dharmas and are not established in the higher stages.

original: des na bdag gis de dag sa gong ma thob pas chen por gyur pa de'i tshe de'i chos khyad par can du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: des na bdag gis de dag sa gong ma thob pas chen por gyur pa de'i tshe de'i chos khyad par can du rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when I attain the higher stages, they become great and at that time they are established as special dharmas.

original: gnas pa 'di dag ni dus chen pos yongs su 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas pa 'di dag ni dus chen pos yongs su 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: These stages are taught to be accomplished by a great eon.

original: de la gnas pa re re yang bskal pa chen po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa re re yang bskal pa chen po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Each stage is called a great eon.

original: thams cad kyis thob pa'i dus kyi tshad nges par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: thams cad kyis thob pa'i dus kyi tshad nges par bstan pa ni /
translated: The measure of time for attaining all is taught.

original: bskal chen po grangs med pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni brtson 'grus 'bar ba rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas pas ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas grangs med pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bskal chen po grangs med pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni brtson 'grus 'bar ba rgyun mi 'chad par dge ba'i rtsa ba la gnas pas ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa nas grangs med pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Three great eons is taught for those who are diligent, uninterrupted, and abide in the roots of virtue, from the stage of practice through faith.

original: de yang rtag tu 'bad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de yang rtag tu 'bad pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: And that is always with effort, etc.

original: 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni myur du zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'bad pa zhes bya ba ni myur du zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: Effort means quickly.

original: grangs med pa @300b gnyis pas ni mtshan ma med pa gnyis pa'i gnas pa thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med pa @300b gnyis pas ni mtshan ma med pa gnyis pa'i gnas pa thob po zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the second countless eon, the second stage of signlessness is attained.

original: de la ni bskal pa grangs med pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyang 'dra bar bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de la ni bskal pa grangs med pa rnam par gzhag pa thams cad kyang 'dra bar bstan pa ni /
translated: There, all the presentations of countless eons are taught to be similar.

original: de ni nges pa kho na ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni nges pa kho na ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is certain.

original: bsam pa dag pa rnams la brtson 'grus rtsom pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa rnams la brtson 'grus rtsom pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no distinction in the exertion of striving for those with pure intention.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de ni nges par 'bad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni nges par 'bad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Because of the certainty of exertion.

original: gsum zhes bya ba dang / grangs med pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: gsum zhes bya ba dang / grangs med pa zhes bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: How is it three and how is it countless?üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / de la bskal pa grangs med pa ni gnyis su rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar / de la bskal pa grangs med pa ni gnyis su rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therein, the countless eons should be known as twofold.

original: rnam pa gnyis kyis bskal pa chen po la grangs med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kyis bskal pa chen po la grangs med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: By two aspects, a great eon is called countless.

original: nyin zhag la sogs pa bgrang ba'i lam las 'das pas bskal pa gcig la yang grangs med pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyin zhag la sogs pa bgrang ba'i lam las 'das pas bskal pa gcig la yang grangs med pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because it transcends the path of enumeration such as days and so on, even a single eon is called countless.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: nyin mtshan dang zla ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bgrang bar mi nus pas na grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyin mtshan dang zla ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bgrang bar mi nus pas na grangs med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it cannot be enumerated by day and night, months and so on, it is called countless.

original: bskal pa chen po ni grangs kyi gnas gzhan gyi khyad par grangs med pas bsdus pa'i phyir grangs med pa gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bskal pa chen po ni grangs kyi gnas gzhan gyi khyad par grangs med pas bsdus pa'i phyir grangs med pa gnyis pa zhes bya'o //
translated: A great eon is called a second incalculable because it is included in an incalculable number of other enumerations.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bgrang ba'i tshul gyis bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bgrang ba'i tshul gyis bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: It is beyond all enumeration by any method of enumeration.

original: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis grangs med pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: yang de ni rnam pa gnyis kyis grangs med pa zhes brjod de /
translated: Moreover, it is called incalculable in two ways:

original: tha mal pa'i grangs las 'das pa'i phyir ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: tha mal pa'i grangs las 'das pa'i phyir ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: It is beyond ordinary enumeration because it is said:

original: bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ste /üîΩde'i ming gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgrang ba thams cad las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ste / de'i ming gis rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is beyond all enumeration.üîΩIt is beyond the enumeration of other names.

original: de lta bu'i grangs kyi gnas gzhan du phyin pa la yang bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i grangs kyi gnas gzhan du phyin pa la yang bya ste /
translated: It is also called incalculable because it is beyond other enumerations.üîΩIn the Sutra of Loose Jewels, it is said:

original: lhug par bstan pa'i mdo las 'don pa'i gnas gzhan drug cur phyin pa ni grang med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lhug par bstan pa'i mdo las 'don pa'i gnas gzhan drug cur phyin pa ni grang med pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The attainment of sixty other enumerations is called incalculable.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: phyi ma shos kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi dbang du byas nas grangs med pa gsum zhes bstan pa de ni phyi ma shos kyi yin no //
analyzed: phyi ma shos kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang gi dbang du byas nas grangs med pa gsum zhes bstan pa de ni phyi ma shos kyi yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù excludes the possibility that the eon is longer than that.

original: lhag pas ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan gyi 'dod pa 'gog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pas ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni sde pa gzhan gyi 'dod pa 'gog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúnot‚Äù excludes the possibility that the eon is shorter than that.

original: 'gag zhig gis bskal pa 'ga' zhig 'dums par bya bar nus pa ni srid kyi bskal pa grangs med pa 'dums pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩsu brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po yang chen pos sbyor ba de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang yang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas bskal pa dgu 'dums @301a * //
analyzed: 'gag zhig gis bskal pa 'ga' zhig 'dums par bya bar nus pa ni srid kyi bskal pa grangs med pa 'dums pa ni 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / su brtson 'grus rtsom pa chen po yang chen pos sbyor ba de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la gang yang bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pas bskal pa dgu 'dums @301a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù indicates that it is impossible for anyone to reduce the incalculable eons to even a few eons.

original: so zhes 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: so zhes 'don pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúwhoever‚Äù indicates that the eon is not reduced for those who are not bodhisattvas.üîΩThe word ‚Äúgreat‚Äù indicates that the eon is not reduced for those who are not diligent.üîΩThe word ‚Äúgreat‚Äù indicates that the eon is not reduced for those who are not diligent.üîΩThe word ‚Äúgreat‚Äù indicates that the eon is not reduced for those who are not diligent.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas pa bcu gnyis po de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: These are the twelve bodhisattva abodes.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis kyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rim gyis spong bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa gnyis kyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len rim gyis spong bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the gradual abandonment of the negative tendencies that are the two obscurations of afflictive and knowledge,

original: de la gnas pa gsum po dag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la gnas pa gsum po dag la ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúAmong those, the three abodes . . .‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i dbye ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The afflictive obscurations of bodhisattvas are twofold:

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / sgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: those to be abandoned by the path of seeing and those to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la ste /
analyzed: de la mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni rab tu dga' ba'i gnas pa la ste /
translated: Among those, the afflictive obscurations to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned on the Joyous, the first bodhisattva ground.

original: bag la nyal dang mngon du rgyu dang bcas pa rab tu spong ngo //üîΩde'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bag la nyal dang mngon du rgyu dang bcas pa rab tu spong ngo // de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: The latent and manifest causes are completely abandoned.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du spong ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThey are abandoned completely and totally.‚Äù

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba la ni gzhi'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba la ni gzhi'i bye brag gis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The afflictive obscurations to be abandoned by the path of cultivation are threefold, based on their basis.

original: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu zhes bya'o//
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring dang / chung ngu zhes bya'o//
translated: they are called great, middling, and small.

original: sgom pas spang bar bya ba chen po'i mngon du rgyu ni sa la zhugs pa la med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgom pas spang bar bya ba chen po'i mngon du rgyu ni sa la zhugs pa la med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The great object to be abandoned by the path of cultivation does not exist for one who has entered the stages.

original: kun du spyod pa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúFrom the practice of the perfections, etc. ‚Äù The object to be abandoned is the nature.

original: chung ngu'i dbye ba yang kha cig ni gnas pa gnyis pa la gnyi ga ji ltar spong bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chung ngu'i dbye ba yang kha cig ni gnas pa gnyis pa la gnyi ga ji ltar spong bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The small object to be abandoned is also twofold. In order to demonstrate the abandonment of both of these in the second stage, he says,

original: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa lhun gyis grub pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn the effortless signless stage, etc. ‚Äù

original: gnas ngan len ni yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: gnas ngan len ni yongs su rgyas par byed pa'i sa bon no //
translated: The seeds that increase the negative reflex actions are the negative reflex actions.

original: bag la nyal ni sa bon phra ba'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal ni sa bon phra ba'o //
translated: The subtle seeds are the dormant tendencies.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi bag la nyal gyi sgrib pa thams cad spong bar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags kyi bag la nyal gyi sgrib pa thams cad spong bar rig par bya ste zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOne should understand that all the obscurations of the dormant tendencies of the instinct for misknowledge are abandoned. ‚Äù

original: gnas pa mchog las 'da' ba na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa mchog las 'da' ba na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning of ‚Äúwhen passing beyond the supreme state of abiding.‚Äù

original: de nyid bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni /
translated: That itself is taught:

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la 'jug pa'o zhes bya bas /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i gnas pa la 'jug pa'o zhes bya bas /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is also the entry into the abiding of the tathƒÅgatas.‚Äù

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i dbye ba bstan nas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba'i dbye ba bstan nas shes bya'i sgrib pa spong ba'i rab tu dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having taught the divisions of the abandonment of the afflictive obstructions, in order to teach the divisions of the abandonment of the obstructions to omniscience, it says,

original: rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúIt should be known as threefold.‚Äù
